The company has grown to over 3,000 global members and supports over 25 special interest groups they call teams, exploring XR industry verticals and niches. Over 60,000 participants have attended their thousands of free and paid events across multiple social VR platforms.

post.post_content: Co-founder and Director of Educators in VR, Lorelle is an educator, keynote, trainer, and passionate advocate for immersive technology. Considered an evangelist, she teaches dozens of workshops and classes annually focused on integrating immersive technology into schools, businesses, and life. Lorelle is an author and writer and expert on social media, web publishing, and VR education.

talk_description:
Co-founders of Educators in VR Lorelle VanFossen and Daniel Dyboski-Bryant share their extensive experience bringing people together in VR to explore and experience XR immersive education. They\'ve produced over 3,000 educational VR events, workshops, classes, and conferences, bringing a unique perceptive to the potential of XR education and VR events. 

Educators in VR was founded by Lorelle VanFossen and Daniel Dyboski-Bryant in 2018 with the mission to integrate XR immersive technology into education, training, research, and business. The company has grown to over 3,000 global members and supports over 25 special interest groups they call teams, exploring XR industry verticals and niches. Over 60,000 participants have attended their thousands of free and paid events across multiple social VR platforms.

post.post_content: Emilie is the CEO and Co-Founder of Zoe Immersive. Based in Los Angeles and Geneva, Switzerland, she oversees business strategy for the company, and was pivotal to establishing Zoe partnerships with Unity, Meta, Qualcomm, Epic Games, and others. Emilie is a Swiss designer & technologist at heart, specializing in human-computer interactions. Emilie’s ultimate goal is to empower the next generations to become creators in the metaverse.

I am an Instructional Media Specialist working at Chemeketa Community College in the Center for Academic Innovation on a faculty support team. I specialize in instructional media and work with faculty on content creation, use of technology and media, best practices and pedagogical use of media, media enabled classroom technology, and more. My former professional background was in video game development prior to working in higher education.

2763.title: Safety, Privacy, and Ethical Design in XR for Education

post.post_content: XR technologies are powerful tools with enormous potential to transform education. Yet these technologies also come with considerable risks. This panel will explore delve into philosophical and ethical issues surrounding the use of XR with young people and will address ways to ensure safety, privacy, and human dignity.
post.post_title: Safety, Privacy, and Ethical Design in XR for Education

post.post_content:
Dr. Karen Alexander is a sought-after consultant on building immersive learning programs with extensive connections across the XR industry and academia. Her experience spans partnering with community organizations on giving children and youth the opportunity to create with XR tools, guiding higher ed institutions through the process of XR adoption, advising ed tech and XR startups, and, in her role as an immersive learning consultant with MetaVRse, pioneering the translation of of 2D training into 3D experiences for enterprise. 

Dr. Alexander is a co-founder of XR Women, a worldwide network of professionals that meet weekly in virtual worlds and where a distinguished list of XR industry speakers has appeared. As part of the team that produces The Polys - WebXR Awards, WebXR Summit Series, and MetaTr@versal, she has worked with some of the most influential thought leaders in spatial computing. Bringing her passion for metaverse literacy back to her academic roots, Dr. Alexander is host of the WebXR Education Summit, assembling a diverse array of practitioners to share knowledge on successful implementation of immersive learning. She is also a member of the Immersive Learning Research Network’s State of XR and Immersive Learning Expert Panel. 

Prior to her work in XR, Dr. Alexander was Dean of Junior and Senior Year programs at the women’s college at Rutgers University and Senior Editor of Signs: Journal of Women and Culture in Society. Her experience in higher education ranges across teaching, program design, journal editing, and college administration, with specializations in art, literature, film, and cultural production. Dr. Alexander is committed to women’s advancement and gender and racial equality and believes in a Humanity First approach to XR and the metaverse. She holds master’s degrees in English, Philosophy, and Issues in Modern Culture and earned her PhD. at the University of London.
post.post_excerpt:
Karen is a Producer and Host of the
WebXR Summit Series
Co-Founder, XR Women and 
Advisor, XR Hall of Fame

post.post_content: Peta is an experienced teacher, researcher and award-winning digital designer specialising in immersive technologies. She designed Pangaea Minds, an educational framework using virtual worlds to connect schools for global team-teaching and student collaboration. Peta has recently led the design of VR and AR solutions for NSW Transport and the Music Performance Industry. Her research in Immersive Design at UNSW was a catalyst for her strong interest in ethics, regulation, and governance specific to the metaverse. She is the Director of XR Global Citizenship and Education at XRSI.org and is currently studying Cyber Law at Deakin University. As a classroom teacher, she is committed to empowering teachers, parents, and students in their understanding of the opportunities, challenges, and risks associated with belonging to virtual worlds and the metaverse. Peta is also winner of the 2021 Immersive Learning Research Network: Best Immersive Learning Project. Pangaea Minds is a truly innovative and global approach to equip students with the attitude and aptitude for conquering the serious economic, political, health, and climate challenges our current leaders are grappling with.

profile_title: Director of Operations; Director of XR Citizenship and Education
Director of Operations; Director of XR Citizenship and Education

post.post_content:
Rolando Masís-Obando is a PhD candidate of Computational Neuroscience at Princeton University. Scientifically, he is interested in how contexts (like those in VR/AR) shape the way we think and remember our day-to-day experiences. He has scanned dozens of people’s brains (and effectively read their minds) to further understand how the brain represents spaces and concepts. Given the intersection of AR/VR with neuroscience, Rolando’s recent interests revolve around how we can shape a future internet to be more human-centered and grounded under ethical principles. He recently directed a cinematic educational video on the history of the Metaverse and its ongoing issues with privacy and agency. The video can be found here: https://youtu.be/wsJF1ugsfKI

Rolando graduated from Yale University with a focus on Molecular, Cellular and Developmental Biology. During his studies co-founded Shuflix with his brothers, the largest activity search engine (at the time), to help people interact with their environment in a playful alternative way while helping small businesses get more exposure. Since then, he has also co-founded PhDx, a platform to help incoming PhD students with guides and insider knowledge of the unspoken rules in academia.

In his free time, Rolando is a filmmaker, composes for films, creates augmented reality tutorials for his YouTube channel, and does pro-bono marketing consulting for personal brands and small businesses.

3266.title: Teaching in Virtual Campuses and Classrooms

post.post_content: When the rules of time and physics don’t apply, you can teach anywhere at any moment in history and take the students with you. We’ll hear from teachers who are also world builders on what they’ve learned while teaching in VR.
post.post_title: Teaching in Virtual Campuses and Classrooms

post.post_content: Keith earned a Ph.D. in anthropology and used it to make a career introducing students to this field. After trying VR, he saw its potential in education and began making the VR museum AnVRopomotron to enhance the student experience. He continues to investigate ways that XR can enrich learning.
post.post_excerpt: Dr. Keith Chan received his Ph.D. in anthropology at the University of Missouri. He currently lives in San Diego, where he teaches biological anthropology in community colleges. Dr. Chan has always been interested in technology and finding new ways to use it in education, especially WebXR.

blurb: How does an educator with no VR experience make a virtual museum? Learn how the WebXR biological anthropology museum AnVRopomotron was built from the very basics of A-Frame and how some of the early stumbling blocks were overcome, including ways to fund the project.

MyMiniFactory-Scan the World myminifactory.com/scantheworld/

post.post_content:
Michael has worked in the educational sector for over twenty years and has taught at the primary, secondary, college, and university levels both domestically and internationally. He is currently working to motivate and facilitate college faculty in increasing digital literacy, exploring new practices, and investigating experiential and extended reality learning opportunities at the Teaching and Learning Exchange at George Brown College.

In addition, he is the president and founder of Tapvigo Solutions, an innovative communications solutions company. In his work, Michael has helped to create a groundbreaking virtual reality simulation on anti-racism called Let\'s Talk About Race.

profile_title: Faculty Facilitator & Educational Technology Coach | Founder & President
Faculty Facilitator & Educational Technology Coach | Founder & President
Faculty Facilitator & Educational Technology Coach | Founder & President

post.post_content: Andrew Wright is the director and Lead Education Consultant at iTeacher, Creator of the EDUmetaverse. With 25 years classroom experience he is an international speaker and innovations specialist, based in Sydney. For the last 8 months he has been building worlds and teaching in the Metaverse.

talk_description: Andrew Wright is the director and Lead Education Consultant at iTeacher, Creator of the EDUmetaverse. With 25 years classroom experience he is an international speaker and innovations specialist, based in Sydney. For the last 8 months he has been building worlds and teaching in the Metaverse.

post.post_content: Summit co-host Julie Smithson synthesizes the key takeaways from the WebXR Education Summit, making sense out of what we learned, and talks about building digital mindsets in organizations. That starts with how people need to continuously adapt to the evolving needs of their jobs in order to seize new opportunities.

Julie Smithson’s personal mission is to ‘inspire and educate people to think and act in a socially, economically and environmentally responsible way’.

It is through this lens as co-founder at MetaVRse, a 3D Web game engine for Business & XR development company.  Julie is leading enterprise companies to digitally transform and educate ways to immersive and remotely train users of the product/service. Julie guides her team to translate instructional language, interaction behaviors and curate knowledge testing gamification for businesses.  

Julie’s leadership is focused on transforming training & marketing into immersive experiences using technologies to design Web3 solutions, integration implementation and deployment to produce growth benefits, cost savings and human efficiencies.

Julie is also co-Chair of XRWomen.com , a global group of women who meet every Wednesday and learn about the applications of extended realities.  The group works to advocate, inspire and build communities aimed at inclusivity of gender equality, race and ethnicity in the digital sector and beyond.  

Julie is the host of the XR For Learning podcast. Julie also leads XR Collaboration, a coalition supporting human connectivity through digital presence in platforms building communication and collaboration.  Julie is also founder of XR Ignite to support the innovation and entrepreneurship of our communities. She also sits on panels and in leading conversations about interoperability standards and alignments with Khronos Group and MetaTr@versal.  

Previous to MetaVRse, Julie was Co-Founder of Emulator, the World’s most advanced DJ system, which won the prestigious 2011 DJ Mag Innovative Product Award.  She scored a $500K deal on the hit TV show Dragons’ Den. 

Julie is the co-host of the WebXR Summit series and a renowned speaker on XR and Produced TEDx Toronto (2010) and introduced coding in VR at Canada Learns Code (2017). She is past-President of the VRARA Toronto Chapter and Former Chair of the VRARA Education and Student Committees. Most recently Julie presented with the YPO, Harvard and 1Society about changing the way we learn and teach using spatial technologies.

3239.title: Findings on the Effectiveness of XR for Education

post.post_content: The evidence for the effectiveness of XR in learning is more than anecdotal. These researchers represent the cutting edge of those whose work can show us what really works.
post.post_title: Findings on the Effectiveness of XR for Education

post.post_content:
Dr. Karen Alexander is a sought-after consultant on building immersive learning programs with extensive connections across the XR industry and academia. Her experience spans partnering with community organizations on giving children and youth the opportunity to create with XR tools, guiding higher ed institutions through the process of XR adoption, advising ed tech and XR startups, and, in her role as an immersive learning consultant with MetaVRse, pioneering the translation of of 2D training into 3D experiences for enterprise.

post.post_content: Cassondra (Cassie) Eng is an NIH T32 Sports Neuroscience Postdoctoral Scholar at Stanford University. Her training is in two distinct, but complementary areas: the Learning Sciences and Cognitive Neuroscience. She utilizes eye tracking and neuroimaging to investigate the interactions between psychophysiological processes and educational outcomes. Her research focuses on fostering attention regulation and cognitive skills through enriching virtual learning contexts. Her primary work examines how physically-active video games enhance cognitive development and neuroplasticity in at-risk populations. As technology use grows at an exponential rate and sedentary behavior increases in the wake of the global pandemic, evidence-based practices that promote both physical activity and cognitive engagement are needed. She advocates for Educational Neuroscience, the emerging field that fosters collaborations in neuroscience, psychology, human-computer interaction, educational technology, and related disciplines to explore how learning experiences support brain development and cognitive skills crucial for academic achievement and success.

Eleni Mangina carried out her PhD work at the University of Strathclyde (UK), Department of Electronic and Electrical Engineering, working on Agent-based applications for intelligent data interpretation (1998-2001). Eleni Mangina holds an M.Sc. in Artificial Intelligence from the Department of Artificial Intelligence at University of Edinburgh in the UK and an MSc in Agricultural Science from Agricultural University of Athens in Greece. In 2002 she joined the School of Computer Science, at University College Dublin, Ireland.

Dr Eleni Mangina is currently Professor at the School of Computer Science, University College Dublin in Ireland and the Vice Principal (International) for College of Science. Eleni Mangina is guided by her own definition of the art of persistence, that involves both courage and compassion with research integrity and authenticity. Her lab operates at the intersection between applied Artificial Intelligence (VR/AR; Data Analytics; UAVs; Information Systems) and a portfolio development within interdisciplinary applications (i.e. Energy Sector and Educational Systems with XR).

Eleni Mangina has extensive experience for the last 20 years in National, EU and International funded projects and she is project coordinator of two (2) H2020 projects (ARETE & AHA), one (1) Erasmus+KA2 (FANTASIA) and partner within other H2020 projects (i.e. iSEED) and three (3) Erasmus+ projects (XRforPed, BASE, RoboPisces). She is funded investigator as part of SFI Energy Systems Integration Partnership Programme (ESIPP), NEXSYS and academic supervisor for two (2) SFI Centres for Research Training (CRT) (Machine Learning – ML-Labs; Digitally-Enhanced Reality – D-REAL).

She has authored more than 200 peer-reviewed articles in national and international peer reviewed workshops and conferences and international journals, including in IEEE and ACM. Eleni Mangina also contributes as a committee member for reviews to many international conferences and journals. Eleni Mangina also contributes actively to IEEE Standards and is the Executive Editor for the publications of the IEEE Global Initiative on XR Ethics. She is currently the Chair of Athena SWAN Bronze Award application for the School of Computer Science.

talk_description:
The
scope of this presentation is the exploration of ethics-related issues to support the development, design, and
deployment of XR applications in education and the aim is to initiate expert-driven, multidiscipline analysis
of the evolving XR Ethics requirements, with a vision to propose solutions, technologies, and standards in future updates. The set of recommendations within this report will hopefully contribute to industry
conceptualisation of socio-technological issues, highlight concreted recommendations, and lay the
groundwork for future technical-standardisation activities.

Reference will be made to our CEN Workshop on the 9th of September 2022:

post.post_content: I am an Assistant Professor in the College of Education, at the University of Florida and have experience of developing technologies with autistic, and underserved groups, which started in my undergraduate work exploring multimedia programs for a deaf community in the U.K. I am currently interested in examining and developing the role that VR HMDs can play in supporting young people with autism in their daily lives; informed by their input. The aim of my work is to co-design the future of this field (VR and autism) with autistic communities and other important stakeholders. More than this, I am also interested in developing a range of innovative technologies that can help to enable people with neuro-diversity.

International medical equipment manufacturer Siemens Healthineers are remaking their employee education program using WebXR. Sophia meets with Jennifer Crawford to talk about how the scalability of delivering immersive content over the web enables rapid expansion with measurable results.

Sophia Moshasha is on a mission to accelerate the adoption of immersive & emerging technologies. Behind the scenes, on camera, and on stage, Sophia is a driving force behind numerous initiatives designed to advance knowledge and engagement with XR across all sectors.

As a producer of The Polys - WebXR Awards and host of its Virtual Red Carpet, Special Correspondent of the WebXR Summit Series and co-host of the VRARA podcast, Sophia has interviewed dozens of XR pioneers and innovators. As a fellow of MetaTr@versal, an initiative to advocate for cooperation among the stakeholders of the Metaverse on standards and interoperability, Sophia was the star of a 40 minute, 3-act play which was performed live on the Main Stage at AWE 2022, which featured a cast of industry heavyweights. She is a co-founder of XR Women, a global collective dedicated to the advancement of female representation in technology.  Sophia will host the WebXR Brand Summit on September 15.

Since 2018, Sophia has been the Vice President of the DC Chapter of the VR/AR Association’s Washington, D.C. Chapter. Sophia is also the co-founder and Chief Marketing Officer for Ready Player Golf, the first annual Virtual Reality Charity Golf Outing, which began in 2020, and has raised money for MSF (Doctors Without Borders) and XRSI (the XR Safety Initiative). She has served as Head of Partnerships for Brightline Interactive, XR Strategist for Virtual Reality Marketing, and in Executive Program support for AFWERX, the US Air Force’s Innovation Investment Program. 


Sophia has been influencing global networks through many years of active engagement in the XR community. She has been featured on prominent media outlets such as Forbes, ABC, CGTN, American Dream TV series and more She holds a Bachelor of Science from Virginia Commonwealth University. She is currently engaged in public policy planning for Meta.
post.post_excerpt:
Sophia is host and producer of the WebXR Brand Summit and
The Polys - WebXR Awards Virtual Red Carpet, Special Correspondent of WebXR Summit Series, Co-Founder of XR Women and Ready Player Golf, VP of the DC Chapter of VRARA, and co-host of the VRARA Podcast.

post.post_content:
Jennifer has been with Siemens Healthineers for 13 years in various roles most recent is as Global Head of Education Designers. In that role she is responsible for design of development of internal training on Healthcare Products.

She lives in Pittsboro, NC currently with her husband & son both named James and her dog Taz.
Jen enjoys coaching little league and basketball in her spare time and spending time on the lake.

talk_title: Siemens Healthineers Digitalization of Internal Training using Immersive and XR Technologies
talk_description:
Questions to ask...
1.	Where was SHS in terms of Digitalization of Internal Training in 2018 and 2019?
2.	What kinds of things were we focused on digitalizing?
3.	What got us interested into Immersive Training and XR? 
4.	What are the educational results were we interested in?
5.	What kind of business results were we interested in?
6.	How have you done?

Sophia Moshasha interviews John Collins, who has more than 30 years experience in STEM education, on how immersive makes teaching science a dream come true.

post.post_content:
John Collins a.k.a. The Paper Airplane Guy held the world record holder for paper airplane distance for ten years. Author of five books of original designs, John has been called the world’s foremost expert on paper aircraft. He has appeared on Conan, Nat Geo, Discovery, Science Channel, ESPN’s Sports Science, Ripley’s Believe It or Not, as well as performing live for TedX Munich, Google Zeitgeist, WIRED 21, Harvard’s Graduate School of Design, and more than 90 in-person presentations per year.

If you've never seen a paper airplane flaps it's wings, flip over and fly back upside down, spin, circle, loop or stay aloft for minutes indoors; tighten your seat belt and stow your tray table. You’re cleared for takeoff!

3538.title: Welcome to the WebXR Brand Summit

post.post_content: WebXR Summit Series creator Ben Erwin welcomes host Sophia Moshasha and the audience to our fifth event. This one is built to be a catalyst for accelerating investment in the Immersive Web through educating the marketing and advertising community.
post.post_title: Welcome to the WebXR Brand Summit

post.post_content:
Ben Erwin’s work is dedicated to the advancement of the XR industry through recognition of its pioneers and events that provide an advocacy platform for thought leaders. He is a passionate proponent for cooperation on standards for the Metaverse.

As an Internet frontiersman since the 1990s, Ben has served as a developer and as an executive for digital media agencies creating data driven interactives for dozens of major brands. For 13 years, he was a webmaster and consultant for the United Nations humanitarian section and partner NGOs, bringing awareness to the plight of women and children in conflict areas around the world. Before the internet, Ben began his career in the entertainment and music industry.

Ben is a digital polymath with decades of experience in marketing, management, programming, video editing, and writing. Influenced by his years as a veteran of the browser wars, he has teamed up with XR industry leadership to produce the MetaTr@versal series of events. These events are designed to galvanize the community around cooperation on the development and adoption of open standards and platform interoperability for the Metaverse.

Ben believes passionately in the potential of immersive content as a positive means for evolved human communication, particularly in civics, journalism, and education. Through shining a light on the good works of innovators, he aims to help preserve their legacy and inspire others to build upon their work.

He is the creator of The Polys - WebXR Awards, WebXR Summit Series, and MetaTr@versal which have impacted the industry by catalyzing awareness of, and engagement with the immersive web.

As a fellow of MetaTr@versal, an initiative to advocate for cooperation among the stakeholders of the Metaverse on standards and interoperability, Sophia was the star of a 40 minute, 3-act play which was performed live on the Main Stage at AWE 2022, which featured a cast of industry heavyweights. She is a co-founder of XR Women, a global collective dedicated to the advancement of female representation in technology.  Sophia will host the WebXR Brand Summit on September 15.

Since 2018, Sophia has been the Vice President of the DC Chapter of the VR/AR Association’s Washington, D.C. Chapter. Sophia is also the co-founder and Chief Marketing Officer for Ready Player Golf, the first annual Virtual Reality Charity Golf Outing, which began in 2020, and has raised money for MSF (Doctors Without Borders) and XRSI (the XR Safety Initiative). She has served as Head of Partnerships for Brightline Interactive, XR Strategist for Virtual Reality Marketing, and in Executive Program support for AFWERX, the US Air Force’s Innovation Investment Program. 


Sophia has been influencing global networks through many years of active engagement in the XR community. She has been featured on prominent media outlets such as Forbes, ABC, CGTN, American Dream TV series and more She holds a Bachelor of Science from Virginia Commonwealth University. She is currently engaged in public policy planning for Meta.

post.post_content:
Amy Peck is the Founder & CEO of EndeavorXR, a leading global XR strategy & consulting firm. She is a recognized thought-leader in the space and speaks globally on the future of XR and exponential technologies.
Amy holds multiple Advisory Board roles and is a Venture Partner at the Capital Region XR
Accelerator. She is Co-chair of Prospera Women, a global organization supporting female-led
startups and was Founding Co-chair of the VRAR Association Enterprise Committee.
She actively mentors entrepreneurs and is a member of several Women in Tech, Venture-backed Accelerators & STEM Education organizations.

Through EndeavorVR, she works with Fortune 500 companies and tech startups on XR strategy, content, development, product and GTM.

Her own personal mission is to see technology accessible to all - fundamentally improving every aspect of our lives and elevating the way we work, learn, communicate and play.

3540.title: WebXR Ad Monetization – Zesty Market Place

post.post_content: Adtech is a big part of Monetization for brands and WebXR takes this opportunity to a whole new level.
post.post_title: WebXR Ad Monetization - Zesty Market Place

post.post_content: Elijah is the co-founder of Zesty, a startup that’s building infrastructure to enable monetization, data collection and content distribution in the spatial web and WebXR. He was previously a data engineer at Shopify, where he worked on internal analytics tooling that today ingests data used by teams in the company. He is passionate about the intersection of web3 and XR, especially when it comes to on-chain identity management, monetization and in-game digital assets.

3542.title: XR Product Placement and Native Advertising

post.post_content: What does product placement mean in the Metaverse and could it replace digital advertising as a more organic means of connecting with the consumer?
post.post_title: XR Product Placement and Native Advertising

post.post_content:
Mr. Gappelberg is an accomplished entrepreneur with an expertise in creating, funding and running start-ups, as well as extensive experience both as a hands-on operating executive and as a public markets professional.

From 2000 to 2005, Mr. Gappelberg was the co-founder and CEO of EG Products where he funded, patented, imported and distributed the market’s first LED light-up toy. He secured license deals from Disney, Universal Studios, Clear Channel Communication and built a national sales channel, setting the foundation to land contracts with Walgreen\'s, Macy’s, and live event shows like Ringling Bros.

He was also co-founder and CEO of an app development company which created and published over 200 successful apps for both Apples iTunes store and the Google Play store. Prior to being a successful entrepreneur, Mr. Gappelberg worked on Wall Street and has more than 20 years of extensive experience as both a hedge fund manager and Senior Vice President of Finance.

In 2018, he founded Nextech AR Solutions and is the current CEO of the Company.

resources: Nextech AR Solutions is the engine accelerating the growth of the Metaverse. Using breakthrough AI, Nextech AR is able to quickly, easily, and affordably ARitize (transform) vast quantities and varieties of existing assets at scale making products, people and places ready for interactive 3D use, giving creators at every level all the essential tools they need to build out their digital AR vision in the Metaverse. Our platform agnostic tools allow brands, educators, students, manufacturers, creators, and technologists to create immersive, interactive and the most photo-realistic 3D assets and digital environments, compose AR experiences, and publish them omnichannel. With a full suite of end-to-end AR solutions in 3D Commerce, Education, Events, and Industrial Manufacturing, Nextech AR is in a unique position to meet the needs of the world’s biggest brands and all Metaverse contributors. To learn more, please visit https://www.nextechar.com/

post.post_content: Ashley Crowder is the co-Founder and CEO of VNTANA, a SaaS platform that makes 3D asset management and distribution incredibly easy via the industry’s only fully automated 3D optimization and content management platform. She has worked in the 3D/AR/VR space for over 10 years helping Fortune 1000 brands including Adidas, Hugo Boss, Decker’s Brands and more launch 3D applications to increase sales and speed up time to market. She has 14 patents on mixed reality technology and is a part of the Khronos Group to create standards in 3D technology. Ashley was featured as one of USC’s leading engineering CEOs of 2016 and has given talks on the future of mixed reality at prestigious venues including SXSW, Augmented World Expo, TEDx, World Economic Forum and more. Prior to co-founding VNTANA she graduated from USC with a bachelors and masters in engineering and gained valuable engineering experience at BP and Northrop Grumman. She leverages her engineering background to guide VNTANA’s overall direction and technology development to shape the future of e-commerce by making it easy to create a 3D version of every product in the world.
The spatial medium gives us new ways to make people think. When you can do anything, what creativity can be unleashed?

Tom Ffiske writes about immersive technologies at the Immersive Wire, a newsletter and website dedicated to all things VR, AR, and the metaverse. His goal is to bring a curated digest of the analysis that matters, helping professionals interested in immersive to reach new heights.

Tom has written about the industry since 2016, covering the latest trends and investments while keeping a pulse on the latest innovations. He has spoken in several events, published a bestselling book on the sector, and help connect professionals to help each other soar.

talk_description: How will the state of XR develop? Tom Ffiske explores the evolution of the industry from 2021 and beyond.

post.post_content: Experienced entrepreneur with a professional background in creative media in the US, Europe and Asia. In 2015, when VR/AR exploded onto the scene, Terry saw the potential in a growing creative market whose professionals would need help with strategic and business development advice. Since then Terry founded his XR Business Consulting agency and the leading VR/AR/Metaverse showcase and community: VirtualRealityMarketing.com

resources:
Invited to the following panel: 

Selling the Matrix: Communicating the Business Case to the Uninitiated

Morpheus said it best, “You cannot be told what The Matrix is, you have to see it for yourself.” Onboarding decision-makers to XR and convincing them of the urgency to wrap their head around the business potential of the medium of the 21st Century

Invited to the following panel: 

Selling the Matrix: Communicating the Business Case to the Uninitiated

Morpheus said it best, “You cannot be told what The Matrix is, you have to see it for yourself.” Onboarding decision-makers to XR and convincing them of the urgency to wrap their head around the business potential of the medium of the 21st Century

post.post_content: Samantha G. Wolfe is the Founder of PitchFWD, a strategic consultancy focused on the acceleration adoption of emerging technologies. She works with some of the most innovative companies in VR, AR, haptics, and the metaverse on branding, marketing, and business strategies. Sam is an Adjunct Professor at NYU's Steinhardt School teaching The Business of Virtual Reality and Augmented Reality, The Marketing of Innovation, and Avatars and Virtual Humans, all courses she created and developed. She has authored two books Metaversed (yet to be announced), Marketing New Realities, and contributed a chapter to Charlie Fink\'s Convergence.

Kiira is a multi-dimensional director crossing the mediums of theatre, hybrid cinema and virtual reality. VR credits include: Cardboard City which won the Samsung Gear VR contest (2016) and premiered at the NYFF in 2016. For her interactive VR experience Runnin’ starring Reggie Watts, she was the first VR director to film on the Intel Studios volumetric capture stage (Sundance 2019, Jury Award for Interactive at SXSW 2019). Loveseat, (VR Theatre - Venice Film Festival 2019) was performed simultaneously before live and virtual audiences. Her latest VR Theatre production Finding Pandora X featured Broadway actors and was recently performed virtually at the Venice Film Festival 2020. She is the founder of Double Eye Studios which specializes in VR Theatre, live events and virtual production.

The Metaverse allows for user engagement at a scope, depth, and length that have never before been possible. In this discussion, we will cover analytics for immersive content and how you can effectively and accurately measure this new form of ROI.

Dr. Karen Alexander is a sought-after consultant on building immersive learning programs with extensive connections across the XR industry and academia. Her experience spans partnering with community organizations on giving children and youth the opportunity to create with XR tools, guiding higher ed institutions through the process of XR adoption, advising ed tech and XR startups, and, in her role as an immersive learning consultant with MetaVRse, pioneering the translation of of 2D training into 3D experiences for enterprise. 

Dr. Alexander is a co-founder of XR Women, a worldwide network of professionals that meet weekly in virtual worlds and where a distinguished list of XR industry speakers has appeared. As part of the team that produces The Polys - WebXR Awards, WebXR Summit Series, and MetaTr@versal, she has worked with some of the most influential thought leaders in spatial computing. Bringing her passion for metaverse literacy back to her academic roots, Dr. Alexander is host of the WebXR Education Summit, assembling a diverse array of practitioners to share knowledge on successful implementation of immersive learning. She is also a member of the Immersive Learning Research Network’s State of XR and Immersive Learning Expert Panel. 

Prior to her work in XR, Dr. Alexander was Dean of Junior and Senior Year programs at the women’s college at Rutgers University and Senior Editor of Signs: Journal of Women and Culture in Society. Her experience in higher education ranges across teaching, program design, journal editing, and college administration, with specializations in art, literature, film, and cultural production. Dr. Alexander is committed to women’s advancement and gender and racial equality and believes in a Humanity First approach to XR and the metaverse. She holds master’s degrees in English, Philosophy, and Issues in Modern Culture and earned her PhD. at the University of London.
post.post_excerpt:
Karen is a Producer and Host of the
WebXR Summit Series
Co-Founder, XR Women and 
Advisor, XR Hall of Fame

post.post_content: Vanitha Swaminathan is Thomas Marshall Professor of Marketing at the University of Pittsburgh and the Director & Founder of the Katz Center for Branding, which aims to be a global thought-leader in digital branding and technology branding strategies. As Center Director of the Center for Branding, Prof. Swaminathan has been active in developing thought leadership, partnerships and programs involving various aspects of digital branding and technology branding strategy.

20+years in executive and sales leadership roles at companies including LinkedIn, Rogers Communication and Bell Media. Extensive experience in the online advertising, ecommerce, fintech and immersive industries driving revenue and developing partnerships. Association involvement includes IAB Canada, Canadian Marketing Association and the Canadian Lending Association. Since 2018, Gary has been leading revenue and partnership development for start-up and scale-up businesses in areas including mobile video/podcast advertising and XR/VR/AR. Providing advisory, strategic sales, partner management & development services. Passionate about sales and selling. A start-up and scale-up veteran. Gary enjoys the challenge of bringing new solutions to market and connecting C Suite executives with solutions in immersive entertainment, online learning and marketing.

It is important to develop a strategy that links the physical to the virtual world, creating creative opportunities to accelerate revenue for physical products. Join this discussion on how to achieve this through seamless, fun, organic, and interactive ways in the metaverse.

D.J. Smith is the Co-Founder and Chief Creative Officer at The Glimpse Group.  The Glimpse Group is a platform company for a portfolio of (14) startups focused on the virtual and augmented reality industries.  At Glimpse, D.J.’s responsibilities include overseeing the production of all VR and AR content as well leading the effort to locate new subsidiary companies.  In addition, D.J. is the organizer of The New York Virtual Reality Meetup (NYVR).  NYVR is the (2nd) largest virtual meetup in the world with 6100+ members and is the premiere venue for industry networking and collaboration within New York City.

Daria Fedko is CEO of WE/AR Studio – a Ukrainian XR studio recognized as one of the world’s top 25 AR/VR companies & Intel’s official partner in AR/VR solutions.
Additionally, Daria is a Technology Ambassador of Ukraine at the World’s Leaders Summit, where she builds a tech-oriented community to drive innovation and share the experience among different verticals.
Today, Daria works with the leading brands providing them with custom-made AR/VR solutions for their needs. Her company also helps businesses to migrate to the Metaverse and keep up with the times in the coming era of Web3.
Additionally, Daria has been invited to speak at global events such as Laval Virtual 2022, XR Global Summit, AWE Nite Amsterdam, VR/AR Global Summit, and others.

talk_title: How to build your business presence in Metaverse through XR
talk_description:
- XR as one of 3 core Mateverse components 
- business use cases of transition to Metaverse-ready model 
- where to start with your transition

post.post_content:
Rupert Deans
Chief Executive and Founder of Plattar

Immersive Reality pioneer Rupert Deans grew up with dyslexia as a child and often questioned why we have so much 2D content in a 3D world. He recognised the enormous potential of 3D & Augmented Reality to solve practical problems and set out to create a tool that would enable anyone to create their own AR experiences with ease. Plattar launched in February 2017, and has worked with Fortune 500 and ASX100 companies including The Warehouse Group, Bailey Nelson, Red Bull, PWC, Air New Zealand, Flight Center, Baby Bunting,  Fisher and Paykel, Nespresso, Samsung, Singel, Schneider Electrical,  SAAB and Unilever.

Mike Cadoux is the Managing Director of QReal, a company that specializes in beautiful immersive XR experiences and lifelike 3D modeling for eCommerce. QReal just won the ‘Best Use of Technology’ award for Digiday’s ModernRetail Awards 2021 - and they're pretty proud of that. Instead of a long resume, just know that Mike loves thinking, reading and talking about the future, skiing, running and playing Go.
Beyond the NFT hype cycle lies the practical matter of digital attribution, copyrights and portability of digital goods.

post.post_content:
Tony Parisi is a Metaverse and virtual reality pioneer, inventor, entrepreneur, investor, author and musician. He has co-created several international 3D graphics standards, including VRML, X3D, and glTF. Tony is the author of O’Reilly Media’s foundational books on 3D graphics and VR, Learning Virtual Reality (2015), Programming 3D Applications in HTML5 and WebGL (2014), and WebGL Up and Running (2012).

One of the leading spokespeople for the immersive industry, Tony has given speeches in multiple countries about industry trends and innovation in augmented reality. He was named in Next Reality’s 30 People to Watch in Augmented Reality in 2020.

Tony is currently serving as Chief Strategy Officer at Lamina1, a new layer 1 blockchain for the Metaverse. He is also an advisor and limited partner in early stage venture firms including ME Ventures, a future-focused investment fund providing opportunities for creators to grow and succeed. Previously, Tony was Head of XR Ads and E-Commerce at Unity, where he oversaw strategy and product for the company’s real-time 3D brand advertising and commerce solutions.

Tony is also a composer and musician. He is currently finishing the cast recording for Judgment Day, a full-length original musical, and has several other music projects underway.

As Chairman and Chief Brand Officer of American manufacturer Wendell August Forge, Will Knecht is charged with leading the strategy and future focus of his company.

He is passionate about the future of our phygital world, the blending of the physical and the digital to offer compelling, immersive brand experiences.

As the Head of Community at Spatial, Jake is leading a community of artists, designers, and creators, as well as a vast network of partners, in building a metaverse for culture.  He has worked in the space for nearly a decade, helping everyone from Fortune 500 enterprise & consumer brands, to individual creators, create engaging augmented & virtual reality experiences for their audiences. Now at Spatial, which is at the unique intersection of the metaverse and NFTs, is building the community of the next generation of the internet and global connectivity.
Richard Ward founder of Ready Player Golf shares with us his concept of his self-named unit of attention "Richards Per Minute."

Sophia Moshasha is on a mission to accelerate the adoption of immersive & emerging technologies. Behind the scenes, on camera, and on stage, Sophia is a driving force behind numerous initiatives designed to advance knowledge and engagement with XR across all sectors.

post.post_content:
Founder of ReadyPlayerGolf.com the oldest and largest charity event in the Metaverse. An annual gathering where industry friends get together, play some cooperative games, and raise funds for a worthy cause. This year it\'s the Children\'s Cancer Research Foundation.

Also, Head of Metaverse for McKinsey & Company

Join us in a discussion with creators and innovators who are shaping the future of XR and Web3 experiences. Hear real-world examples, and learn about a variety of technologies, emerging trends, and immersive experiences across brands, content, entertainment, fashion, and the future of retail.

Bobby Carlton has worked in immersive technology industry since 2016 when he became the Director of VRLearn at the MASIE Center, working with enterprise learning leader Elliott Masie and helping organizations and government agencies understand how AR/VR/XR technology could make people better learners.

In 2017 he joined VRScout as a writer and continued to work with multiple organizations as an XR consultant. He is also on the SXSW XR Pitch Advisory Board.

In 2022, he joined FS Studio to become their XR/VR Content Manager bringing his years of experience to projects in robotics, automation, infrastructure, mechatronics, marketing, and workforce training.

Val Vacante is an award-winning global innovator; as the VP of Solutions Innovation at Dentsu, she uncovers cultural trends, commerce dynamics and emerging technologies to shape next-generation product innovations, and solutions impacting the way people connect and experience in the physical and digital world.

Val is the visionary and co-creator behind ShopNXT™ — dentsu’s award-winning patent-pending retail innovations named “top product picks,” at CES by PCR Magazine, “top tools shaping the future of retail” by Adweek, featured in CNET, The Drum, PSFK Retail Innovation Week, eMarketer, MediaPost, PCR, TechAcute among others.

Additionally, Val architected and launched NXT Intelligence™ an innovation platform featuring 12 technology, innovation, and brand solutions designed to rapidly explore, evaluate and evolve business growth opportunities. Her latest work focuses on connected experiences, the evolution of the metaverse, mixed worlds, gaming, retail and play.

She is also the founder of Collabsco where she pioneered the first connected play landscape, mapping 260+ emerging technologies and connected experiences featured in VentureBeat, The Drum, and VRScout.

Her portfolio includes over 50+ brands: Hasbro, Mattel, Disney, Bandai Namco Entertainment, WowWee, AT&T, Vodafone, Nestlé, Mercedes-Benz, MINI, Honeywell, Sleep Number, Dell, MERGE, Virsix Games, among others.

Val has recently been named one of the Top 25 Women in Tech by PCR magazine, The Most Powerful Women in Technology, 2022 by CIO Views and 40 Over Forty.

She serves on the Fast Company Executive Board, SXSW Innovation Advisory Board, is a Global Expert to MassChallenge, an international speaker and writer.

Briar Prestidge is a serial entrepreneur and CEO of Prestidge Group a leading personal branding, PR and speaker relations agency managing HNWI, C-level executives, technology experts, celebrities, government officials and investors, with offices in Dubai, New York, and London.

A qualified Digital Marketer, Speech-Language Pathologist and Neuro-Linguistic Programming Business Practitioner with an international career for both private and government sectors (originally from a farm in New Zealand), Briar is obsessed with PR, emerging tech, VR/AR and the metaverse, continual learning, business and entrepreneurship.

Prior to establishing Prestidge Group, Briar led communication and digital teams, including executive branding, for many public/ private sector companies, including a government agency rebrand (both digital and comms lead), overseeing all communication touch points, crisis comms strategy, media training for VIPs, and press launch for regional/ international media.

Briar also has a corporate power suit collection BRIAR PRESTIDGE - The Label (www.briarprestidge.com), made from fine wool and cashmere. In 2022, they created their virtual spin-off collection for avatars and dropped NFT suits on leading VR platform, Decentraland, at the World’s First Metaverse Fashion Week.

Briar is also a Strategic Advisor for Scopernia, specialized in preparing companies for a future in Web3, and she sits on the board for the Metaverse Fashion Council.

She was named ‘Top 100 Most Influential’ in the United Arab Emirates, and she has been featured across Entrepreneur, Forbes, OSN, Emirates Women, Marie Claire, Grazia and The National in recognition of her work. In 2022, Briar also received a lot of publicity around her experiment where she spent ’48 hours in the metaverse’ and through her virtual reality world hopping productions.

As a mentor for startups, Briar works with The Founders Institute and one of the world\'s largest entrepreneurial networks, TiE, and she also provides one-on-one and group session consulting.

Briar advocates the role of a healthy body and mind for entrepreneurs and corporate professionals, which is why she wrote the recipe book “Hunger for Success – A recipe book for businesspeople who hate cooking,” to be released in 2022.

When Briar isn’t working or travelling, you can find her at the gym, Pilates or running, spending time with friends (in real life or virtually…), or studying something new.

Marco Carvalho is a visionary entrepreneur who creates transformational technologies, products, and immersive experiences by remixing gaming, film, education, work, and play in the physical and digital world.

Marco is the CEO of HeadOffice.Space where he’s co-creating the world’s first metaverse on the moon, designed for the ever-changing way remote teams work, play, learn and engage — building a sense of belonging, fostering a culture of connection, community, creativity, and productivity.
Marco is an Endeavor Entrepreneur (endeavor.org), multi-award-winning creative director, inventor, and co-founder of global brands, products, and companies in the USA, UK, China, and Brazil.

He has driven innovative products and experiences for over eighteen years across immersive content, art, games, technology, education, adventure parks, and global distribution with over ten years focused on developing AR, VR, and voice/sound technologies.

Marco has partnered with leading global technology, entertainment, games, and consumer product companies, including Universal Studios, WarnerBros., Disney, Amazon, Qualcomm, developing businesses, IPs, products & technology globally.

Marco’s work has been featured on the global stage of innovation as a CES Innovation honoree 2019; Cinequest 2020 best VR Roomscale, 2014 Best Educational toy in France (with Bandai) among others, he serves as a mentor and international speaker featured at Amazon, Qualcomm, UKTI, Harvard University, and Berkeley University.

3533.title: Setting A High Bar for Avatars

post.post_content: Celebrities demand fidelity in how they are represented. Performance to digital fashion count for brands entering the metaverse. Can platforms innovations keep pace with the expectations they set?
post.post_title: Setting A High Bar for Avatars

post.post_content:
Dulce Baerga has been producing interactive content for over 20 years. Building sites ranging from entertainment based portals to product based community sites. She’s a self-taught full stack developer, front-end engineer and network/IT manager who’s passionate about augmented reality and virtual reality platforms. Her skill set includes developing concepts, programming demos, creating UI/UX design, scripting user interactivity, building 3D simulations, creating virtual products, and building webXR apps.

She’s also an active resident of multiple virtual worlds, top prize winner at XR related hackathons, and deeply embedded in the XR community. Dulce is currently pushing the edges of the immersive web and augmented reality, creating XR MVPs for clients and collaboration projects. Immersive theater and mixed reality storytelling are two verticals of focus where she’s been creating production pipelines and UI/UX mechanics. Iterating on and streamlining new XR pipelines to create base MVPs is Dulce’s primary directive while pushing the XR envelope.

Verónica Orvalho is the founder and CEO of Didimo. She has translated years of research, data science, and computer graphics expertise into a patented technology platform to create digital humans, empowering people to engage more authentically and humanly in digital spaces. This breakthrough provides the next evolution of how humans will engage the world around them.

Veronica earned a Ph.D. in Computer Graphics and is a professor at Porto University. She has lived and worked on three continents, with companies like IBM, Sony, Amazon, Universal Studios, and more.

Amany is an Instructional designer, researcher, Voice User Interface designer, author, and teacher trainer. She is currently pursuing her doctoral degree in the Instructional Technology and Media program at Teachers College, Columbia University. She’s co-hosts Metaverse Adventures at the Immersive Learning Research Network. She founded the VirtuaTELL conference at NYS TESOL in 2021 that brings together educators, practitioners, researchers, and passionate enthusiasts to work together to integrate emerging technologies into education. Her research interests include conversational AI, Extended Reality for education, immersive storytelling, intelligent NFTs and decentralized autonomous organizations.

Andy has long had a passion for mixing art with business and cutting-edge technology to help artists create sustainable magic. Most recently he was Chief Product Officer for Hanai World, a phygital entertainment company led by Cirque du Soleil founder Guy Laliberte, bringing the human performance to new forms of XR and LBE experiences. Andy is a founder of Arcturus, a 3D video software company that enables the authoring, editing and streaming of volumetrically captured performances. Prior to Arcturus, Andy was the creator-focused product manager at YouTube responsible for launching monetization, analytics, payments and reporting solutions for YouTube partners. In early 2015 he shifted his focus to creating YouTube’s initial VR content strategy, launching YouTube’s 360 video feature with top creator content, and leading production for the first stereoscopic 360 music videos. Prior to YouTube, Andy was a serial entrepreneur who co-founded, grew and sold 3 media-tech companies after earning his Wharton MBA and Princeton electrical engineering degrees. Andy is also an avid drummer, stage performer, and arts patron: He toured with a jam band in the late 90\'s, was a trained performer in the Blue Man Group in the early 00\'s, and is now an advisor, executive producer or board member to various creator-focused initiatives.

At 100 floors, 100 million square feet, TheMall promises to be the largest virtual retail and entertainment destination in the Metaverse.  Co-Founder Alan Smithson will give a live tour of the new revolutionary 3D real-time interactive website for TheMall, built on the web based MetaVRse Engine.

My purpose in life is to inspire and educate people to think and act in a socially, economically and environmentally responsible way.
I make creator tools: Emulator , MetaVRse, and Your Director AI (Stealth)
I am a TEDx Speaker, Podcast Host and was  featured on Dragons’ Den. I was a DJ for more than 20 years performing for millions of people winning DJ Mag’s Innovative Product of the Year in 2011.

4339.title: The Road to Mass Consumer Adoption

post.post_content: Taking this new medium to scale is the key to world-wide adoption and monetization. A discussion with Bob Bjarke from Meta about what it will take to get the immersive industry to a place where this medium will become a part of the daily life of a consumer.
post.post_title: The Road to Mass Consumer Adoption

post.post_content:
Sophia Moshasha is on a mission to accelerate the adoption of immersive & emerging technologies. Behind the scenes, on camera, and on stage, Sophia is a driving force behind numerous initiatives designed to advance knowledge and engagement with XR across all sectors.

As a producer of The Polys - WebXR Awards and host of its Virtual Red Carpet, Special Correspondent of the WebXR Summit Series and co-host of the VRARA podcast, Sophia has interviewed dozens of XR pioneers and innovators. As a fellow of MetaTr@versal, an initiative to advocate for cooperation among the stakeholders of the Metaverse on standards and interoperability, Sophia was the star of a 40 minute, 3-act play which was performed live on the Main Stage at AWE 2022, which featured a cast of industry heavyweights. She is a co-founder of XR Women, a global collective dedicated to the advancement of female representation in technology.  Sophia will host the WebXR Brand Summit on September 15.

Since 2018, Sophia has been the Vice President of the DC Chapter of the VR/AR Association’s Washington, D.C. Chapter. Sophia is also the co-founder and Chief Marketing Officer for Ready Player Golf, the first annual Virtual Reality Charity Golf Outing, which began in 2020, and has raised money for MSF (Doctors Without Borders) and XRSI (the XR Safety Initiative). She has served as Head of Partnerships for Brightline Interactive, XR Strategist for Virtual Reality Marketing, and in Executive Program support for AFWERX, the US Air Force’s Innovation Investment Program. 


Sophia has been influencing global networks through many years of active engagement in the XR community. She has been featured on prominent media outlets such as Forbes, ABC, CGTN, American Dream TV series and more She holds a Bachelor of Science from Virginia Commonwealth University. She is currently engaged in public policy planning for Meta.

In addition to partnering with the most highly regarded creative agencies in North America, Bob has also developed innovative new mobile ad products with teams of Meta engineers and product managers.

3531.title: What Happens on the Headset Stays on the Headset

post.post_content: Striking the balance between how sensors capture biometric and environmental data in order to function, without violating a user's privacy is fundamental to ethical concerns about XR.
post.post_title: What Happens on the Headset Stays on the Headset

post.post_content:
Since May 2014, Kent Bye has conducted over 1600 Voices of VR podcast interviews featuring the pioneering artists, storytellers, and technologists driving the resurgence of virtual & augmented reality. He's an oral historian, experiential journalist, & aspiring philosopher, helping to define the patterns of immersive storytelling, experiential design, ethical frameworks, & the ultimate potential of XR.

He's also been an executive committee member on the IEEE's Global Initiative on the Ethics of Extended Reality, which has been looking at mapping out the landscape of ethics for virtual and augmented reality. You can hear his latest thoughts on Twitter @kentbye.

post.post_content: Aura Freeman is Co-founder of Atom Futures, a cultural research, futures and brand strategy agency based in London. Her background is in research, campaigning and strategy in the not-for-profit sector and with brands. She has designed and implemented global social and policy change campaigns for several international organisations, including Amnesty International, on issues such as online safety and freedom of speech.

Katitza Rodriguez is EFF's Policy Director for Global Privacy. She concentrates on comparative policy of global privacy issues, with special emphasis on emerging technology and cross border data flows. Katitza's work also focuses on cybersecurity and government access to data at the intersection of international human rights law and standards. Katitza also supervises EFF's growing Latin American team. She was an advisor to the UN Internet Governance Forum (2009-2010). In 2018, CNET named Katitza one of the 20 most influential Latinos in technology in the United States. In 2014, she was also named one of "The heroes in the fight to save the Internet".

resources:

Virtual Worlds, Real People: Human Rights in the Metaverse, https://www.eff.org/deeplinks/2021/12/virtual-worlds-real-people-human-rights-metaverse


Defending Your Rights in Every Reality: Year in Review 2020, https://www.eff.org/deeplinks/2020/12/defending-your-rights-every-reality-year-review-2020

post.post_content:
Avi Bar-Zeev has been at the forefront of XR and The Metaverse for over 30 years: first launching Disney’s groundbreaking Aladdin VR ride in the early 90s, crafting Second Life’s 3D worlds and co-founding Keyhole (Google Earth) mirror-earth 3D browser around 2001. He co-invented Microsoft Hololens in 2010, helped defined Amazon Echo Frames in 2015, and then contributed at Apple on undisclosed projects.

Since leaving Apple, he’s consulted privately for top XR companies and investors. And he’s taken a more public stance by writing and speaking publicly on important issues like privacy, biometric sensing and mental autonomy, targeted and future experiential advertising, DEI and harassment in XR, and various open Metaverse/web3 architectures.

Most recently, he is a founder and President of The XR Guild, a new non-profit membership organization that seeks to support and educate professionals in XR on ethics and most positive outcomes for humanity.

The Metaverse doesn't just open opportunities to create payment rails for existing physical products or services, but it also creates opportunities for alternative revenues streams through selling goods/services exclusively available virtually.

Daniel Dyboski-Bryant is a humanitarian committed to XR for good. His personal mission is to explore, drive and share the development and application of benevolent and meaningful and impactful experiences with emerging technologies. 

Daniel is the Executive Director of the Virtual World Society - a US non-profit - leading their mission to inspire and enable people to thrive, solve problems and create positive impact with emerging technologies. Since 2015, the VWS has run projects around the globe with families, schools and communities; has recognised and celebrated achievements in the XR community; and has contributed thought leadership to the industry.

Daniel co-founded Educators in VR in 2018 to bring together a global community of 3500 educators pioneering the integration of VR for learning, teaching and beyond. He specializes in R.I.S.E. - Remote Immersive Synchronous Experiences and Education. Educators in VR has run more than 3000 virtual events, workshops, presentations and conferences. In Feb 2020, two weeks before Covid 19 arrived, Educators in VR hosted the 2020 International Educators in VR Summit - a 6-day, 24/7, fully immersive VR conference on 5 platforms with 170 speakers, 150 events and 95% CO2 saving compared with a real-world conference. In May 2021 they ran a similar 30-day conference on 20 immersive VR platforms. Daniel will host the WebXR Production Summit on October 13.

Daniel has been an educator for 25 years, teaching languages, entrepreneurship and innovation and training trainers at colleges, universities and corporations in Germany, England, Wales and online. At Coleg Menai Daniel built and led an immersive learning Lab where he used VR to engage with migrant workers and refugees for which he won Inspire Tutor of the Year award in 2020.

talk_description:
Co-founders of Educators in VR Lorelle VanFossen and Daniel Dyboski-Bryant share their extensive experience bringing people together in VR to explore and experience XR immersive education. They\'ve produced over 3,000 educational VR events, workshops, classes, and conferences, bringing a unique perceptive to the potential of XR education and VR events. 

Educators in VR was founded by Lorelle VanFossen and Daniel Dyboski-Bryant in 2018 with the mission to integrate XR immersive technology into education, training, research, and business. The company has grown to over 3,000 global members and supports over 25 special interest groups they call teams, exploring XR industry verticals and niches. Over 60,000 participants have attended their thousands of free and paid events across multiple social VR platforms.

Athena Demos is co-founder and CEO of Big Rock Creative (BRC), an award-winning XR experience company creating groundbreaking experiences for global clients. Big Rock Creative won the Producer’s Guild Award for Innovation, the Aurea Award for creativity, the No Proscenium award for Best VR experience of 2020, the Hermes\' Platinum Award, and the Auggie Award for Best Societal Impact of 2022. With over 20 years of experience producing iconic events, like the LA Burning Man Decompression Arts and Music Celebration, as well as  the Art of Change Inaugural Ball for President Obama in LA, she transitioned to the metaverse to produce BRCvr (Black Rock City Virtual Reality). BRCvr is an official virtual Burning Man Experience whose scope is unprecedented in the VR space. Athena produced internationally recognized social impact projects such as Breonna’s Garden which premiered at SXSW 2022. She has developed a philosophical approach to guiding humanity to build a foundational fabric for creative collaboration in the metaverse. As a result, she has been quoted in leading books, articles and spoken at leading industry events.

Anne-Marie is an award-winning Event Producer who loves bringing together inspiring people to create incredible connections.  She is the Executive Producer of the Immerse Global Summit and Global Event Director for the VR/AR Association.  Anne-Marie also serves as an Ambassador for Mission Impact, a Global Leadership Development program focusing on business-critical web3 training, personal growth, and impact for women so that they can accelerate their leadership within the organization and in the world.  She is proud to be on the Advisory Board of  The Women of the Future, Web3 & Metaverse Book.  Anne-Marie loves using the stages at her events to give a platform for voices that need to be heard.

In 2019, Sonya founded VR Community Builders and she actively encourages positive, inclusive communities through engagement and training. She's also an avid journalist and has written eight books.
Eventually, studios are going to need to provide immersive content to keep consumers engaged. How exactly is that going to work when premium content services enter the Metaverse?

Event producer, immersive experience designer & music director/artist Celeste Lear is a Los Angeles based XR professional with 2 decades of discipline within the digital entertainment & audio/visual world. She has lead various teams working with DreamlandXR & has worked on ground breaking projects with world renown production crews to turn out consistently well planned & executed futuristic events, including, high tech multi-media installation experiences, video mapping, conferences, immersive festivals & concerts - both physically and in VR in the metaverse. Founder of Boutique Electronique Music, her work is also centered around the most current tech and trends for AV, sound engineering, performance, music curation, music direction and broadcast. She has a special passion for projects around environmental sustainability, human connection & the arts.

post.post_content: Gabe is a product manager and developer who has worked somewhere at the intersection of education, immersive technology, and collaborative tools for the past 10 years. He lives in Southern California, creates instrumental music in his free time, and enjoys working with curious, passionate people.

Christi Fenison is an immersive storyteller, 3D artist, 360 videographer and simulation designer.
Her passion is creating XR experiences that expand perspectives and inspire action. Drawing on principles of narrative transport, cognitive elaboration and the sense of presence, she works to bring big picture ideas to life via the careful interplay of meaningful details.

By day, Christi works as an XR Instructional Media Producer at UNC School of Medicine IT, focused on the research, development and integration of XR training simulations in curriculum. Beyond the classroom, she is also a bespoke World Builder for Social VR events, crafting custom experiences tailored to each client’s vision and goals.

Christi received her Master's degree from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill’s Environment and Science Communication program, where focused on Emerging Technologies, 3D Modeling + Unity Development, Green Architecture + Sustainable Design, Geospatial Information Systems, and Immersive Journalism.

post.post_content:
Doug is a co-founder of Big Rock Creative, a XR company producing large
scale events in VR. Big Rock’s first large project, BRCvr, created a fully
immersive Burning Man festival in social VR starting in 2020 which generated
much positive PR including an article in Wired Magazine. Big Rock Creative
won the Producer's Guild innovation award and the Aurea Award. He has
since worked on projects ranging from directing an XR music video featuring
Pitbull, facilitating a Hollywood red carpet premiere in VR or creative directing
the VR version of "Breonna's Garden" that premiered in SXSW 2022.
Doug’s background is in the film industry, he graduated from USC film school
in the 90s with honors. Over the course of his career, he has written,
directed, produced, and edited several festival award-winning narratives and
documentaries. His most notorious documentary features the Burning Man
festival called, “Journey to the flames” which has been screened nationally
and internationally. Some other feature-length docs include “Faire: An
American Renaissance” and “The Secret Lives of Adult Stars”, and co-edited
the award-winning short doc “Selling Lies”.

post.post_content:
Han Kim is an attorney in the Entertainment, Technology and Advertising Practice Group at SheppardMullin.

Han’s practice focuses on transactional entertainment matters that span from the cutting-edge intersection of technology and entertainment to traditional entertainment industries. He advises clients on business transactions related to music, television, feature film, podcast, metaverse (VR/AR), blockchain/NFTs, esports and games.

Forward-thinking and entrepreneurial by nature, Han works closely with companies, talents, producers, and entrepreneurs that disrupt, and bring innovations to, various entertainment industries. Han provides added value to his clients’ work by structuring novel business models, presenting practical risk management solutions for their operations, and leveraging his industry relationships.

Cynthia Maller is Head of 3D Creative Technology at Walmart, and three of its digitally-native brands: Hayneedle, Art.com and Allswell. She is also a Certified Emotional Intelligence (EQ) Practitioner. Her focus is strengthening and scaling the three pillars of 3D in retail: inspiring aesthetics, visual integrity and operational excellence. She believes that every one of us has the talent and capability to add value to immersive commerce, and to be a builder, a citizen and a purveyor in the Metaverse. This drives her commitment to peer education, advocacy and invention. When she’s not at work, she’s on the ice, feeding her passion for figure skating. Her drive to try new things, to push herself, both in commerce technology and on the ice, is guided by the words of Erin Hanson, “What if I fall? Oh, but my darling, What if you fly?

Gregg is a media entrepreneur, speaker, educator, and business and marketing strategist with experience in extended reality, virtual world events, location-based entertainment, and emerging media and technologies.

Gregg is currently serving as Senior Vice-President of U.S. Operations / Partner, of HOLOGATE, the world’s most successful immersive media company for location-based entertainment with 13,000,000+ players-to-date across 38 countries around the globe; Co-Vice Chair of the Producers Guild of America ‘New Media Council’ (2nd Term); and Partner and Co-Event Director of DreamlandXR. He also an advisory board member of SXSW ‘Pitch’; ‘Kollab’, which supports thousands of LA youth of the Boys and Girls Clubs of America; and the Cal State University Entertainment Alliance (CSUEA). Previously, Gregg was Chief Strategist / Evangelist at ‘Unofficial Cardboard’, the pioneering and leading Google-Certified producer of ‘Google Cardboard VR’.

Gregg’s speaking engagements include the Augmented World Expo (AWE), Consumer Electronic Show (CES), Game Developer’s Conference (GDC); National Association of Broadcasters (NAB); Dubai Game Conference, Comic-Con, WonderCon, IBC Show | Amsterdam, SIGGRAPH, SXSW, Mobile World Congress, VR/AR Global Summit, Amusement Expo/VR Summit, G2E-Global Game Expo, and many others.

post.post_content: Brian currently leads the Production Services group at The Mars Agency, which is comprised of a robust team of production design, finishing, retouching, asset management, execution and print production.  He has over 20 years of experience in leading executions for some of the largest CPG\'s and retailers in the industry, both from the lense of the agency, as well as the solution provider.  Brian also leads the Disruptive Technologies & Innovation group, focusing on Metaverse, NFTs and Augmented Reality experiences and commerce. Brian has been with the agency for the past 2 years and is based out of Atlanta, GA.

Winslow Porter is an award-winning director, producer and creative technologist specializing in virtual/augmented reality as well as large-scale immersive installations. Winslow formed the pioneering, new media studio the New Reality Company in 2016, creating the critically-acclaimed cinematic VR experiences Giant and Tree. Shortly after, he was named Adweek’s Top 100 creatives as digital innovators and a designer-in-residence at A/D/O. In 2018, Tree won the Lumiere for Best Location Based VR Short as well as 7 other notable awards after being shown at over 100 notable conferences and festivals such as TED, UN General Assembly, Davos and Gardens By The Bay. He is currently a Cultural Leader at the World Economic Forum, a mentor in residence at the New Museum Incubator, an adjunct NYU Tisch professor, a founding member of the Onassis Institute’s ONX art/tech accelerator, as well as a creative director and creative tech consultant at R/GA Global. Winslow’s new immersive AR experience Rainforest, which received an Epic Games MegaGrant, transforms participant’s settings into their own private jungle environment to elucidate pressing concepts and concerns of sustainability and conservation. Winslow is also an artist in residence at the Smallhold Mushroom farm in Brooklyn, creating Forager, an immersive experience of the life-cycle of a mushroom, featuring the first volumetric time-lapse inside a game engine.

Amanda’s recent endeavors have lead her to join forces with the Web3 powerhouse DAO, XLA, as Director of Events and lead in experiential marketing. XLA’s mission is to democratize wealth building and revenue distribution for IP creators, owners, and holders by empowering them through the power of Web 3.0 based technologies.

She is the visionary behind 150+ innovative technological events of the past decade, providing the leading curated event platforms for groundbreaking artists, film, immersive media, blockchain technologies, space exploration, motion capture innovation, and other emerging technologies now converging and evolving to create experiences and brands into the metaverse.

Amanda Pool is the Founder of Imagine Global Marketing and Imagine Events Services, producing and executing over 150 individual events in technology, film and music over the last 5+ years. Imagine was Agency of Record for the IBC Convention, Europe’s largest media trade show (curating the schedule for the Future Reality Zone); Agency of Record for the Advanced Imaging Society (producing and curating “On the Lot” at Paramount Studios for three consecutive years). Imagine also produced Eveleigh Social House, VR On the Mountain, and The Fly Lounge at Sundance Film Festival and the Lumiere Awards. She has produced events at Coachella, EDC, NAB, CES, Toronto International Film Festival, Festival de Cannes, and many more.

When people are still talking about what the Metaverse is, it can be confusing for Brands to know what to do to start thinking about their brands spatially. This session will provide some sense making from the day to build your Metaverse.

Julie Smithson’s personal mission is to ‘inspire and educate people to think and act in a socially, economically and environmentally responsible way’.

It is through this lens as co-founder at MetaVRse, a 3D Web game engine for Business & XR development company.  Julie is leading enterprise companies to digitally transform and educate ways to immersive and remotely train users of the product/service. Julie guides her team to translate instructional language, interaction behaviors and curate knowledge testing gamification for businesses.  

Julie’s leadership is focused on transforming training & marketing into immersive experiences using technologies to design Web3 solutions, integration implementation and deployment to produce growth benefits, cost savings and human efficiencies.

Julie is also co-Chair of XRWomen.com , a global group of women who meet every Wednesday and learn about the applications of extended realities.  The group works to advocate, inspire and build communities aimed at inclusivity of gender equality, race and ethnicity in the digital sector and beyond.  

Julie is the host of the XR For Learning podcast. Julie also leads XR Collaboration, a coalition supporting human connectivity through digital presence in platforms building communication and collaboration.  Julie is also founder of XR Ignite to support the innovation and entrepreneurship of our communities. She also sits on panels and in leading conversations about interoperability standards and alignments with Khronos Group and MetaTr@versal.  

Previous to MetaVRse, Julie was Co-Founder of Emulator, the World’s most advanced DJ system, which won the prestigious 2011 DJ Mag Innovative Product Award.  She scored a $500K deal on the hit TV show Dragons’ Den. 

Julie is the co-host of the WebXR Summit series and a renowned speaker on XR and Produced TEDx Toronto (2010) and introduced coding in VR at Canada Learns Code (2017). She is past-President of the VRARA Toronto Chapter and Former Chair of the VRARA Education and Student Committees. Most recently Julie presented with the YPO, Harvard and 1Society about changing the way we learn and teach using spatial technologies.
