post.post_content:
Dr. Yu Yuan (Candidate for 2022 IEEE Standards Association President-Elect) is a visionary researcher, inventor, practitioner, and entrepreneur in the areas of Consumer Technology, Multimedia/VR/AR, Connected/Automated Vehicles, IoT, and Digital Transformation. He founded 0xSenses Corporation, a multinational technology company specializing in Virtual Reality.

Dedicated to \"Creating Better Worlds\" as its long-term vision, the company is developing technologies, infrastructures, ecosystems, and resources needed for massively multiplayer ultra-realistic virtual experiences. Prior to this he worked for IBM Research as a research scientist and was a key contributor to IBM\'s Cell Broadband Engine, Smarter Planet, and IoT initiative. He has been a passionate volunteer in various leadership positions at IEEE and other professional communities. His outstanding service in IEEE standards activities at different levels (working groups, standards committees, and governance at higher levels) has been widely appreciated by standards developers, individual members, and corporate members.

He has a Ph.D., an M.S., and a B.S. in Computer Science from Tsinghua University.

resources:
The IEEE Annual Election has now begun. You can submit your vote before 12:00 p.m. ET (1600 UTC-04) on 1 October to help determine the future volunteer leadership of IEEE.

As a candidate nominated by petition for 2022 IEEE Standards Association President-Elect, I am humbly inviting you to review and comment on my Detailed Plan If Elected, which is NOT included in the IEEE Annual Election website due to a word limit. While my Bio, IEEE Accomplishments and Activities, and Statement can all be found on both the IEEE Annual Election website and my personal website (https://yuyuan.info/), I do encourage you to visit and bookmark my personal website as it always includes the latest version of my Detailed Plan If Elected, and supports interactive discussions in the comments area.

post.post_content:
Dr. June Wang currently serves as Senior Vice President at Futurewei Technologies. She has 20 years of experience in companies such as Qualcomm, Ericsson, Huawei, etc., with expertise in product management, strategy, marketing, and business development in wireless terminals and the mobile ecosystem.

She was also a pivotal leader in account management interfacing with large U.S operators such as Verizon Wireless. In 2015, Dr. Wang helped drive breakthroughs like partnering with Google on the Nexus 6P and Android Wear flagship device. In 2016 she led a team to build a joint lab with Microsoft to support her company’s PC product line. In 2017-2018 her team gained Google VR/AR/Lens Product Area certification and supported partners’ efforts on the first rollout of Android Go and Android Messaging (RCS). In recent years, Dr. Wang’s department focusing on managing master agreements/contracts that are fully compliant with local regulations with top partners in the ecosystem. She believes in the power of open source and fully supports the WebXR efforts in the community.

post.post_title: MetaD@vos -Kent Bye, Voices of VR Podcast

post.post_content:
Since May 2014, Kent Bye has conducted over 1600 Voices of VR podcast interviews featuring the pioneering artists, storytellers, and technologists driving the resurgence of virtual & augmented reality. He's an oral historian, experiential journalist, & aspiring philosopher, helping to define the patterns of immersive storytelling, experiential design, ethical frameworks, & the ultimate potential of XR.

He's also been an executive committee member on the IEEE's Global Initiative on the Ethics of Extended Reality, which has been looking at mapping out the landscape of ethics for virtual and augmented reality. You can hear his latest thoughts on Twitter @kentbye.

4917.title: MetaD@vos -Daniel Dyboski- Bryant, Virtual World Society

post.post_title: MetaD@vos -Daniel Dyboski- Bryant, Virtual World Society

post.post_content:
Daniel Dyboski-Bryant is a humanitarian committed to XR for good. His personal mission is to explore, drive and share the development and application of benevolent and meaningful and impactful experiences with emerging technologies. 

Daniel is the Executive Director of the Virtual World Society - a US non-profit - leading their mission to inspire and enable people to thrive, solve problems and create positive impact with emerging technologies. Since 2015, the VWS has run projects around the globe with families, schools and communities; has recognised and celebrated achievements in the XR community; and has contributed thought leadership to the industry.

Daniel co-founded Educators in VR in 2018 to bring together a global community of 3500 educators pioneering the integration of VR for learning, teaching and beyond. He specializes in R.I.S.E. - Remote Immersive Synchronous Experiences and Education. Educators in VR has run more than 3000 virtual events, workshops, presentations and conferences. In Feb 2020, two weeks before Covid 19 arrived, Educators in VR hosted the 2020 International Educators in VR Summit - a 6-day, 24/7, fully immersive VR conference on 5 platforms with 170 speakers, 150 events and 95% CO2 saving compared with a real-world conference. In May 2021 they ran a similar 30-day conference on 20 immersive VR platforms. Daniel will host the WebXR Production Summit on October 13.

Daniel has been an educator for 25 years, teaching languages, entrepreneurship and innovation and training trainers at colleges, universities and corporations in Germany, England, Wales and online. At Coleg Menai Daniel built and led an immersive learning Lab where he used VR to engage with migrant workers and refugees for which he won Inspire Tutor of the Year award in 2020.
post.post_excerpt:
Daniel is the host of the WebXR Production Summit and
Co-Founder of Educators in VR

talk_description:
Co-founders of Educators in VR Lorelle VanFossen and Daniel Dyboski-Bryant share their extensive experience bringing people together in VR to explore and experience XR immersive education. They\'ve produced over 3,000 educational VR events, workshops, classes, and conferences, bringing a unique perceptive to the potential of XR education and VR events. 

Educators in VR was founded by Lorelle VanFossen and Daniel Dyboski-Bryant in 2018 with the mission to integrate XR immersive technology into education, training, research, and business. The company has grown to over 3,000 global members and supports over 25 special interest groups they call teams, exploring XR industry verticals and niches. Over 60,000 participants have attended their thousands of free and paid events across multiple social VR platforms.

post.post_content:
Avi Bar-Zeev has been at the forefront of XR and The Metaverse for over 30 years: first launching Disney’s groundbreaking Aladdin VR ride in the early 90s, crafting Second Life’s 3D worlds and co-founding Keyhole (Google Earth) mirror-earth 3D browser around 2001. He co-invented Microsoft Hololens in 2010, helped defined Amazon Echo Frames in 2015, and then contributed at Apple on undisclosed projects.

Since leaving Apple, he’s consulted privately for top XR companies and investors. And he’s taken a more public stance by writing and speaking publicly on important issues like privacy, biometric sensing and mental autonomy, targeted and future experiential advertising, DEI and harassment in XR, and various open Metaverse/web3 architectures.

Most recently, he is a founder and President of The XR Guild, a new non-profit membership organization that seeks to support and educate professionals in XR on ethics and most positive outcomes for humanity.

post.post_content:
Julie Smithson’s personal mission is to ‘inspire and educate people to think and act in a socially, economically and environmentally responsible way’.

It is through this lens as co-founder at MetaVRse, a 3D Web game engine for Business & XR development company.  Julie is leading enterprise companies to digitally transform and educate ways to immersive and remotely train users of the product/service. Julie guides her team to translate instructional language, interaction behaviors and curate knowledge testing gamification for businesses.  

Julie’s leadership is focused on transforming training & marketing into immersive experiences using technologies to design Web3 solutions, integration implementation and deployment to produce growth benefits, cost savings and human efficiencies.

Julie is also co-Chair of XRWomen.com , a global group of women who meet every Wednesday and learn about the applications of extended realities.  The group works to advocate, inspire and build communities aimed at inclusivity of gender equality, race and ethnicity in the digital sector and beyond.  

Julie is the host of the XR For Learning podcast. Julie also leads XR Collaboration, a coalition supporting human connectivity through digital presence in platforms building communication and collaboration.  Julie is also founder of XR Ignite to support the innovation and entrepreneurship of our communities. She also sits on panels and in leading conversations about interoperability standards and alignments with Khronos Group and MetaTr@versal.  

Previous to MetaVRse, Julie was Co-Founder of Emulator, the World’s most advanced DJ system, which won the prestigious 2011 DJ Mag Innovative Product Award.  She scored a $500K deal on the hit TV show Dragons’ Den. 

Julie is the co-host of the WebXR Summit series and a renowned speaker on XR and Produced TEDx Toronto (2010) and introduced coding in VR at Canada Learns Code (2017). She is past-President of the VRARA Toronto Chapter and Former Chair of the VRARA Education and Student Committees. Most recently Julie presented with the YPO, Harvard and 1Society about changing the way we learn and teach using spatial technologies.

post.post_content:
Joanna Popper is an award-winning Hollywood and Silicon Valley media executive with a track record of launching cutting edge content and technology to drive revenue, audience engagement and brand love.

She currently leads HP’s Virtual Reality initiatives for Go-To-Market and Location Based Entertainment. Prior she was EVP of Media & Marketing at Singularity University and VP Marketing at NBCUniversal.

Joanna is Executive Producer on “Breonna’s Garden” which premiered at the Tribeca Festival. This augmented reality experience was created by Lady PhoEnix and Sutu with Ju’Niyah Palmer to honor the life of her sister, Breonna Taylor.

Joanna was Executive Producer on Double Eye Studios’ “Finding Pandora X,” winner of Venice Film Festival Golden Lion for Best VR Experience and the SXSW Audience Award for Virtual Cinema Spotlight. Finding Pandora X is a modern day take on Greek mythology live interactive experience in VRChat.

Joanna was selected as “50 Women Can Change the World in Media and Entertainment,” “Top 50 Original Thinkers in VR,” “Top Women in Media: Game Changers,” “Top Women in Media: Industry Leaders,” “Digital It List,” “101 Women Leading the VR Industry” and is on the Coalition for the Women in XR Fund.

Artur Sychov is Founder and CEO of Somnium Space. He has been navigating virtual worlds for more than two decades starting with Ultima Online in 1999, then Second Life and many more. Artur strongly believes in the ultimate future of Virtual Reality worlds with open and decentralized economy.

Christopher Lafayette is an emergent technologist in XR applying his talents to Medtech, FinTech, Climate and applied sciences.

He is working for a more equitable future in technology serving as a Silicon Valley national and international speaker, thought leader and a culture advocate.

post.post_content:
Register Now for the Live 2-Hour Launch Event
November 3rd at 8am Pacific / 11am Eastern / 4pm CET

The Wolvic Browser is the only Open Source Immersive Browser The Reincarnation of Firefox Reality.

You can DOWNLOAD WOLVIC NOW, FREE

Wolvic is Open Source Visit the GitHub Repo,
see the code and contribute to it.

Help fund Wolvic by Joining the Wolvic Open Collective

Sophia Moshasha has a conversation with Igalia founders Juan José Sánchez Penas and Sergio Villar Senin to tell the story of how the Wolvic Browser came to be. Mozilla discontinued development of the open-source Firefox® Reality browser in 2020 leaving the community of WebXR developers without a hardware-independent browser. Then Igalia stepped-in, resurrecting and modernizing the code base, and recently released Wolvic! See what opportunities and plans lie ahead for the only Immersive-Only browser in XR.

Sophia Moshasha is on a mission to accelerate the adoption of immersive & emerging technologies. Behind the scenes, on camera, and on stage, Sophia is a driving force behind numerous initiatives designed to advance knowledge and engagement with XR across all sectors.

As a producer of The Polys - WebXR Awards and host of its Virtual Red Carpet, Special Correspondent of the WebXR Summit Series and co-host of the VRARA podcast, Sophia has interviewed dozens of XR pioneers and innovators. As a fellow of MetaTr@versal, an initiative to advocate for cooperation among the stakeholders of the Metaverse on standards and interoperability, Sophia was the star of a 40 minute, 3-act play which was performed live on the Main Stage at AWE 2022, which featured a cast of industry heavyweights. She is a co-founder of XR Women, a global collective dedicated to the advancement of female representation in technology.  Sophia will host the WebXR Brand Summit on September 15.

Since 2018, Sophia has been the Vice President of the DC Chapter of the VR/AR Association’s Washington, D.C. Chapter. Sophia is also the co-founder and Chief Marketing Officer for Ready Player Golf, the first annual Virtual Reality Charity Golf Outing, which began in 2020, and has raised money for MSF (Doctors Without Borders) and XRSI (the XR Safety Initiative). She has served as Head of Partnerships for Brightline Interactive, XR Strategist for Virtual Reality Marketing, and in Executive Program support for AFWERX, the US Air Force’s Innovation Investment Program. 


Sophia has been influencing global networks through many years of active engagement in the XR community. She has been featured on prominent media outlets such as Forbes, ABC, CGTN, American Dream TV series and more She holds a Bachelor of Science from Virginia Commonwealth University. She is currently engaged in public policy planning for Meta.

4631.title: Importance of WebXR and the Immersive Web

post.post_content: Wolvic is the only browser that runs on multiple VR platforms which is a very significant advancement for the immersive web ecosystem. Polys creator Ben Erwin welcomes a panel of diverse expertise for a discussion on developing, deploying, scaling, and building community around this unique open-source initiative to provide alternatives to manufacturers, developers and consumers for distributed WebXR experiences.
post.post_title: Importance of WebXR and the Immersive Web

post.post_content:
Ben Erwin’s work is dedicated to the advancement of the XR industry through recognition of its pioneers and events that provide an advocacy platform for thought leaders. He is a passionate proponent for cooperation on standards for the Metaverse.

As an Internet frontiersman since the 1990s, Ben has served as a developer and as an executive for digital media agencies creating data driven interactives for dozens of major brands. For 13 years, he was a webmaster and consultant for the United Nations humanitarian section and partner NGOs, bringing awareness to the plight of women and children in conflict areas around the world. Before the internet, Ben began his career in the entertainment and music industry.

Ben is a digital polymath with decades of experience in marketing, management, programming, video editing, and writing. Influenced by his years as a veteran of the browser wars, he has teamed up with XR industry leadership to produce the MetaTr@versal series of events. These events are designed to galvanize the community around cooperation on the development and adoption of open standards and platform interoperability for the Metaverse.

Ben believes passionately in the potential of immersive content as a positive means for evolved human communication, particularly in civics, journalism, and education. Through shining a light on the good works of innovators, he aims to help preserve their legacy and inspire others to build upon their work.

He is the creator of The Polys - WebXR Awards, WebXR Summit Series, and MetaTr@versal which have impacted the industry by catalyzing awareness of, and engagement with the immersive web.
post.post_excerpt:
Ben is the Creator of 
The Polys WebXR Awards,
WebXR Summit Series, and 
XR Hall of Fame.
Co-Founder, Ready Player Golf

talk_description: Welcoming our worldwide audience to the WebXR community and thanking our team, our sponsors and our speakers.

post.post_content: Elijah is the co-founder of Zesty, a startup that’s building infrastructure to enable monetization, data collection and content distribution in the spatial web and WebXR. He was previously a data engineer at Shopify, where he worked on internal analytics tooling that today ingests data used by teams in the company. He is passionate about the intersection of web3 and XR, especially when it comes to on-chain identity management, monetization and in-game digital assets.

Keith earned a Ph.D. in anthropology and used it to make a career introducing students to this field. After trying VR, he saw its potential in education and began making the VR museum AnVRopomotron to enhance the student experience. He continues to investigate ways that XR can enrich learning.
post.post_excerpt: Dr. Keith Chan received his Ph.D. in anthropology at the University of Missouri. He currently lives in San Diego, where he teaches biological anthropology in community colleges. Dr. Chan has always been interested in technology and finding new ways to use it in education, especially WebXR.

blurb: How does an educator with no VR experience make a virtual museum? Learn how the WebXR biological anthropology museum AnVRopomotron was built from the very basics of A-Frame and how some of the early stumbling blocks were overcome, including ways to fund the project.

post.post_content: Co-host of the Vhite Rabbit WebXR podcast and one of the original founders of the VR browser games platform \"Construct Arcade\", where he realized the need for WebXR focused development tools, which lead to the inception of Wonderland Engine, a development platform for VR, AR and 3D on the web.

Igalia’s Developer Advocate Brian Kardell lays out the vision for Wolvic, from its vision to its Open Collective. He will share with you how Wolvic plans to grow its community, sustain its finances and maintain its integrity as the open source browser that protects your privacy.

Brian is a Developer Advocate at Igalia, as well as Original Co-author/Co-signer of The Extensible Web Manifesto. He is active in Web standards, sitting on many working groups and is co-chair of the MathML Working Group, Co-Founder/Chair, W3C Extensible Web CG Member, as well as the AC Representative to the W3C (formerly OpenJS Foundation and now Igalia). He is a blogger and speaker on many web topics.

talk_description: Introducing Wolvic XR, the next evolution of the open source Firefox Reality browser.  In this talk we\'ll focus on introducing what it is, where it is going, and what makes it interesting and important.

post.post_content: Julie Smithson catches up with MeetKai CEO James Kaplan, to talk about the key role AI plays in building the Metaverse. MeetKai has some amazing WebXR Experiences, and an AI assistant for searches.

Julie Smithson’s personal mission is to ‘inspire and educate people to think and act in a socially, economically and environmentally responsible way’.

It is through this lens as co-founder at MetaVRse, a 3D Web game engine for Business & XR development company.  Julie is leading enterprise companies to digitally transform and educate ways to immersive and remotely train users of the product/service. Julie guides her team to translate instructional language, interaction behaviors and curate knowledge testing gamification for businesses.  

Julie’s leadership is focused on transforming training & marketing into immersive experiences using technologies to design Web3 solutions, integration implementation and deployment to produce growth benefits, cost savings and human efficiencies.

Julie is also co-Chair of XRWomen.com , a global group of women who meet every Wednesday and learn about the applications of extended realities.  The group works to advocate, inspire and build communities aimed at inclusivity of gender equality, race and ethnicity in the digital sector and beyond.  

Julie is the host of the XR For Learning podcast. Julie also leads XR Collaboration, a coalition supporting human connectivity through digital presence in platforms building communication and collaboration.  Julie is also founder of XR Ignite to support the innovation and entrepreneurship of our communities. She also sits on panels and in leading conversations about interoperability standards and alignments with Khronos Group and MetaTr@versal.  

Previous to MetaVRse, Julie was Co-Founder of Emulator, the World’s most advanced DJ system, which won the prestigious 2011 DJ Mag Innovative Product Award.  She scored a $500K deal on the hit TV show Dragons’ Den. 

Julie is the co-host of the WebXR Summit series and a renowned speaker on XR and Produced TEDx Toronto (2010) and introduced coding in VR at Canada Learns Code (2017). She is past-President of the VRARA Toronto Chapter and Former Chair of the VRARA Education and Student Committees. Most recently Julie presented with the YPO, Harvard and 1Society about changing the way we learn and teach using spatial technologies.

blurb: Building conversation from higher education, experiences and around Education access, implementation and curation of WebXR experiences

post.post_content:
James Kaplan is the Co-Founder and CEO of MeetKai Inc., a Conversational AI and metaverse company shaping the next-gen of artificial speech intelligence. He founded the startup with Co-Founder and Chairwoman, Weili Dai, after becoming frustrated with the limitations of current automated assistants. Kaplan has had a true passion for AI and coding since he was six and wrote his first bots at only nine years old, including the first Pokemon Go bot and many others still popular to this day.

Now his pioneering work puts MeetKai in competition with the largest names in tech. MeetKai Inc. was listed by Forbes as a “Tech Company Leading the Way” and has powered AI solutions for more than 20M people around the world. Kaplan studied Computer Science at Harvey Mudd College in Claremont, CA and currently resides in the Los Angeles area.

4655.title: Extending WebXR’s Reach with Diego Marcos

post.post_content: We're delighted to have Diego Marcos Segura, creator and maintainer of A-Frame join us for a last word on how an open source browser is good for the marketplace, for developers, and for users.
post.post_title: Extending WebXR's Reach with Diego Marcos

post.post_content:
Sophia Moshasha is on a mission to accelerate the adoption of immersive & emerging technologies. Behind the scenes, on camera, and on stage, Sophia is a driving force behind numerous initiatives designed to advance knowledge and engagement with XR across all sectors.

As a producer of The Polys - WebXR Awards and host of its Virtual Red Carpet, Special Correspondent of the WebXR Summit Series and co-host of the VRARA podcast, Sophia has interviewed dozens of XR pioneers and innovators. As a fellow of MetaTr@versal, an initiative to advocate for cooperation among the stakeholders of the Metaverse on standards and interoperability, Sophia was the star of a 40 minute, 3-act play which was performed live on the Main Stage at AWE 2022, which featured a cast of industry heavyweights. She is a co-founder of XR Women, a global collective dedicated to the advancement of female representation in technology.  Sophia will host the WebXR Brand Summit on September 15.

Since 2018, Sophia has been the Vice President of the DC Chapter of the VR/AR Association’s Washington, D.C. Chapter. Sophia is also the co-founder and Chief Marketing Officer for Ready Player Golf, the first annual Virtual Reality Charity Golf Outing, which began in 2020, and has raised money for MSF (Doctors Without Borders) and XRSI (the XR Safety Initiative). She has served as Head of Partnerships for Brightline Interactive, XR Strategist for Virtual Reality Marketing, and in Executive Program support for AFWERX, the US Air Force’s Innovation Investment Program. 


Sophia has been influencing global networks through many years of active engagement in the XR community. She has been featured on prominent media outlets such as Forbes, ABC, CGTN, American Dream TV series and more She holds a Bachelor of Science from Virginia Commonwealth University. She is currently engaged in public policy planning for Meta.

Sophia is host and producer of the WebXR Brand Summit and
The Polys - WebXR Awards Virtual Red Carpet, Special Correspondent of WebXR Summit Series, Co-Founder of XR Women and Ready Player Golf, VP of the DC Chapter of VRARA, and co-host of the VRARA Podcast.

post.post_content:
Dr. June Wang currently serves as Senior Vice President at Futurewei Technologies. She has 20 years of experience in companies such as Qualcomm, Ericsson, Huawei, etc., with expertise in product management, strategy, marketing, and business development in wireless terminals and the mobile ecosystem.

She was also a pivotal leader in account management interfacing with large U.S operators such as Verizon Wireless. In 2015, Dr. Wang helped drive breakthroughs like partnering with Google on the Nexus 6P and Android Wear flagship device. In 2016 she led a team to build a joint lab with Microsoft to support her company’s PC product line. In 2017-2018 her team gained Google VR/AR/Lens Product Area certification and supported partners’ efforts on the first rollout of Android Go and Android Messaging (RCS). In recent years, Dr. Wang’s department focusing on managing master agreements/contracts that are fully compliant with local regulations with top partners in the ecosystem. She believes in the power of open source and fully supports the WebXR efforts in the community.

Daniel Ljunggren has 10 years of accomplishments within Product Management and another 10 years within Business Development & Strategic Partnerships gained from global leadership roles within the smartphone, mobile apps & services, IoT, and AR/VR industry.

For over twenty years I have turned ideas into products in a variety of technical organizations ranging from low level systems programming (Be) to high level ubiquitous computing research (Xerox PARC). I have found success in many roles in growth startups including individual contributor and CTO.

post.post_content: Keram founded both VRTO & FIVARS in 2015. He’s a business and creative development consultant to a wide variety of tech companies, and founder of Constant Change Media Group Inc., with strong ties to both the Toronto & Los Angeles markets. He is also the editor in-chief of IndieGameReviewer.com, an instructor in WebXR design at UCLA Extension and author of essays around spatial media for several books. He won Creator of the Year at the 2022 Poly Awards, was named one of the Top 100 Original Voices in XR in 2021, and contributed to the 2022 PEW Research report on the Metaverse in 2040.
post.post_excerpt:
Keram is the founder and executive director of the VRTO International Symposium on Immersive Media and the FIVARS Festival of Virtual & Augmented Reality Stories. Both ran in WebXR in 2020.

He most recently contributed essays to two books published in 2020: Dyscorpia: Future Intersections of the Body and Technology, Edited by Marilene Oliver and Daniel Laforest, Published by Dept of Art and Design, University of Alberta and Handbook of Research on the Global Impacts and Roles of Immersive Media (editors: Jacquelyn Ford Morie (All These Worlds, LLC, USA) and Kate McCallum (Bridge Arts Media, USA and Vortex Immersion Media, USA).

My bio, headshots, logos, and links are on this google document.

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1f90K8RcIvFTy01jGPzKcxpCWyonAqjzB/edit?usp=sharing&ouid=108690154065405076525&rtpof=true&sd=true

Athena Demos is co-founder and CEO of Big Rock Creative (BRC), an award-winning XR experience company creating groundbreaking experiences for global clients. Big Rock Creative won the Producer’s Guild Award for Innovation, the Aurea Award for creativity, the No Proscenium award for Best VR experience of 2020, the Hermes\' Platinum Award, and the Auggie Award for Best Societal Impact of 2022. With over 20 years of experience producing iconic events, like the LA Burning Man Decompression Arts and Music Celebration, as well as  the Art of Change Inaugural Ball for President Obama in LA, she transitioned to the metaverse to produce BRCvr (Black Rock City Virtual Reality). BRCvr is an official virtual Burning Man Experience whose scope is unprecedented in the VR space. Athena produced internationally recognized social impact projects such as Breonna’s Garden which premiered at SXSW 2022. She has developed a philosophical approach to guiding humanity to build a foundational fabric for creative collaboration in the metaverse. As a result, she has been quoted in leading books, articles and spoken at leading industry events.

Doug is a co-founder of Big Rock Creative, a XR company producing large
scale events in VR. Big Rock’s first large project, BRCvr, created a fully
immersive Burning Man festival in social VR starting in 2020 which generated
much positive PR including an article in Wired Magazine. Big Rock Creative
won the Producer's Guild innovation award and the Aurea Award. He has
since worked on projects ranging from directing an XR music video featuring
Pitbull, facilitating a Hollywood red carpet premiere in VR or creative directing
the VR version of "Breonna's Garden" that premiered in SXSW 2022.
Doug’s background is in the film industry, he graduated from USC film school
in the 90s with honors. Over the course of his career, he has written,
directed, produced, and edited several festival award-winning narratives and
documentaries. His most notorious documentary features the Burning Man
festival called, “Journey to the flames” which has been screened nationally
and internationally. Some other feature-length docs include “Faire: An
American Renaissance” and “The Secret Lives of Adult Stars”, and co-edited
the award-winning short doc “Selling Lies”.

Elgin-Skye McLaren is a Senior Product Manager for Mozilla Hubs - an open source platform for creating and sharing 3D social spaces on the web.

She holds an MSc in Interactive Arts and Technology from Simon Fraser University. When she isn't working on Hubs or exploring VR she enjoys roller skating and building cool stuff with code.

blurb: Joining a panel

post.post_content:
Brian Peiris has been sitting at the intersection of XR and the Web since 2013. An early backer of the original Oculus Rift kickstarter, he started experimenting with practical applications of VR, using his skils as a fullstack developer to build a JavaScript VR live-coding app that went viral. This lead to a job at AltspaceVR, a startup at the time, where he established their web-based SDK and developer community.

Brian now works at Mozilla as part of the Mozilla Hubs team, who have been building their virtual social platform since 2017.
post.post_excerpt: Brian Peiris has been sitting at the intersection of XR and the Web since 2013. An early backer of the original Oculus Rift kickstarter, he started experimenting with practical applications of VR, using his skils as a fullstack developer to build a JavaScript VR live-coding app that went viral. This lead to a job at AltspaceVR, a startup at the time, where he established their web-based SDK and developer community. Brian now works at Mozilla as part of the Mozilla Hubs team, who have been building their virtual social platform since 2017.

post.post_content:
Avi Bar-Zeev has been at the forefront of XR and The Metaverse for over 30 years: first launching Disney’s groundbreaking Aladdin VR ride in the early 90s, crafting Second Life’s 3D worlds and co-founding Keyhole (Google Earth) mirror-earth 3D browser around 2001. He co-invented Microsoft Hololens in 2010, helped defined Amazon Echo Frames in 2015, and then contributed at Apple on undisclosed projects.

Since leaving Apple, he’s consulted privately for top XR companies and investors. And he’s taken a more public stance by writing and speaking publicly on important issues like privacy, biometric sensing and mental autonomy, targeted and future experiential advertising, DEI and harassment in XR, and various open Metaverse/web3 architectures.

Most recently, he is a founder and President of The XR Guild, a new non-profit membership organization that seeks to support and educate professionals in XR on ethics and most positive outcomes for humanity.

Yinch is a software engineer who works in the games and real time graphics space. His recent projects have included a VR ski fitness game, a jetliner cockpit procedural trainer and MRI machine simulator. He believes that technology should help solve real world problems and make life better.

He works closely with local schools to give access to immersive, interactive and inspiring VR learning experiences, ranging from an ISS jetpack adventure to Shakespeare\'s Globe Theatre. His company also runs programmes that encourage pupils to learn coding skills.

Before VR, his company has worked on video installations, healthcare mobile apps, treadmill fitness software and interactive 3D kiosks. Clients including Bank of America, Ford Motor Company and Samsung USA.

Yinch founded playko after working as lead developer on console games and multimedia titles. He graduated with a Masters in Engineering from Imperial College, London.

Co-host of the Vhite Rabbit WebXR podcast and one of the original founders of the VR browser games platform \"Construct Arcade\", where he realized the need for WebXR focused development tools, which lead to the inception of Wonderland Engine, a development platform for VR, AR and 3D on the web.
Brandon is a software engineer at Google working on various ways to bring immersive content to the web, including WebGL, WebXR, and most recently WebGPU.
post.post_excerpt: Brandon is a software engineer at Google working on various ways to bring immersive content to the web, including WebGL, WebXR, and most recently WebGPU.

Dulce Baerga has been producing interactive content for over 20 years. Building sites ranging from entertainment based portals to product based community sites. She’s a self-taught full stack developer, front-end engineer and network/IT manager who’s passionate about augmented reality and virtual reality platforms. Her skill set includes developing concepts, programming demos, creating UI/UX design, scripting user interactivity, building 3D simulations, creating virtual products, and building webXR apps.

She’s also an active resident of multiple virtual worlds, top prize winner at XR related hackathons, and deeply embedded in the XR community. Dulce is currently pushing the edges of the immersive web and augmented reality, creating XR MVPs for clients and collaboration projects. Immersive theater and mixed reality storytelling are two verticals of focus where she’s been creating production pipelines and UI/UX mechanics. Iterating on and streamlining new XR pipelines to create base MVPs is Dulce’s primary directive while pushing the XR envelope.

Julie is also co-Chair of XRWomen.com , a global group of women who meet every Wednesday and learn about the applications of extended realities.  The group works to advocate, inspire and build communities aimed at inclusivity of gender equality, race and ethnicity in the digital sector and beyond.  

Julie is the host of the XR For Learning podcast. Julie also leads XR Collaboration, a coalition supporting human connectivity through digital presence in platforms building communication and collaboration.  Julie is also founder of XR Ignite to support the innovation and entrepreneurship of our communities. She also sits on panels and in leading conversations about interoperability standards and alignments with Khronos Group and MetaTr@versal.  

Previous to MetaVRse, Julie was Co-Founder of Emulator, the World’s most advanced DJ system, which won the prestigious 2011 DJ Mag Innovative Product Award.  She scored a $500K deal on the hit TV show Dragons’ Den. 

Julie is the co-host of the WebXR Summit series and a renowned speaker on XR and Produced TEDx Toronto (2010) and introduced coding in VR at Canada Learns Code (2017). She is past-President of the VRARA Toronto Chapter and Former Chair of the VRARA Education and Student Committees. Most recently Julie presented with the YPO, Harvard and 1Society about changing the way we learn and teach using spatial technologies.

post.post_content:
Sophia Moshasha is on a mission to accelerate the adoption of immersive & emerging technologies. Behind the scenes, on camera, and on stage, Sophia is a driving force behind numerous initiatives designed to advance knowledge and engagement with XR across all sectors.

As a producer of The Polys - WebXR Awards and host of its Virtual Red Carpet, Special Correspondent of the WebXR Summit Series and co-host of the VRARA podcast, Sophia has interviewed dozens of XR pioneers and innovators. As a fellow of MetaTr@versal, an initiative to advocate for cooperation among the stakeholders of the Metaverse on standards and interoperability, Sophia was the star of a 40 minute, 3-act play which was performed live on the Main Stage at AWE 2022, which featured a cast of industry heavyweights. She is a co-founder of XR Women, a global collective dedicated to the advancement of female representation in technology.  Sophia will host the WebXR Brand Summit on September 15.

Since 2018, Sophia has been the Vice President of the DC Chapter of the VR/AR Association’s Washington, D.C. Chapter. Sophia is also the co-founder and Chief Marketing Officer for Ready Player Golf, the first annual Virtual Reality Charity Golf Outing, which began in 2020, and has raised money for MSF (Doctors Without Borders) and XRSI (the XR Safety Initiative). She has served as Head of Partnerships for Brightline Interactive, XR Strategist for Virtual Reality Marketing, and in Executive Program support for AFWERX, the US Air Force’s Innovation Investment Program. 


Sophia has been influencing global networks through many years of active engagement in the XR community. She has been featured on prominent media outlets such as Forbes, ABC, CGTN, American Dream TV series and more She holds a Bachelor of Science from Virginia Commonwealth University. She is currently engaged in public policy planning for Meta.

The Polys - WebXR Awards Virtual Red Carpet, Special Correspondent of WebXR Summit Series, Co-Founder of XR Women and Ready Player Golf, VP of the DC Chapter of VRARA, and co-host of the VRARA Podcast.

post.post_content:
Dr. Karen Alexander is a sought-after consultant on building immersive learning programs with extensive connections across the XR industry and academia. Her experience spans partnering with community organizations on giving children and youth the opportunity to create with XR tools, guiding higher ed institutions through the process of XR adoption, advising ed tech and XR startups, and, in her role as an immersive learning consultant with MetaVRse, pioneering the translation of of 2D training into 3D experiences for enterprise. 

Dr. Alexander is a co-founder of XR Women, a worldwide network of professionals that meet weekly in virtual worlds and where a distinguished list of XR industry speakers has appeared. As part of the team that produces The Polys - WebXR Awards, WebXR Summit Series, and MetaTr@versal, she has worked with some of the most influential thought leaders in spatial computing. Bringing her passion for metaverse literacy back to her academic roots, Dr. Alexander is host of the WebXR Education Summit, assembling a diverse array of practitioners to share knowledge on successful implementation of immersive learning. She is also a member of the Immersive Learning Research Network’s State of XR and Immersive Learning Expert Panel. 

Prior to her work in XR, Dr. Alexander was Dean of Junior and Senior Year programs at the women’s college at Rutgers University and Senior Editor of Signs: Journal of Women and Culture in Society. Her experience in higher education ranges across teaching, program design, journal editing, and college administration, with specializations in art, literature, film, and cultural production. Dr. Alexander is committed to women’s advancement and gender and racial equality and believes in a Humanity First approach to XR and the metaverse. She holds master’s degrees in English, Philosophy, and Issues in Modern Culture and earned her PhD. at the University of London.

post.post_content:
Caitlin Krause focuses on the intersection of technology, innovation and wellbeing, and founded the studio and consultancy MindWise in 2015. She teaches about the subject at Stanford University. Caitlin has advised global organizations including Google, Facebook, Oracle, TED, Evernote, University of San Francisco, ETH Zürich and the U.S. State Department. In September of 2020 she released the book Designing Wonder: Leading Transformative Experiences in Virtual Reality. She authored The Importance of Presence and The Art of Storytelling in VR as part of the XR Collaboration Global Resource Guide.

Caitlin has created and run numerous collaborative experiences in social XR, fusing presence, mindfulness, storytelling, curiosity and emotional intelligence. A Senior Strategist for the Virtual World Society, she is a writer and designer for digital therapeutic applications that incorporate haptics and biofeedback. After two decades of teaching and leadership experience, she authored Mindful By Design (Corwin Press, 2019). Caitlin helps individuals and teams navigate complexity and change, prioritizing mindful wellbeing, joy, creativity, wonder and awe.

post.post_content:
Ricardo (@mrdoob) is a self-taught computer-graphics programmer. Originally from Barcelona, he began his professional career alternating between roles as a designer and developer. In his spare time, his involvement in the demoscene set him on the path to learning graphics programming.

Combining his background as a designer and expertise in development, his work ranges from simple interactive digital toys — Google Gravity, Ball Pool and Harmony — to full featured experiences — The Johnny Cash Project, The Wilderness Downtown and ROME.

Nowadays, Ricardo spends most of his time developing open source libraries and tools — three.js, frame.js and stats.js — with the aim of making design and development simpler for everyone.

post.post_content:
LISI LINARES is the founder of LNRS PR+ XR TLNT MNGMNT, a boutique publicity and talent management agency that operates in stealth mode. All of the clients come word of mouth.

VR has been Lisi’s passion since she wrote her first VR script at NYU Film in 1994. Too early to start a career in VR, Lisi began making music. She recorded and released songs with influential label, Ze Records. Her music attracted the casting agent for SURVIVOR. She went on to appear as a castaway on season 14. Doing press junkets for CBS lead to a pointing point. “I really got into how a story is pitched and how the narrative of a character is shaped in the media”

In 2015, Lisi co-founded a public relations agency representing primarily Crypto and Blockchain projects. After premiering the first Anime on the blockchain, Vevara in Your Dream and working with some of the bigger projects in the space such as David Chaum’s Elixxir, Path Network and NGRAVE, it was time to move on.
During the summer of 2019 Lisi saw an opportunity to pivot into VR, the great love of her life! Starting with consulting AR start-ups, she quickly became immersed in the XR community. “I feel like I had found my tribe.”

March 2021, Lisi expanded her publicity services to include managing xr talent. She is actively bridging the gap between 20th and 21st century entertainment. Consulting talent agencies on how to prepare their talent roster was the inspiration behind XR TLNT MNGMNT.
Lisi is a proud Board Member of the Femme Futures Grant at Artizen and XR Women.

Stay tuned more to come...

post.post_content:
Jonathan (Jono) Brandel is an award winning graphic designer and computer programmer. He comes from mixed heritage, an American of Filipino and Polish descent. As such Jono pairs distinct subjects to frame the creative process. These combinations range from latin and emojis to lithography and pixel sorting. While pairings vary, there is an accessible tenor to the digital and physical objects he produces. This attention to detail allows people to access complex subject matters including positivism, the collision of black holes, and music composition with ease.

With a Bachelor’s in Design | Media Arts, a Minor in Latin from the University of California, Los Angeles, and a Master of Fine Arts in New Media from Paris College of Art, Jono’s work has been shown at international festivals including TED, Sundance, Tribeca Film Festival, SIGGRAPH, and the Japan Media Arts Festival. His commitment to Visual Music has sparked collaborations with musicians including applications with Lullatone, a live performance with Nosaj Thing, and interactive music videos for the likes of Matthew Dear, the Chemical Brothers, and Kimbra.
To develop his projects Jono writes custom software and actively participates in open source communities. He shares his own libraries such as the event driven two-dimensional drawing interface for the web, Two.js. This library and many others are freely available and actively maintained to help promote the creative expression of individuals worldwide.

post.post_content:
Brendan Andolsek Bradley is a multi-award winning actor, writer, director and producer known internationally as "America's Scrappy Storyteller" (AR Post) with 100+ IMDb credits, 50M+ views online and a leader in the virtual theater movement performing using groundbreaking XR/VR tools.

Brendan established The Integrative Technology Lab at New York University's Tisch School of the Arts to foster the next generation of multi-disciplinary live storytellers and during the pandemic, he began releasing free tutorials and case-studies for adopting ubiquitous streaming tools for live performance, including a customizable virtual theater in your web browser that allows anyone in the world to get back "on" stage for free. More at brendanAbradley.com/futurestages

He’s a business and creative development consultant to a wide variety of tech companies, and founder of Constant Change Media Group Inc., with strong ties to both the Toronto & Los Angeles markets. He is also the editor in-chief of IndieGameReviewer.com, an instructor in WebXR design at UCLA Extension and author of essays around spatial media for several books. Julie Smithson’s personal mission is to ‘inspire and educate people to think and act in a socially, economically and environmentally responsible way’.

It is through this lens as co-founder at MetaVRse, a 3D Web game engine for Business & XR development company.  Julie is leading enterprise companies to digitally transform and educate ways to immersive and remotely train users of the product/service. Julie guides her team to translate instructional language, interaction behaviors and curate knowledge testing gamification for businesses.  

Julie’s leadership is focused on transforming training & marketing into immersive experiences using technologies to design Web3 solutions, integration implementation and deployment to produce growth benefits, cost savings and human efficiencies.

Julie is also co-Chair of XRWomen.com , a global group of women who meet every Wednesday and learn about the applications of extended realities.  The group works to advocate, inspire and build communities aimed at inclusivity of gender equality, race and ethnicity in the digital sector and beyond.

She is the founder & CEO of Kai XR, which uses Metaverse technologies to develop critical 21st century skills in students preparing them for a rapidly evolving future. Kai also serves as Global Child Safety & Education Adviser for the XR Safety Initiative, XRSI.

Before creating Kai XR, she worked with several museums such as the United States Holocaust Memorial Museum as well as the Smithsonian National Museum of African American History & Culture, specializing in digital strategy and content creation.

post.post_content:
Blair MacIntyre is a Professor of Interactive Computing at Georgia Tech, where he has explored socio-technical issues surrounding AR and VR for more than 20 years. He has built authoring toolkits for media designers, deployed room-scale and handheld games and experiences, built AR-enabled web-browsers, helped lead the design of WebXR, and run online conferences using immersive social VR.

His experience spans all aspects of building, deploying, and evaluating AR and VR tools, systems, and experiences. He has been doing research in augmented reality since 1991, is actively involved with numerous conferences and workshops, speaks and consults regularly, and has published over 100 academic papers in the field.

post.post_content:
Brian Peiris has been sitting at the intersection of XR and the Web since 2013. An early backer of the original Oculus Rift kickstarter, he started experimenting with practical applications of VR, using his skils as a fullstack developer to build a JavaScript VR live-coding app that went viral. This lead to a job at AltspaceVR, a startup at the time, where he established their web-based SDK and developer community.

Brian now works at Mozilla as part of the Mozilla Hubs team, who have been building their virtual social platform since 2017.
post.post_excerpt: Brian Peiris has been sitting at the intersection of XR and the Web since 2013. An early backer of the original Oculus Rift kickstarter, he started experimenting with practical applications of VR, using his skils as a fullstack developer to build a JavaScript VR live-coding app that went viral. This lead to a job at AltspaceVR, a startup at the time, where he established their web-based SDK and developer community. Brian now works at Mozilla as part of the Mozilla Hubs team, who have been building their virtual social platform since 2017.

Tedx and Global speaker. Experienced Executive with strong leadership and strategic skills. Recently recognized as the 2013 "Business Person of the Year" by the Harlem Business Alliance for implementing innovative strategies for non-profit and for profit clients and exceeding objectives.

Back in 2014 Raanan had made his first contribution to Babylon.js - the web 3D engine. Since then he has continuously contributed to the open source framework as a community member. For the last year he has been working as a software developer @ Microsoft in the Babylon.js team. A major part of his time is invested in developing and maintaining Babylon's WebXR support. The rest of the time he is trying to configure build systems, fight React, and catch up on E-Mails.

He resides in Berlin, Germany, and enjoys playing multiplayer games with his family, making music, and practicing magic tricks that get him nowhere.

Back in 2014 Raanan had made his first contribution to Babylon.js - the web 3D engine. Since then he has continuously contributed to the open source framework as a community member. blurb:
This talk is about Babylon.js and its WebXR support. We will talk about the engine itself, the principals that guide us, and the way we see WebXR support and the decisions made when implementing it - simplicity, extensibility, and full support for advanced devs. 
We will see a few XR demos, see the tools the framework provides, talk a bit about Babylon native (cross-platform application development) and go over a few code snippets.
Satisfaction guarantied or your money back!

post.post_content:
Hi, I'm Dave Hill. I'm an Engineering Manager at Oculus/Facebook Reality Labs, supporting the Oculus Browser team and focusing on the web developer ecosystem as it relates to our headsets and our browser. Prior to joining Oculus, I spent time at Microsoft working on HoloLens, and on Xbox Kinect before that.

Before that, I spent a bunch of years working in game development working on gameplay, graphics, and engine programming.
post.post_excerpt: Hi, I'm Dave Hill. I'm an Engineering Manager at Oculus/Facebook Reality Labs, supporting the Oculus Browser team and focusing on the web developer ecosystem as it relates to our headsets and our browser. Prior to joining Oculus, I spent time at Microsoft working on HoloLens, and on Xbox Kinect before that. Before that, I spent a bunch of years working in game development working on gameplay, graphics, and engine programming.

blurb:
Oculus Browser and the Immersive Web:

In this talk, I'll discuss how the Oculus Browser team thinks about the WebXR developer ecosystem, where it is today and what we hope to see it grow into, where we're investing and why, and also share a bit about our upcoming roadmap.

post.post_content: Keith earned a Ph.D. in anthropology and used it to make a career introducing students to this field. After trying VR, he saw its potential in education and began making the VR museum AnVRopomotron to enhance the student experience. He continues to investigate ways that XR can enrich learning.
post.post_excerpt: Dr. Keith Chan received his Ph.D. in anthropology at the University of Missouri. He currently lives in San Diego, where he teaches biological anthropology in community colleges. Dr. Chan has always been interested in technology and finding new ways to use it in education, especially WebXR.

blurb: How does an educator with no VR experience make a virtual museum? Learn how the WebXR biological anthropology museum AnVRopomotron was built from the very basics of A-Frame and how some of the early stumbling blocks were overcome, including ways to fund the project.

post.post_content:
Sophia Moshasha is on a mission to accelerate the adoption of immersive & emerging technologies. Behind the scenes, on camera, and on stage, Sophia is a driving force behind numerous initiatives designed to advance knowledge and engagement with XR across all sectors.

As a producer of The Polys - WebXR Awards and host of its Virtual Red Carpet, Special Correspondent of the WebXR Summit Series and co-host of the VRARA podcast, Sophia has interviewed dozens of XR pioneers and innovators. As a fellow of MetaTr@versal, an initiative to advocate for cooperation among the stakeholders of the Metaverse on standards and interoperability, Sophia was the star of a 40 minute, 3-act play which was performed live on the Main Stage at AWE 2022, which featured a cast of industry heavyweights. She is a co-founder of XR Women, a global collective dedicated to the advancement of female representation in technology.  Sophia will host the WebXR Brand Summit on September 15.

Since 2018, Sophia has been the Vice President of the DC Chapter of the VR/AR Association’s Washington, D.C. Chapter. Sophia is also the co-founder and Chief Marketing Officer for Ready Player Golf, the first annual Virtual Reality Charity Golf Outing, which began in 2020, and has raised money for MSF (Doctors Without Borders) and XRSI (the XR Safety Initiative). She has served as Head of Partnerships for Brightline Interactive, XR Strategist for Virtual Reality Marketing, and in Executive Program support for AFWERX, the US Air Force’s Innovation Investment Program. 


Sophia has been influencing global networks through many years of active engagement in the XR community. She has been featured on prominent media outlets such as Forbes, ABC, CGTN, American Dream TV series and more She holds a Bachelor of Science from Virginia Commonwealth University. She is currently engaged in public policy planning for Meta.
post.post_excerpt:
Sophia is host and producer of the WebXR Brand Summit and
The Polys - WebXR Awards Virtual Red Carpet, Special Correspondent of WebXR Summit Series, Co-Founder of XR Women and Ready Player Golf, VP of the DC Chapter of VRARA, and co-host of the VRARA Podcast.

post.post_content:
After a combined 20 years of studying and teaching foreign languages, Michael McDonald created Gold Lotus which aims to demonstrate how virtual reality can support the learning and teaching of foreign languages.

Recent projects include the launch of the Handy English VR vocabulary-building app, a 24-hour VR English lesson and cultural event to raise funds for the fight against Covid and programs in schools around the world aimed at raising awareness of how VR can be used to develop language skills and cultural awareness, with particular focus on students building their own webXR spaces to share their local cultural heritage in a unique VR exchange program. His most recent course in partnership with VictoryXR has just concluded on the ENGAGE VR platform - Public Speaking in a Multicultural World.

https://www.goldlotus.co/ - website showing all the related projects and resources

https://www.youtube.com/vrenglishlessons - 150+ videos showing how to make the most of VR for language learning and teaching

Samantha Mathews is Founder & CEO; CTO of LOCI, a patented and neurologically proven safety training platform that transforms unstructured location and occupancy data into digital components that power a game engine that generates gamified content based on your environment. LOCI teaches people where to go and what to do to stay safe in places they visit and spend time regardless of age, language, or ability.

To Samantha, technology has always been a tool for connecting with people and improving lives. She builds by her belief that, instead of deepening our dependence on technology and letting it do the thinking for us, new systems should empower us to be more present, knowledgeable, and confident wherever we go.
post.post_excerpt:
Samantha hosted the
WebXR Business Summit 
on September 14, 2021

talk_description: Utilizing the web's ability to reach everyone on earth while also delivering stable immersive experiences calls for creativity, grit and patience. Perhaps with new protocols for decentralization, creator friendly game engines, lightweight headsets and digital twins we can collectively imagine an infrastructure that supports all visions of a shared immersive web.

post.post_content: Alban Denoyel is the co-founder of Sketchfab, the leading platform to publish and find 3D content online, now part of Epic Games. Prior to Sketchfab, he worked for 4 years in the 2D world of photography. He loves making 3D content with photogrammetry or VR sculpting. He graduated from ESSEC Business School (Paris, France).

Fabien Bénétou is a WebXR freelance developer currently working for UNICEF and the European Parliament. Based in Brussels, Belgium, Fabien is a Mozilla AFrame contributor driven by the need to make virtual and augmented reality understandable by anybody curious enough to try. He has organized events, given talks and lead dozens of professional workshops all around the world. His focus goes beyond the technology to the positive impact it can offer through privacy conscious methods to bring VR and AR innovations to the most wide possible audience. He is convinced that XR will become useful once used and challenged by the most diverse audience.

company: EU Parliament Innovation Lab; UNICEF Innovation Fund
talk_title: WebXR, from efficient prototyping to delivery at the European Parliament and for UNICEF startups
talk_description:
Is WebXR good enough today? Can you use your current tools? Do you need to hire new developers? What are all the efforts for?

Through case encounted prototyping for the European Parliament and supporting startups selected by the UNICEF Innovation Fund we will explore each of those tricky questions and more.

What business problems does WebXR solve today?

post.post_content:
Dr. Yu Yuan (Candidate for 2022 IEEE Standards Association President-Elect) is a visionary researcher, inventor, practitioner, and entrepreneur in the areas of Consumer Technology, Multimedia/VR/AR, Connected/Automated Vehicles, IoT, and Digital Transformation. He founded 0xSenses Corporation, a multinational technology company specializing in Virtual Reality.

Dedicated to \"Creating Better Worlds\" as its long-term vision, the company is developing technologies, infrastructures, ecosystems, and resources needed for massively multiplayer ultra-realistic virtual experiences. Prior to this he worked for IBM Research as a research scientist and was a key contributor to IBM\'s Cell Broadband Engine, Smarter Planet, and IoT initiative. He has been a passionate volunteer in various leadership positions at IEEE and other professional communities. His outstanding service in IEEE standards activities at different levels (working groups, standards committees, and governance at higher levels) has been widely appreciated by standards developers, individual members, and corporate members.

He has a Ph.D., an M.S., and a B.S. in Computer Science from Tsinghua University.

resources:
The IEEE Annual Election has now begun. You can submit your vote before 12:00 p.m. ET (1600 UTC-04) on 1 October to help determine the future volunteer leadership of IEEE.

As a candidate nominated by petition for 2022 IEEE Standards Association President-Elect, I am humbly inviting you to review and comment on my Detailed Plan If Elected, which is NOT included in the IEEE Annual Election website due to a word limit. While my Bio, IEEE Accomplishments and Activities, and Statement can all be found on both the IEEE Annual Election website and my personal website (https://yuyuan.info/), I do encourage you to visit and bookmark my personal website as it always includes the latest version of my Detailed Plan If Elected, and supports interactive discussions in the comments area.

post.post_content: Neil is VP Developer Ecosystems at NVIDIA, where he works to enable applications to take advantage of GPUs. Neil has been the elected President of the Khronos Group for over twenty years, where he initiated the OpenGL ES standard used by billions worldwide, helped catalyze the WebGL, Vulkan and OpenXR APIs for portable 3D and augmented and virtual reality, and the glTF run-time 3D asset format. Most recently Neil initiated and now Chairs the Metaverse Standards Forum with over 1,800 member companies.

Verónica Orvalho is the founder and CEO of Didimo. She has translated years of research, data science, and computer graphics expertise into a patented technology platform to create digital humans, empowering people to engage more authentically and humanly in digital spaces. This breakthrough provides the next evolution of how humans will engage the world around them.

Veronica earned a Ph.D. in Computer Graphics and is a professor at Porto University. She has lived and worked on three continents, with companies like IBM, Sony, Amazon, Universal Studios, and more.

Jason Lovell, PwC UK Head of XR Strategy

Jason\'s overriding focus is on helping clients across multiple industries understand, quantify, and implement the benefits of virtual reality and augmented reality technology, with a focus on deriving clear return on investment.

Passionate about articulating the real business value of emerging technologies, Jason has significant experience across consumer electronics & innovation in a variety of senior roles, including managing VR for Samsung UK, founding his own XR consultancy \'Captivate\', and managing EMEA brand partnerships for Jaunt XR.

Emilios Eracleous is the Specialist XR Recruiter & Co-Founder of Immersive Search, where he provides exceptional XR talent to businesses across the globe. Currently, his main focus is on addressing the skills gap in XR, by building a global network of talent and connecting them to the organizations that need them.

Emilios is a senior recruitment professional, who has a demonstrated track record of successfully delivering recruitment and retention solutions to a diverse client range, including industry leading organisations and start-ups.

post.post_content:
Dr. Karen Alexander is a sought-after consultant on building immersive learning programs with extensive connections across the XR industry and academia. Her experience spans partnering with community organizations on giving children and youth the opportunity to create with XR tools, guiding higher ed institutions through the process of XR adoption, advising ed tech and XR startups, and, in her role as an immersive learning consultant with MetaVRse, pioneering the translation of of 2D training into 3D experiences for enterprise. 

Dr. Alexander is a co-founder of XR Women, a worldwide network of professionals that meet weekly in virtual worlds and where a distinguished list of XR industry speakers has appeared. As part of the team that produces The Polys - WebXR Awards, WebXR Summit Series, and MetaTr@versal, she has worked with some of the most influential thought leaders in spatial computing. Bringing her passion for metaverse literacy back to her academic roots, Dr. Alexander is host of the WebXR Education Summit, assembling a diverse array of practitioners to share knowledge on successful implementation of immersive learning. She is also a member of the Immersive Learning Research Network’s State of XR and Immersive Learning Expert Panel. 

Prior to her work in XR, Dr. Alexander was Dean of Junior and Senior Year programs at the women’s college at Rutgers University and Senior Editor of Signs: Journal of Women and Culture in Society. Her experience in higher education ranges across teaching, program design, journal editing, and college administration, with specializations in art, literature, film, and cultural production. Dr. Alexander is committed to women’s advancement and gender and racial equality and believes in a Humanity First approach to XR and the metaverse. She holds master’s degrees in English, Philosophy, and Issues in Modern Culture and earned her PhD. at the University of London.

post.post_content:
Christopher Lafayette is an emergent technologist in XR applying his talents to Medtech, FinTech, Climate and applied sciences.

He is working for a more equitable future in technology serving as a Silicon Valley national and international speaker, thought leader and a culture advocate.

Alex Howland, Ph.D., is president and co-founder of Virbela, a virtual world platform for remote work, learning, and events. Howland created Virbela in 2012, before it was purchased and made public by eXp World Holdings in 2018.

Virbela’s mission is to help organizations and people thrive in a remote-first future. Alex leads the development of Virbela’s products and services -- continuing to expand the platform to accommodate not just business workspaces, but classrooms, event spaces, and recreational areas as well.

Prior to co-founding Virbela, Howland was an instructor in the Psychology Department at University of California, San Diego, where he taught Industrial and Organizational Psychology to undergraduate students. His expertise in organizational psychology gives him a unique perspective on creating virtual work and education spaces. He designed Virbela specifically to create a unique virtual experience where users feel psychologically safe and are more likely to collaborate, brainstorm, and succeed.

Howland has a bachelor of science in psychology from Providence College, and his Ph.D. in organizational psychology from Alliant International University, San Diego.

Vivian is the CEO of Red Threads and former Global Head of Digital Sales at NexTech AR Solutions, one Canada's fastest-growing publicly traded technology companies in digital experience and augmented reality. With 20 years of experience creating monetization strategies for emerging technology, she has helped scale three high-growth startups and served on the merger & acquisitions committee at VMware.

Vivian is a lauded Ecosystem builder — she is Globe and Mail’s Top 50 Executive and a YWCA Women of Distinction Nominee in 2021.

As the CMO and Co-Founder of Reflective Brands, Nisha has a robust collection of skills pertaining to the media industry, digital marketing, and branding. Nisha specializes in helping companies elevate their brand identity and accomplish their goals through custom immersive experiences using VR/AR, strategic branding, and transmedia marketing. She is also a skilled filmmaker and currently she serves on the executive board of the OMPA the top trade organization for media production professionals in Oregon.

With over 15 years of experience in this field, Nisha brings expertise in utilizing the power of storytelling and cutting-edge technologies to get exceptional marketing results.

Caspar Thykier is the co-founder and CEO of Zappar, an augmented reality platform and creative studio on a mission to democratize immersive technology.

Caspar and the Zappar team have been pioneers in the AR space for the last decade and have worked with the world’s leading brands to deploy innovative and market-leading AR solutions across the mobile web and native apps.

Prior to founding Zappar, Caspar spent 15 years as an account director and managing director of major advertising agencies, including one where he was a founding partner.

Ben is a passionate product leader for Augmented Reality and boundary mediums in general. His experience spans Interactive Television, Gaming, Experiential entertainment, Lightfield VR and Augmented Reality.
Nick provides strategic leadership to clients and the production team across Dreamwave and Active Theory projects.

Artur Sychov is Founder and CEO of Somnium Space. He has been navigating virtual worlds for more than two decades starting with Ultima Online in 1999, then Second Life and many more. Artur strongly believes in the ultimate future of Virtual Reality worlds with open and decentralized economy.

post.post_content: With experience in several startups, publishing and ad products, Luke was well equipped to join Brave in 2016 to begin developing new business models with privacy and blockchain. A co-author of the Basic Attention Token white paper, and core BAT team member Luke leads Business Operations at Brave and BAT, bringing new solutions to market that include privacy by default, backed with the benefits and empowerment that blockchain brings to web3.

Amy Peck is the Founder & CEO of EndeavorXR, a leading global XR strategy & consulting firm. She is a recognized thought-leader in the space and speaks globally on the future of XR and exponential technologies.
Amy holds multiple Advisory Board roles and is a Venture Partner at the Capital Region XR
Accelerator. She is Co-chair of Prospera Women, a global organization supporting female-led
startups and was Founding Co-chair of the VRAR Association Enterprise Committee.
She actively mentors entrepreneurs and is a member of several Women in Tech, Venture-backed Accelerators & STEM Education organizations.

Through EndeavorVR, she works with Fortune 500 companies and tech startups on XR strategy, content, development, product and GTM.

Her own personal mission is to see technology accessible to all - fundamentally improving every aspect of our lives and elevating the way we work, learn, communicate and play.

Jamie is the CEO and founder of Outlier Ventures. He was an early investor in Bitcoin and Ethereum and founded Outlier Ventures, the Web 3.0 startup accelerator, in 2014. He is an active collector of NFTs and a passionate proponent of the Open Metaverse theory (you can read the thesis: https://outlierventures.io/research/the-open-metaverse-os/). The Open Metaverse thesis was created early 2021 after months of development, and acts as a toolkit to design alternatives based on principles of user centricity and sovereignty of identity, data and wealth.

Jamie is an active media commentator and has spoken on stages across the world about the breadth of opportunity Ethereum posses to serve as the foundation for the next generation of the internet. He is an active collector of NFTs, co-founding 100xARt, a community of the Top 200 collectors and has helped launch the world\'s first d-zine, NFTs.WTF, an independent NFT media property owned and controlled by a DAO of 100 industry leaders, creatives and influencers.

Arome Ibrahim is a passionate 360° Virtual Reality Developer, Product Manager (XR), Digital Media Arts Creator and Impact Entrepreneur who strongly believes in utilising technology, more broadly, innovation to build and grow impact-based solutions in Africa.

He co-founded Experis Immersive - An Extended Reality (XR) content development agency creating immersive, innovative, and interactive experiences.

Arome is the team lead at Immersive Tech Africa, a creative non-profit organisation that leverages Extended Reality (XR) technologies to create impact-driven experiences and solutions that inspire global action toward the UN Sustainable Development Goals.

talk_title: Leveraging Digital Twins For Businesses in Africa via WebXR
talk_description: I will be sharing how Digital Twins are adopted by businesses in the various industries across Africa and how the technology helps companies improve the customer experience by better understanding customer needs, develop enhancements to existing products, operations, and services, and how its helping drive innovation on the continent.

post.post_content:
Danny Stefanic is the creator of the world\'s first metaverse-for-business platform, spawning both MootUp for virtual events and LearnBrite for simulation and training. He is the inventor of the first 3D metaverse ExitReality, founder of the International Virtual Reality Association and chairman of the virtual worlds social network Koinup.

Called a "visionary" by his peers and deemed by Wall Street CIOs and Silicon Valley VCs to be "one of the pioneers in his field", he has been creating ground-breaking 3D businesses for over 29 years. Danny actively works with young businesses to share his experiences and give back to the community. He has assisted companies with angel investment, international licensing, acquisitions, exits, managing distributed teams and has personally closed IP acquisitions valued at $85MM.

post.post_content:
Samantha Mathews is Founder & CEO; CTO of LOCI, a patented and neurologically proven safety training platform that transforms unstructured location and occupancy data into digital components that power a game engine that generates gamified content based on your environment. LOCI teaches people where to go and what to do to stay safe in places they visit and spend time regardless of age, language, or ability.

To Samantha, technology has always been a tool for connecting with people and improving lives. She builds by her belief that, instead of deepening our dependence on technology and letting it do the thinking for us, new systems should empower us to be more present, knowledgeable, and confident wherever we go.

talk_description: Utilizing the web's ability to reach everyone on earth while also delivering stable immersive experiences calls for creativity, grit and patience. post.post_content:
Dulce Baerga has been producing interactive content for over 20 years. Building sites ranging from entertainment based portals to product based community sites. She’s a self-taught full stack developer, front-end engineer and network/IT manager who’s passionate about augmented reality and virtual reality platforms. Her skill set includes developing concepts, programming demos, creating UI/UX design, scripting user interactivity, building 3D simulations, creating virtual products, and building webXR apps.

She’s also an active resident of multiple virtual worlds, top prize winner at XR related hackathons, and deeply embedded in the XR community. Dulce is currently pushing the edges of the immersive web and augmented reality, creating XR MVPs for clients and collaboration projects. Immersive theater and mixed reality storytelling are two verticals of focus where she’s been creating production pipelines and UI/UX mechanics. Iterating on and streamlining new XR pipelines to create base MVPs is Dulce’s primary directive while pushing the XR envelope.

Conceptual artist who creates multilayered installations, performances, and experiences with the express intent of elevating his audience to a sublime state. Challenging the relationship between art and spectator Morris’ work is typically equal parts technical, playful, inventive and rich with depth. From Le Louvre to Lady Gaga from Cirque Du Soleil to the Metropolitan Opera, his work has been praised by NY Times, Wall Street Journal, LA Times, Rolling Stone, NBC, VICE, Wired.... Highlight works include; *[NOWHERE](http://www.urnowhere.com/)*, reimagining online gathering; [*Reflecting the Stars*](http://thewindmillfactory.com/?portfolio=reflecting-the-stars), recreating the night sky in the Hudson River; [Choreographing Nine Inch Nails](http://thewindmillfactory.com/?portfolio=nine-inch-nails-festival-tour) Festival Tour; [*Pixel Forest*](http://thewindmillfactory.com/?portfolio=pixel-forest), voice-illuminated balloon forest; [*The Wedge*](https://thewindmillfactory.com/portfolio/interactive-art-installation-burning-man-wedge/), a legendary slide/aerial-performance-center at Burning Man.

In addition to founding [The Windmill Factory](http://www.thewindmillfactory.com), Jon has performed and created with Fuerzabruta, Cirque du Soleil, The MET, Theatre de la Jeune Lune, Patrice Chereau, Robert Wilson, Tina Landau, Aszure Barton, Spymonkey, Diavolo Dance Theatre, Ken Roht’s Orphean Circus, Fabulous Monsters and Jay Scheib.  He has been featured in films by Jonathan Dayton and Valari Faris, David Michalek, and Anson Mount and starred in various national commercials and innumerable embarrassing gigs.

He has been a Thomas J. Watson Fellow, Kinnernet-Europe Experience Director, LaMaMa ETC Artist in residence, Watermill Center Fellow, Tennessee Williams Fellow, NCAA Post Graduate Scholar, 6-time All-American Springboard Diver, and holds a B.A. from the University of the South, Sewanee.  Jon has taught master classes at Harvard, NYU, Columbia, Pace, The University of The South, Vanderbilt.

Keram founded both VRTO & FIVARS in 2015. He’s a business and creative development consultant to a wide variety of tech companies, and founder of Constant Change Media Group Inc., with strong ties to both the Toronto & Los Angeles markets. He is also the editor in-chief of IndieGameReviewer.com, an instructor in WebXR design at UCLA Extension and author of essays around spatial media for several books. He won Creator of the Year at the 2022 Poly Awards, was named one of the Top 100 Original Voices in XR in 2021, and contributed to the 2022 PEW Research report on the Metaverse in 2040.
