post.post_content: Gabe is a product manager and developer who has worked somewhere at the intersection of education, immersive technology, and collaborative tools for the past 10 years. He lives in Southern California, creates instrumental music in his free time, and enjoys working with curious, passionate people.

Christi Fenison is an immersive storyteller, 3D artist, 360 videographer and simulation designer.
Her passion is creating XR experiences that expand perspectives and inspire action. Drawing on principles of narrative transport, cognitive elaboration and the sense of presence, she works to bring big picture ideas to life via the careful interplay of meaningful details.

By day, Christi works as an XR Instructional Media Producer at UNC School of Medicine IT, focused on the research, development and integration of XR training simulations in curriculum. Beyond the classroom, she is also a bespoke World Builder for Social VR events, crafting custom experiences tailored to each client’s vision and goals.

Christi received her Master's degree from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill’s Environment and Science Communication program, where focused on Emerging Technologies, 3D Modeling + Unity Development, Green Architecture + Sustainable Design, Geospatial Information Systems, and Immersive Journalism.

company: Cause + Christi Immersive XR Design; UNC School of Medicine IT
resources: Please see www.causechristi.com for a portfolio of past VR worlds.

post.post_content:
Doug is a co-founder of Big Rock Creative, a XR company producing large
scale events in VR. Big Rock’s first large project, BRCvr, created a fully
immersive Burning Man festival in social VR starting in 2020 which generated
much positive PR including an article in Wired Magazine. Big Rock Creative
won the Producer's Guild innovation award and the Aurea Award. He has
since worked on projects ranging from directing an XR music video featuring
Pitbull, facilitating a Hollywood red carpet premiere in VR or creative directing
the VR version of "Breonna's Garden" that premiered in SXSW 2022.
Doug’s background is in the film industry, he graduated from USC film school
in the 90s with honors. Over the course of his career, he has written,
directed, produced, and edited several festival award-winning narratives and
documentaries. His most notorious documentary features the Burning Man
festival called, “Journey to the flames” which has been screened nationally
and internationally. Some other feature-length docs include “Faire: An
American Renaissance” and “The Secret Lives of Adult Stars”, and co-edited
the award-winning short doc “Selling Lies”.

post.post_excerpt:
Linda is a Producer and co-host of the WebXR Summit Series,
Creator of The Poly Trophy, and 
WebXR Summit 3D Models.

post.post_content:
Han Kim is an attorney in the Entertainment, Technology and Advertising Practice Group at SheppardMullin.

Han’s practice focuses on transactional entertainment matters that span from the cutting-edge intersection of technology and entertainment to traditional entertainment industries. He advises clients on business transactions related to music, television, feature film, podcast, metaverse (VR/AR), blockchain/NFTs, esports and games.

Forward-thinking and entrepreneurial by nature, Han works closely with companies, talents, producers, and entrepreneurs that disrupt, and bring innovations to, various entertainment industries. Han provides added value to his clients’ work by structuring novel business models, presenting practical risk management solutions for their operations, and leveraging his industry relationships.

Cynthia Maller is Head of 3D Creative Technology at Walmart, and three of its digitally-native brands: Hayneedle, Art.com and Allswell. She is also a Certified Emotional Intelligence (EQ) Practitioner. Her focus is strengthening and scaling the three pillars of 3D in retail: inspiring aesthetics, visual integrity and operational excellence. She believes that every one of us has the talent and capability to add value to immersive commerce, and to be a builder, a citizen and a purveyor in the Metaverse. This drives her commitment to peer education, advocacy and invention. When she’s not at work, she’s on the ice, feeding her passion for figure skating. Her drive to try new things, to push herself, both in commerce technology and on the ice, is guided by the words of Erin Hanson, “What if I fall? Oh, but my darling, What if you fly?

Gregg is a media entrepreneur, speaker, educator, and business and marketing strategist with experience in extended reality, virtual world events, location-based entertainment, and emerging media and technologies.

Gregg is currently serving as Senior Vice-President of U.S. Operations / Partner, of HOLOGATE, the world’s most successful immersive media company for location-based entertainment with 13,000,000+ players-to-date across 38 countries around the globe; Co-Vice Chair of the Producers Guild of America ‘New Media Council’ (2nd Term); and Partner and Co-Event Director of DreamlandXR. He also an advisory board member of SXSW ‘Pitch’; ‘Kollab’, which supports thousands of LA youth of the Boys and Girls Clubs of America; and the Cal State University Entertainment Alliance (CSUEA). Previously, Gregg was Chief Strategist / Evangelist at ‘Unofficial Cardboard’, the pioneering and leading Google-Certified producer of ‘Google Cardboard VR’.

Gregg’s speaking engagements include the Augmented World Expo (AWE), Consumer Electronic Show (CES), Game Developer’s Conference (GDC); National Association of Broadcasters (NAB); Dubai Game Conference, Comic-Con, WonderCon, IBC Show | Amsterdam, SIGGRAPH, SXSW, Mobile World Congress, VR/AR Global Summit, Amusement Expo/VR Summit, G2E-Global Game Expo, and many others.

company: HOLOGATE; The Producers Guild of America 'New Media Council'

post.post_content: Brian currently leads the Production Services group at The Mars Agency, which is comprised of a robust team of production design, finishing, retouching, asset management, execution and print production.  He has over 20 years of experience in leading executions for some of the largest CPG\'s and retailers in the industry, both from the lense of the agency, as well as the solution provider.  Brian also leads the Disruptive Technologies & Innovation group, focusing on Metaverse, NFTs and Augmented Reality experiences and commerce. Brian has been with the agency for the past 2 years and is based out of Atlanta, GA.

Winslow Porter is an award-winning director, producer and creative technologist specializing in virtual/augmented reality as well as large-scale immersive installations. Winslow formed the pioneering, new media studio the New Reality Company in 2016, creating the critically-acclaimed cinematic VR experiences Giant and Tree. Shortly after, he was named Adweek’s Top 100 creatives as digital innovators and a designer-in-residence at A/D/O. In 2018, Tree won the Lumiere for Best Location Based VR Short as well as 7 other notable awards after being shown at over 100 notable conferences and festivals such as TED, UN General Assembly, Davos and Gardens By The Bay. He is currently a Cultural Leader at the World Economic Forum, a mentor in residence at the New Museum Incubator, an adjunct NYU Tisch professor, a founding member of the Onassis Institute’s ONX art/tech accelerator, as well as a creative director and creative tech consultant at R/GA Global. Winslow’s new immersive AR experience Rainforest, which received an Epic Games MegaGrant, transforms participant’s settings into their own private jungle environment to elucidate pressing concepts and concerns of sustainability and conservation. Winslow is also an artist in residence at the Smallhold Mushroom farm in Brooklyn, creating Forager, an immersive experience of the life-cycle of a mushroom, featuring the first volumetric time-lapse inside a game engine.

Amanda’s recent endeavors have lead her to join forces with the Web3 powerhouse DAO, XLA, as Director of Events and lead in experiential marketing. XLA’s mission is to democratize wealth building and revenue distribution for IP creators, owners, and holders by empowering them through the power of Web 3.0 based technologies.

She is the visionary behind 150+ innovative technological events of the past decade, providing the leading curated event platforms for groundbreaking artists, film, immersive media, blockchain technologies, space exploration, motion capture innovation, and other emerging technologies now converging and evolving to create experiences and brands into the metaverse.

Amanda Pool is the Founder of Imagine Global Marketing and Imagine Events Services, producing and executing over 150 individual events in technology, film and music over the last 5+ years. Imagine was Agency of Record for the IBC Convention, Europe’s largest media trade show (curating the schedule for the Future Reality Zone); Agency of Record for the Advanced Imaging Society (producing and curating “On the Lot” at Paramount Studios for three consecutive years). Imagine also produced Eveleigh Social House, VR On the Mountain, and The Fly Lounge at Sundance Film Festival and the Lumiere Awards. She has produced events at Coachella, EDC, NAB, CES, Toronto International Film Festival, Festival de Cannes, and many more.

Julie Smithson’s personal mission is to ‘inspire and educate people to think and act in a socially, economically and environmentally responsible way’.

It is through this lens as co-founder at MetaVRse, a 3D Web game engine for Business & XR development company.  Julie is leading enterprise companies to digitally transform and educate ways to immersive and remotely train users of the product/service. Julie guides her team to translate instructional language, interaction behaviors and curate knowledge testing gamification for businesses.  

Julie’s leadership is focused on transforming training & marketing into immersive experiences using technologies to design Web3 solutions, integration implementation and deployment to produce growth benefits, cost savings and human efficiencies.

Julie is also co-Chair of XRWomen.com , a global group of women who meet every Wednesday and learn about the applications of extended realities.  The group works to advocate, inspire and build communities aimed at inclusivity of gender equality, race and ethnicity in the digital sector and beyond.  

Julie is the host of the XR For Learning podcast. Julie also leads XR Collaboration, a coalition supporting human connectivity through digital presence in platforms building communication and collaboration.  Julie is also founder of XR Ignite to support the innovation and entrepreneurship of our communities. She also sits on panels and in leading conversations about interoperability standards and alignments with Khronos Group and MetaTr@versal.  

Previous to MetaVRse, Julie was Co-Founder of Emulator, the World’s most advanced DJ system, which won the prestigious 2011 DJ Mag Innovative Product Award.  She scored a $500K deal on the hit TV show Dragons’ Den. 

Julie is the co-host of the WebXR Summit series and a renowned speaker on XR and Produced TEDx Toronto (2010) and introduced coding in VR at Canada Learns Code (2017). She is past-President of the VRARA Toronto Chapter and Former Chair of the VRARA Education and Student Committees. Most recently Julie presented with the YPO, Harvard and 1Society about changing the way we learn and teach using spatial technologies.

blurb: Building conversation from higher education, experiences and around Education access, implementation and curation of WebXR experiences

post.post_content:
Sophia Moshasha is on a mission to accelerate the adoption of immersive & emerging technologies. Behind the scenes, on camera, and on stage, Sophia is a driving force behind numerous initiatives designed to advance knowledge and engagement with XR across all sectors.

As a producer of The Polys - WebXR Awards and host of its Virtual Red Carpet, Special Correspondent of the WebXR Summit Series and co-host of the VRARA podcast, Sophia has interviewed dozens of XR pioneers and innovators. As a fellow of MetaTr@versal, an initiative to advocate for cooperation among the stakeholders of the Metaverse on standards and interoperability, Sophia was the star of a 40 minute, 3-act play which was performed live on the Main Stage at AWE 2022, which featured a cast of industry heavyweights. She is a co-founder of XR Women, a global collective dedicated to the advancement of female representation in technology.  Sophia will host the WebXR Brand Summit on September 15.

Since 2018, Sophia has been the Vice President of the DC Chapter of the VR/AR Association’s Washington, D.C. Chapter. Sophia is also the co-founder and Chief Marketing Officer for Ready Player Golf, the first annual Virtual Reality Charity Golf Outing, which began in 2020, and has raised money for MSF (Doctors Without Borders) and XRSI (the XR Safety Initiative). She has served as Head of Partnerships for Brightline Interactive, XR Strategist for Virtual Reality Marketing, and in Executive Program support for AFWERX, the US Air Force’s Innovation Investment Program. 


Sophia has been influencing global networks through many years of active engagement in the XR community. She has been featured on prominent media outlets such as Forbes, ABC, CGTN, American Dream TV series and more She holds a Bachelor of Science from Virginia Commonwealth University. She is currently engaged in public policy planning for Meta.
post.post_excerpt:
Sophia is host and producer of the WebXR Brand Summit and
The Polys - WebXR Awards Virtual Red Carpet, Special Correspondent of WebXR Summit Series, Co-Founder of XR Women and Ready Player Golf, VP of the DC Chapter of VRARA, and co-host of the VRARA Podcast.

post.post_content:
Today I lead storytelling and digital design within the challenging demands of a sales organization, while advising brand managers and brand design representatives globally on campaign execution excellence, be it via internal workforce or external agencies alike.

Growing up in Switzerland in a trilingual household, I learned about ideating, developing and executing on creative and social selling at a very young age. It’s what drives me of being a business driven, passionate and flexible solution leader today. I love to brainstorm with my team, as well as engage management in any group-wide, fast moving environment, often beyond borders and continents.

It’s what drove me to study in Los Angeles at the ArtCenter College of Design, after which I ended up spending 10 years on the West Coast to help my clients and employers excel in brand strategy, design evolution and concept development. Be it independent compilations of research, trend studies, market analysis or any design related concept development and design system, I love presenting strategic plans to executive boards as well as getting my peers fired up for it.

Innovation is my passion. I love to fuel creativity and brainstorm ideas. I enjoy abstract analysis and discover new ways to foster solutions. I thrive on blazing fresh trails, come up with the most viable product for the challenges at hand and then convince leaders to boldly move forward.

post.post_content:
James Kaplan is the Co-Founder and CEO of MeetKai Inc., a Conversational AI and metaverse company shaping the next-gen of artificial speech intelligence. He founded the startup with Co-Founder and Chairwoman, Weili Dai, after becoming frustrated with the limitations of current automated assistants. Kaplan has had a true passion for AI and coding since he was six and wrote his first bots at only nine years old, including the first Pokemon Go bot and many others still popular to this day.

Now his pioneering work puts MeetKai in competition with the largest names in tech. MeetKai Inc. was listed by Forbes as a “Tech Company Leading the Way” and has powered AI solutions for more than 20M people around the world. Kaplan studied Computer Science at Harvey Mudd College in Claremont, CA and currently resides in the Los Angeles area.

Ben Erwin’s work is dedicated to the advancement of the XR industry through recognition of its pioneers and events that provide an advocacy platform for thought leaders. He is a passionate proponent for cooperation on standards for the Metaverse.

As an Internet frontiersman since the 1990s, Ben has served as a developer and as an executive for digital media agencies creating data driven interactives for dozens of major brands. For 13 years, he was a webmaster and consultant for the United Nations humanitarian section and partner NGOs, bringing awareness to the plight of women and children in conflict areas around the world. Before the internet, Ben began his career in the entertainment and music industry.

Ben is a digital polymath with decades of experience in marketing, management, programming, video editing, and writing. Influenced by his years as a veteran of the browser wars, he has teamed up with XR industry leadership to produce the MetaTr@versal series of events. These events are designed to galvanize the community around cooperation on the development and adoption of open standards and platform interoperability for the Metaverse.

Ben believes passionately in the potential of immersive content as a positive means for evolved human communication, particularly in civics, journalism, and education. Through shining a light on the good works of innovators, he aims to help preserve their legacy and inspire others to build upon their work.

He is the creator of The Polys - WebXR Awards, WebXR Summit Series, and MetaTr@versal which have impacted the industry by catalyzing awareness of, and engagement with the immersive web.

talk_description: Welcoming our worldwide audience to the WebXR community and thanking our team, our sponsors and our speakers.

post.post_content:
Daniel Dyboski-Bryant is a humanitarian committed to XR for good. His personal mission is to explore, drive and share the development and application of benevolent and meaningful and impactful experiences with emerging technologies. 

Daniel is the Executive Director of the Virtual World Society - a US non-profit - leading their mission to inspire and enable people to thrive, solve problems and create positive impact with emerging technologies. Since 2015, the VWS has run projects around the globe with families, schools and communities; has recognised and celebrated achievements in the XR community; and has contributed thought leadership to the industry.

Daniel co-founded Educators in VR in 2018 to bring together a global community of 3500 educators pioneering the integration of VR for learning, teaching and beyond. He specializes in R.I.S.E. - Remote Immersive Synchronous Experiences and Education. Educators in VR has run more than 3000 virtual events, workshops, presentations and conferences. In Feb 2020, two weeks before Covid 19 arrived, Educators in VR hosted the 2020 International Educators in VR Summit - a 6-day, 24/7, fully immersive VR conference on 5 platforms with 170 speakers, 150 events and 95% CO2 saving compared with a real-world conference. In May 2021 they ran a similar 30-day conference on 20 immersive VR platforms. Daniel will host the WebXR Production Summit on October 13.

Daniel has been an educator for 25 years, teaching languages, entrepreneurship and innovation and training trainers at colleges, universities and corporations in Germany, England, Wales and online. At Coleg Menai Daniel built and led an immersive learning Lab where he used VR to engage with migrant workers and refugees for which he won Inspire Tutor of the Year award in 2020.
post.post_excerpt:
Daniel is the host of the WebXR Production Summit and
Co-Founder of Educators in VR

talk_description:
Co-founders of Educators in VR Lorelle VanFossen and Daniel Dyboski-Bryant share their extensive experience bringing people together in VR to explore and experience XR immersive education. They\'ve produced over 3,000 educational VR events, workshops, classes, and conferences, bringing a unique perceptive to the potential of XR education and VR events. 

Educators in VR was founded by Lorelle VanFossen and Daniel Dyboski-Bryant in 2018 with the mission to integrate XR immersive technology into education, training, research, and business. The company has grown to over 3,000 global members and supports over 25 special interest groups they call teams, exploring XR industry verticals and niches. Over 60,000 participants have attended their thousands of free and paid events across multiple social VR platforms.

post.post_content:
Jon Gress
CEO
The Metaverse Construction Company LLC

With over 30 years of experience in motion picture, visual effects, immersive media technologies, production and education, Jon Gress has been on the cutting edge of digital production technologies since their inceptions and has done research, development, consulting and training for VFX, Immersive,
Real-time, 3D, CGI, 360 Degree, Virtual Reality (VR), Augmented Reality (AR), Stereoscopic 3D,
Photogrammetry, Dense Mapping, 3D Scanning, 3D Printing, Motion Tracking, Motion Control, Motion Capture, Live Action/Real-Time Animation, Game Engine VFX Integration for Motion Pictures, TV, Internet Media, Marketing & Advertising, Communications and Education.

The Metaverse Construction Company LLC provides clients with turn-key, next-gen, fully immersive, real-time virtual environments for multi-user events, meetings, trainings, showrooms, enterprise, education, entertainment and other Metaverse experiences.

Jon has trained thousands of filmmakers and visual effects artists from all over the world, who have gone on from his training to secure jobs in top visual effects companies and have worked on blockbuster movies and award winning television series including:

24, 47 Ronin, Almost Human, Ant Man, Assassin's Creed, Captain America, Conan The Barbarian, CSI, Die Hard, Dredd, Fringe, Game of Thrones, GI Joe, Godzilla, Hansel and Gretel: Witch Hunters, Harry Potter, Hawaii Five-O, Hugo, Iron Man, James Bond, John Carter, Life of Pi, Lost, MIB 3, Mirror Mirror, Narnia,
Need for Speed, Oblivion, Olympus Has Fallen, Oz, Pacific Rim, Pirates of the Caribbean, Riddick, RIPD, Serenity, Snow White and the Huntsman, Spiderman, Stolen, Superman, Star Trek, Star Wars, Terra Nova, The Avengers, The Curious Case of Benjamin Button, The Expendables, The Fast and the Furious,
The Great Gatsby, The Green Hornet, The Green Lantern, The Hobbit, The Hulk, The Hunger Games, The Mechanic, The Twilight Saga, The Walking Dead, The Wolf of Wall Street, Thor, Titanic, Total Recall, Transformers, White House Down, Wolverine, X-Men, and many many more). ( <---feel free to pare this list down, this was what was on my Author bio) Jon is a member of The Visual Effects Society (a global professional honorary society and the entertainment industry’s only organization representing the full breadth of visual effects practitioners with over 4,000 members in more than 40 countries worldwide), co-chair for the global VRARA Universities & Colleges Committee, member of the Virtual Worlds Society and Themed Entertainments Association, a published Pearson Higher Education author ("Digital Visual Effects & Compositing", the complete college curriculum textbook & instructor’s guide used in colleges all over the world), has been a regular writer/columnist for motion picture industry trade publications and has produced, been a keynote speaker & evangelist for motion picture visual effects and immersive production technologies, directed and supervised hundreds of motion picture, television, VFX and cutting edge interactive multimedia & immersive productions (for institutions ranging from small independent to Fortune 100) since 1995. Jon was previously the Academic Director for The Digital Animation & Visual Effects School at Universal Studios, Orlando FL bringing them decades of expertise, research and development in cutting edge motion picture visual effects, real-time, immersive, and visualization technologies such as 3D Stereoscopic Imaging, 3D Photogrammetry, 360 & 180 VR photo/video, 3D motion tracking, capture & motion control, the integration of these into real-time visualization, VR, AR, MxR & Virtual Production development for Motion Pictures, Games, 3D Visual Effects and Fully Immersive Virtual Environments.

Brian is a Developer Advocate at Igalia, as well as Original Co-author/Co-signer of The Extensible Web Manifesto. He is active in Web standards, sitting on many working groups and is co-chair of the MathML Working Group, Co-Founder/Chair, W3C Extensible Web CG Member, as well as the AC Representative to the W3C (formerly OpenJS Foundation and now Igalia). He is a blogger and speaker on many web topics.

talk_description: Introducing Wolvic XR, the next evolution of the open source Firefox Reality browser.  In this talk we\'ll focus on introducing what it is, where it is going, and what makes it interesting and important.

post.post_content: Neil is VP Developer Ecosystems at NVIDIA, where he works to enable applications to take advantage of GPUs. Neil has been the elected President of the Khronos Group for over twenty years, where he initiated the OpenGL ES standard used by billions worldwide, helped catalyze the WebGL, Vulkan and OpenXR APIs for portable 3D and augmented and virtual reality, and the glTF run-time 3D asset format. Most recently Neil initiated and now Chairs the Metaverse Standards Forum with over 1,800 member companies.

post.post_content: Terry works in Group Partnering and Devices serving all global business units and natcos with strategy, partner management, technology and trend scouting, technical research and developer engagement. He focuses on metaverse topics: spatial computing, 5G, edge computing, AI, cryptocurrency, NFTs and related emerging technologies. Terry leads Deutsche Telekom’s XR hardware and software scouting and metaverse ecosystem activities with key global partners. As an official Telekom Ambassador he brings the passion and spirit of #TeamMagenta to everyone!

Eve Weston believes in storytelling as a force for positive change. Weston is writer/director of the award-winning world’s first 360VR immersive sitcom, The BizNest (bit.ly/TLCBizNest). She is also a published expert in XR narrative, author of the taxonomy for immersive POV and a professor of VR filmmaking, TV writing and immersive storytelling at top-ranked film schools.
As CEO of Metaverse Talent Group, she provides real people for virtual worlds, connecting businesses of all kinds with experienced individuals who can host, perform, sell, and represent their business in the metaverse. Learn more at www.castingthemetaverse.com.
Weston is co-founder of TheLook.Club, the first searchable database of immersive narrative, which also features a review show. Weston’s speaking engagements include Stanford University, SIGGRAPH and the Academy of Television Arts and Sciences of Emmys fame.
An award-winning journalist, Weston has written about VR for Ms. Magazine and The New York Post. A produced television writer, she’s written and developed for several ABC/Disney channels and shows, including Wizards of Waverly Place - where she wrote and choreographed a viral YouTube sensation for Selena Gomez. Weston is an alumna of Princeton, USC and Goldman Sachs. Follow her at https://medium.com/@eveweston for cutting-edge insights.

company: Exelauno; LA Film School & Chapman University

post.post_content:
Peabody field builder winner Nonny de la Peña is the program director of ASU’s center for Emerging Media and Narrative, where she leads a best-in-class research and graduate program with a focus on new narratives developed using emerging media technologies in the areas of arts, culture and nonfiction. She comes to the new Los Angeles-based center, a joint undertaking by The Sidney Poitier New American Film School, in the Herberger Institute for Design and the Arts, and the Walter Cronkite School of Journalism and Mass Communication, with more than 20 years working as an award-winning writer, director and producer in virtual, augmented and extended reality, film, print and television. As founder and CEO of Emblematic Group, de la Peña uses cutting-edge technologies to tell stories — both fictional and news-based — that create intense, empathic engagement on the part of viewers via immersive virtual, mixed and augmented reality. Her latest breakthrough is Emblematic's WebVR platform REACH.Love, a no-code toolset that creates scalable distribution in the medium, democratizes content authorship, and empowers new voices to share their stories.

De la Peña has appeared on the cover of the Wall Street Journal Magazine as Technology Innovator of the Year, was inducted into the SXSW Hall of fame in 2022 and was named one of CNET en Español’s 20 most influential Latinos in tech. Often called the “Godmother of Virtual Reality” for her pioneering work using cutting edge technologies to tell important stories, she is also a New America Fellow, a Yale Poynter Media Fellow and a former correspondent for Newsweek. Widely credited with pioneering the genre of immersive journalism, de la Peña was selected by Wired Magazine as a #MakeTechHuman Agent of Change, and Fast Company named her “One of the People Who Made the World More Creative.” She earned a BA in sociology and visual and environmental studies from Harvard University, an MA in online communities from the USC’s Annenberg School for Communication and Journalism, and a PhD in media arts and practice from the USC School of Cinematic Arts.

John Haddick is a Distinguished Engineer at Lenovo Intelligent Devices Group focusing on developing technologies for the ThinkReality commercial AR/VR portfolio of solutions. As the CTO of ThinkReality, John is a leading strategist for AR/VR product design and development for the company.

Before joining Lenovo, John was the CTO of the Osterhout Design Group, a company pioneering AR technologies, where he was in charge of new product innovations and long range product strategy across the company.
In AR for 12 years

My purpose in life is to inspire and educate people to think and act in a socially, economically and environmentally responsible way.
I make creator tools: Emulator , MetaVRse, and Your Director AI (Stealth)
I am a TEDx Speaker, Podcast Host and was  featured on Dragons’ Den. I was a DJ for more than 20 years performing for millions of people winning DJ Mag’s Innovative Product of the Year in 2011.

Ashley Crowder is the co-Founder and CEO of VNTANA, a SaaS platform that makes 3D asset management and distribution incredibly easy via the industry’s only fully automated 3D optimization and content management platform. She has worked in the 3D/AR/VR space for over 10 years helping Fortune 1000 brands including Adidas, Hugo Boss, Decker’s Brands and more launch 3D applications to increase sales and speed up time to market. She has 14 patents on mixed reality technology and is a part of the Khronos Group to create standards in 3D technology. Ashley was featured as one of USC’s leading engineering CEOs of 2016 and has given talks on the future of mixed reality at prestigious venues including SXSW, Augmented World Expo, TEDx, World Economic Forum and more. Prior to co-founding VNTANA she graduated from USC with a bachelors and masters in engineering and gained valuable engineering experience at BP and Northrop Grumman. She leverages her engineering background to guide VNTANA’s overall direction and technology development to shape the future of e-commerce by making it easy to create a 3D version of every product in the world.

Co-host of the Vhite Rabbit WebXR podcast and one of the original founders of the VR browser games platform \"Construct Arcade\", where he realized the need for WebXR focused development tools, which lead to the inception of Wonderland Engine, a development platform for VR, AR and 3D on the web.

Felix has been creating award-winning VR and AR experiences for the last 13 years. More and more of those happen in and around the web, WebXR and glTF.

Being in that weird spot between designer and developer, he has a strong focus on editor tools, workflows, graphics development and shaders. Founder @needletools. Founder @prefrontlcortex. Tech @amusevision

post.post_content:
Evo Heyning has been creating immersive experiences that bridge real and virtual worlds for more than 20 years. As an interactive showrunner and production strategist, she has worked on media projects ranging from launching the Affordable Care Act to producing more than 500 hours of livestreaming events during the pandemic. Her work focuses on metaverse media and the creative potential of volumetric and virtual production.

Evo passionately shapes the future of the open spatial web to connect people and groundbreaking, applicable ideas through collaborative technologies. Through her company Playable Agency, Evo provides early stage production strategy and creative worldbuilding that expand reality.

post.post_content: Tim is CTO and Co-Founder of MOD Tech Labs. He leads the company to create the groundbreaking AI-powered technology that is reshaping the future of content creation. After graduating from Full Sail University, Tim began his career as an animation artist and, over two decades, expanded into more highly technical developer roles at leading game and production studios. He worked at Sony Picture Imageworks, Two Bit Circus, Gameloft, and GameHouse to name a few. Aside from helping produce countless games, movies, and XR experiences, Tim has used his deep knowledge of technology and entertainment paradigms to make novel solutions to scale content creation with interoperable files for transmedia.

company: Mod Tech Labs; Consumer Technology Association

post.post_content:
Dulce Baerga has been producing interactive content for over 20 years. Building sites ranging from entertainment based portals to product based community sites. She’s a self-taught full stack developer, front-end engineer and network/IT manager who’s passionate about augmented reality and virtual reality platforms. Her skill set includes developing concepts, programming demos, creating UI/UX design, scripting user interactivity, building 3D simulations, creating virtual products, and building webXR apps.

She’s also an active resident of multiple virtual worlds, top prize winner at XR related hackathons, and deeply embedded in the XR community. Dulce is currently pushing the edges of the immersive web and augmented reality, creating XR MVPs for clients and collaboration projects. Immersive theater and mixed reality storytelling are two verticals of focus where she’s been creating production pipelines and UI/UX mechanics. Iterating on and streamlining new XR pipelines to create base MVPs is Dulce’s primary directive while pushing the XR envelope.

ANDREW MACDONALD
A serial innovator throughout his filmmaking career, Andrew has always been the first to bring a new camera or technology to set. This led him to co-found Cream's digital department with Cream CEO David Brady in 2015. This venture has grown from one person incubator to an award-winning full XR production department. Cream has created over 20 pieces of original XR content including 360 3D series, AR apps, and interactive volumetric VR, for networks, studios, agencies, and brands all over the world. Many of these pieces have been invited to show at festivals including Cannes, Sundance, and SXSW. Andrew’s piece "A Curious Mind" won a W3 GOLD 2018 award and a (CSA) Canadian Screen Award 2019.
Andrew is also an executive producer on “Dark threads” Featuring Dominc Monaghan, a VR sci fi adventure recently launched on on Steam. Andrew has become well versed in concept definition, interactive UX design, directing motion capture, game development, and innovation of XR production workflows. Andrew is currently directing an applied research machine learning project on digital humans (DDH) at Sheridan’s screen industries research and technology (SIRT) centre. Andrew is listed as an inventor on two international patent applications. Andrew has raised over $3m in investments and grants, and fostered relationships with industry leaders like HTC, Oculus, Dell, Microsoft, and Adobe.

profile_title: Executive- in charge of innovation / Executive Creative Producer
Executive- in charge of innovation / Executive Creative Producer

post.post_content:
Christina is the CEO of Metastage. Since its founding in 2018, Metastage has completed over 150 productions with major brands and award winning projects, including two Emmy nominations. Metastage is the first North American partner for the Microsoft Mixed Reality Capture technology.

Prior to leading Metastage, Christina was the CEO of VR Playhouse, an immersive content company with immersive projects featured at SXSW, Sundance, and Festival de Cannes. She is a recipient of the Advanced Imaging Society\'s Distinguished Leadership in Technology Award and was named in the Huffington Post as one of 5 women changing the virtual reality scene.

Her writing and research on volumetric video has been published in the textbook, Handbook of Research on the Global Impacts and Roles of Immersive Media (2019), and What is Augmented Reality? Everything You Wanted to Know Featuring Exclusive Interviews with Leaders of the AR Industry (2019).

talk_description: n/a

post.post_content: Lifelong passion for decentralized and p2p technology. I\'ve been in VR since DK1 was released and building web based VR experiences for 7 years. I\'m interested in the standards and file formats that become the glue for the next version of the internet. Everyday I think about how the metaverse can be less friction and more freedom.

Elizabeth Strickler is the Founding Director of the Creative Industries Blockchain Lab and Director of Media Entrepreneurship at Georgia State University. She teaches media innovation to undergraduate and graduate students and works with major labels and cultural icons to build web3 and blockchain/nft strategies. Her April 2021 TEDx talk is considered canonical viewing for those entering the nft/metaverse space and she presents regularly on the topic. She holds academic positions in both the Business School and the College of Arts and Sciences, where she has received multiple grants to research innovation and XR in education. Her goal is to help others start businesses, tell immersive stories, and build a stronger cultural economy. She believes most people can learn most things and have fun while doing so. Her eclectic interests can be seen in her academic credentials, holding a BA in Philosophy, BS in Computer Science, and an MFA in Digital Filmmaking and Art.

Iliana Oris Valiente, CPA, CA is widely credited for being a trailblazer in the blockchain industry dating back to 2013. She’s advised fortune 500 companies, government leaders, regulators, and startups – often acting as a translator between web2 and web3 worlds. Iliana is a published author and sought-after speaker; has been featured in various print, radio, and television outlets; sits on the board of several prominent organizations; and is passionate about web3 + philanthropy, DAOs, venture investing, and travel. Currently, Iliana is a Managing Director and Canada Innovation Lead at Accenture, working with senior executives and boards of F500 companies to support their strategic transformation journeys, leading multi-disciplinary teams across design, data, and the latest emerging technologies.

Elisabeth Chase founded HelloFutureBuzz on Twitter to advocate for the Ħedera Community as a  #SpacesHost featuring Ħashgraph Biz/Projects, Ħedera team, NFT Creators, Dapp devs+

Coming in Q1 2023, is HelloFutureDAO which is a Social Philanthropic organization which plans to build Hello Future Museum in the metaverse to highlight the history of crypto and showcase today\'s digital artists.

Christopher has over 20+ years creating digital experiences, including 6 years with Ethereum and blockchains and 2 years spent creating and collecting NFTs. He is the Director of Engineering @ HyperMint and the former Head of Tech for VaynerNFT.

Chris is passionate about web3 and the future of digital identities and expression. He is father to a 6 month old daughter, a member of DefDAO, and has been fascinated with the concept of the Metaverse since reading Snow Crash in the 90s.

Juliana Loh is a Creative Producer working hard to change the world by bringing imagination, critical thinking and a sense of play + wonder to the forefront. Drawn to global perspectives, she identifies with the storytellers, futurists and game changers in a world in need of a better vision. A talented XR artist (Google Tiltbrush) and in-world designer, Juliana uses human centric design thinking to give structure, inspiration and meaning to ideas, people and places. Her work has been represented at four International Film Festivals and she has spoken at such venues as SXSW and various XR global summits.

Daniel Adams is a developer for Zesty Market, creator of the WebXR Discord server (a community of 2000+ members), and a contributor to open-source WebXR projects. Some of his notable work includes Silk Brush, a port of the open-sourced Tilt Brush to WebXR, the updating of A-Painter, and most recently the creation of an A-Frame wrapper for the Exokit Avatars system.

Albright is a Digital Twin Engineer, XR Developer, and Energy Professional who combines cross-industrial experiences through research, development, and prototyping. Her work benefits engineers, XR technology enthusiasts, and business professionals, by providing access to research work, training, and cultivating a creative community. Albright strives to better African education and advocates sustainability for the energy, arts, fashion, and entertainment industries through extended reality.

Timmy has been described as an expert in C#, JavaScript, and web technologies. He is a senior developer, technical lead with a lot of knowledge about architecture. He has been building software for 3 decades ranging from large web portals and mobile apps to creating 3D artist impressions and virtual, augmented, and mixed reality. He has a great interest in AI and graphics.

Timmy currently works as a Senior Mixed Reality Developer at Velicus working on applications to train people in hospitals and first responders. When he's not working, he builds small VR/XR games. He founded the WebXR NL meetup, helps to run the WebXR Discord, and is recognized as a Microsoft MVP for his contributions to the Mixed Reality community.

Ginna is an experienced VR DP and 360 experience content developer. She enjoys finding new and interesting vantage points for cinematic VR. To date, she has set up cameras on rickshaws, canoes, temples, ferries, cars, balloons, spomeniks, and the occasional migrating zebra herd. In addition to her work with VArtisans, she is also the Director of Content with Conscio VR.

Liquid Cinema Inc is a Toronto-based, software and platform development company dedicated to exploring and defining the evolving language of immersive storytelling in 2D, XR and desktop formats. Liquid Cinema’s mission is to democratize the WebXR creation and distribution pipeline.

Liquid Cinema is led by multiple Emmy award winning producer and director Thomas Wallner who brings over two decades of experience leading creative and technical teams to produce cutting-edge, internationally awarded work for television, film and interactive/digital media and games.

Daniel Dyboski-Bryant is a humanitarian committed to XR for good. His personal mission is to explore, drive and share the development and application of benevolent and meaningful and impactful experiences with emerging technologies. 

Daniel is the Executive Director of the Virtual World Society - a US non-profit - leading their mission to inspire and enable people to thrive, solve problems and create positive impact with emerging technologies. Since 2015, the VWS has run projects around the globe with families, schools and communities; has recognised and celebrated achievements in the XR community; and has contributed thought leadership to the industry.

Daniel co-founded Educators in VR in 2018 to bring together a global community of 3500 educators pioneering the integration of VR for learning, teaching and beyond. He specializes in R.I.S.E. - Remote Immersive Synchronous Experiences and Education. Educators in VR has run more than 3000 virtual events, workshops, presentations and conferences. In Feb 2020, two weeks before Covid 19 arrived, Educators in VR hosted the 2020 International Educators in VR Summit - a 6-day, 24/7, fully immersive VR conference on 5 platforms with 170 speakers, 150 events and 95% CO2 saving compared with a real-world conference. In May 2021 they ran a similar 30-day conference on 20 immersive VR platforms. Daniel will host the WebXR Production Summit on October 13.

Daniel has been an educator for 25 years, teaching languages, entrepreneurship and innovation and training trainers at colleges, universities and corporations in Germany, England, Wales and online. At Coleg Menai Daniel built and led an immersive learning Lab where he used VR to engage with migrant workers and refugees for which he won Inspire Tutor of the Year award in 2020.

The company has grown to over 3,000 global members and supports over 25 special interest groups they call teams, exploring XR industry verticals and niches. Over 60,000 participants have attended their thousands of free and paid events across multiple social VR platforms.

profiles_list.title: Keram Malicki-Sánchez
profiles_list.notes: Will be coming straight off another call.

post.post_content: Keram founded both VRTO & FIVARS in 2015. He’s a business and creative development consultant to a wide variety of tech companies, and founder of Constant Change Media Group Inc., with strong ties to both the Toronto & Los Angeles markets. He is also the editor in-chief of IndieGameReviewer.com, an instructor in WebXR design at UCLA Extension and author of essays around spatial media for several books. He won Creator of the Year at the 2022 Poly Awards, was named one of the Top 100 Original Voices in XR in 2021, and contributed to the 2022 PEW Research report on the Metaverse in 2040.
post.post_excerpt:
Keram is the founder and executive director of the VRTO International Symposium on Immersive Media and the FIVARS Festival of Virtual & Augmented Reality Stories. Both ran in WebXR in 2020.

He most recently contributed essays to two books published in 2020: Dyscorpia: Future Intersections of the Body and Technology, Edited by Marilene Oliver and Daniel Laforest, Published by Dept of Art and Design, University of Alberta and Handbook of Research on the Global Impacts and Roles of Immersive Media (editors: Jacquelyn Ford Morie (All These Worlds, LLC, USA) and Kate McCallum (Bridge Arts Media, USA and Vortex Immersion Media, USA).

Constant Change Media Group; VRTO; FIVARS

post.post_content:
Chris worked 20 years in behavioral health administration and programming before experiencing social presence via VR in 2013. VR changed his professional trajectory when he recognized the disruptive implications remote, immersive, shared experiences, unbound from the physical restraints and proximity requirements of the real world, will have on the way humans work, learn, and socialize.

Listed by Onalytica as a Top 100 influencer in both AR and VR, Chris is particularly noted for keeping a close pulse on the social, educational, artistic and entertainment spaces of the XR movement.

Chris has held a variety of roles including Social VR Liaison for the leading Virtual Reality tech blog ‘Road to VR’, co-founder of Utah VR and Silicon Slopes (AR/VR chapter), Edge of Discovery Ambassador, Siggraph judge, XR consultant/speaker, and Director of AR/VR at Morph 3D where he co-developed portable and persistent avatar systems.

Chris is currently serving as Senior Sales Engineer for ENGAGE XR, delivering virtual collaboration, communication, training, education, events and creative solutions to a growing global market transitioning to the metaverse

Ben Erwin’s work is dedicated to the advancement of the XR industry through recognition of its pioneers and events that provide an advocacy platform for thought leaders. He is a passionate proponent for cooperation on standards for the Metaverse.

As an Internet frontiersman since the 1990s, Ben has served as a developer and as an executive for digital media agencies creating data driven interactives for dozens of major brands. For 13 years, he was a webmaster and consultant for the United Nations humanitarian section and partner NGOs, bringing awareness to the plight of women and children in conflict areas around the world. Before the internet, Ben began his career in the entertainment and music industry.

Ben is a digital polymath with decades of experience in marketing, management, programming, video editing, and writing. Influenced by his years as a veteran of the browser wars, he has teamed up with XR industry leadership to produce the MetaTr@versal series of events. These events are designed to galvanize the community around cooperation on the development and adoption of open standards and platform interoperability for the Metaverse.

Ben believes passionately in the potential of immersive content as a positive means for evolved human communication, particularly in civics, journalism, and education. Through shining a light on the good works of innovators, he aims to help preserve their legacy and inspire others to build upon their work.

He is the creator of The Polys - WebXR Awards, WebXR Summit Series, and MetaTr@versal which have impacted the industry by catalyzing awareness of, and engagement with the immersive web.

talk_description: Welcoming our worldwide audience to the WebXR community and thanking our team, our sponsors and our speakers.

post.post_content:
Catherine D. Henry is a leading voice in XR and one of the top women covering augmented reality, virtual reality, and artificial intelligence –– combining futurism with creative technology and strategic implementation.

Catherine is SVP Growth at Media.Monks, where she advises leading global brands on how to enter the Metaverse; a new era of brand virtualization with innovative ideas and cutting edge technology, from enterprise to entertainment. Catherine decodes technology and interactive experiences to help companies become more resilient, efficient, and productive.

With a career spanning nearly 20 years in global financial services leading institutional sales for private and equity tech investments, Catherine enables teams to better communicate, collaborate and create with tech –– no matter where they are.

Catherine D. Henry is a Black female tech geek & AfroFuturist who holds an MBA, MA in economics, and speaks five languages. She did post-graduate work in immersive media & VR Film making at NY Film Academy (2016).

profile_title: SVP 5G, XR Creative Innovation and Strategy

post.post_content: Ricard works as CEO & co-founder at captic.io. Captic, the company behind vrland.io, has created a whitelabel metaverse solution for Web3. Ricard is Chair at SIGGRAPH Asia’s games program and founding member of Euromersive.

Daniel Ljunggren has 10 years of accomplishments within Product Management and another 10 years within Business Development & Strategic Partnerships gained from global leadership roles within the smartphone, mobile apps & services, IoT, and AR/VR industry.

David Alan Smith Smith is the CTO and Founder of Croquet Corporation, developing the Croquet Microverse platform.
Smith is a computer scientist and entrepreneur who has focused on interactive 3D and using 3D as a basis for new user environments and entertainment. He built his first HMD in 1986 to study telepresence control of a remote robot arm using a Dataglove.
Smith was a Senior Fellow at Lockheed Martin, where he focused on next generation human centric computing and collaboration platforms. Before that, Smith was the chief architect of the Croquet Project, an open-source virtual world collaboration platform where he worked with Alan Kay (Turing Award) and David P Reed (created UDP, co-created TCP/IP) and Andreas Raab (Squeak Smalltalk co-developer).
In 1987, Smith created The Colony, the first real time 3D adventure game/shooter. Smith developed Virtus Walkthrough in 1990, the first real-time 3D design application for personal computers. Smith also co-founded Red Storm Entertainment with author Tom Clancy and co-created the Rainbow Six game franchise. David gave the keynote address at IEEE VR 2017.

talk_description: The Metaverse is and will be a powerful communication medium enabling users to express ideas and engage in ways that we can\'t quite fully imagine. Our ability to see, understand and control the world around us is about to take a quantum leap, but our ability to collaborate on and solve hard problems is even more crucial.

post.post_content: Lucas Rizzotto is an award-winning VR/AR artist, filmmaker & community leader. Creator of the breakout Quest hit "Where Thoughts Go" as well as the viral series “Lucas Builds The Future”, Lucas’s work daringly pushes the boundaries of technology, storytelling & comedy all at once, creating innovative projects that warm the heart and open the mind of millions of people worldwide. Lucas is also the Co-Founder of the largest real-life community of Metaverse creators in the world, known as the AR House, and recently premiered his latest VR satire “Flat Earth VR” at the Sundance Film Festival.

post.post_content: As CEO of RP1, Sean drives the overall strategic direction of the business, from vision, mission, sales, and go to market strategy. Sean has nearly 25 years of leadership, technology, and entrepreneurial experience in building companies from the ground up. His career experience spans multiple industries, having worked in various B2C and B2B companies, including medical, consumer electronics, software technology, fitness and wellness. He is a visionary leader with deep expertise in business transformation, strategic partnerships, and marketing strategies.

Dr. Karen Alexander is a sought-after consultant on building immersive learning programs with extensive connections across the XR industry and academia. Her experience spans partnering with community organizations on giving children and youth the opportunity to create with XR tools, guiding higher ed institutions through the process of XR adoption, advising ed tech and XR startups, and, in her role as an immersive learning consultant with MetaVRse, pioneering the translation of of 2D training into 3D experiences for enterprise. 

Dr. Alexander is a co-founder of XR Women, a worldwide network of professionals that meet weekly in virtual worlds and where a distinguished list of XR industry speakers has appeared. As part of the team that produces The Polys - WebXR Awards, WebXR Summit Series, and MetaTr@versal, she has worked with some of the most influential thought leaders in spatial computing. Bringing her passion for metaverse literacy back to her academic roots, Dr. Alexander is host of the WebXR Education Summit, assembling a diverse array of practitioners to share knowledge on successful implementation of immersive learning. She is also a member of the Immersive Learning Research Network’s State of XR and Immersive Learning Expert Panel. 

Prior to her work in XR, Dr. Alexander was Dean of Junior and Senior Year programs at the women’s college at Rutgers University and Senior Editor of Signs: Journal of Women and Culture in Society. Her experience in higher education ranges across teaching, program design, journal editing, and college administration, with specializations in art, literature, film, and cultural production. Dr. Alexander is committed to women’s advancement and gender and racial equality and believes in a Humanity First approach to XR and the metaverse. She holds master’s degrees in English, Philosophy, and Issues in Modern Culture and earned her PhD. at the University of London.
post.post_excerpt:
Karen is a Producer and Host of the
WebXR Summit Series
Co-Founder, XR Women and 
Advisor, XR Hall of Fame

post.post_content:
Rolando Masís-Obando is a PhD candidate of Computational Neuroscience at Princeton University. Scientifically, he is interested in how contexts (like those in VR/AR) shape the way we think and remember our day-to-day experiences. He has scanned dozens of people’s brains (and effectively read their minds) to further understand how the brain represents spaces and concepts. Given the intersection of AR/VR with neuroscience, Rolando’s recent interests revolve around how we can shape a future internet to be more human-centered and grounded under ethical principles. He recently directed a cinematic educational video on the history of the Metaverse and its ongoing issues with privacy and agency. The video can be found here: https://youtu.be/wsJF1ugsfKI

Rolando graduated from Yale University with a focus on Molecular, Cellular and Developmental Biology. During his studies co-founded Shuflix with his brothers, the largest activity search engine (at the time), to help people interact with their environment in a playful alternative way while helping small businesses get more exposure. Since then, he has also co-founded PhDx, a platform to help incoming PhD students with guides and insider knowledge of the unspoken rules in academia.

In his free time, Rolando is a filmmaker, composes for films, creates augmented reality tutorials for his YouTube channel, and does pro-bono marketing consulting for personal brands and small businesses.

Damon works in many areas of the Web3D & XR industries as a designer, developer, advisor, speaker, entrepreneur and executive that has been active in virtual environments, the 3D web, and other Metaverse related technologies for over 20 years. He is passionate about the web’s convergence with other technologies including 3D, IoT, GIS, CAD/BIM/CAM, AR/VR, mobile and advises a variety of entities that use these technologies for enterprise focused applications. Since 2007, he has been working closely with various built environment professions on the adoption and use of innovative technologies.

Previously he was at SIMLAB, where he was working to make property ownership & management more user friendly for owners via digital twins. At Samsung Research America he focused on making the web browser experience awesome and enhanced with immersive web technologies and new types of interfaces. He is a co-founder of IDEAbuilder, a high tech building company that uses immersive technologies and robotic manufacturing to build more efficiently. He has worked with 3D web and virtual world companies and was acting director of a student initiated organization with the Web3D Consortium, where he worked with the Consortium’s global outreach and education initiatives. He has built numerous mixed reality applications and has lead dozens of research projects in multiple domains.

As founding team member of the Augmented Reality Developer Camps, VR Hackathon, & founder of the AEC Hackathon, he is actively working to help grow the use of innovative technologies.

Meadows is an artist, author, and inventor. Since 2019 he has served as CTO for Idoru Worlds, guiding the development of tools to create, edit and place XR avatars. His professional interests include conversational portraits, interactive narratives, and natural language processing. With over twenty years in virtual reality, character design, artificial intelligence and over ten years in blockchain he has participated as a founder and advisor to startups and fortune-100s around the globe. As a 100-ton USCG captain Meadows has sailed four of the seven seas, speaks English, French, and Spanish and lives on his boat with his family in Mexico.

Haggai Goldfarb, has held leadership positions with a distinguished track record of delivering successful large-scale projects and products to market. For over a decade he led VFX teams in Hollywood with significant roles at Warner Bros. Disney, DreamQuest and DreamWorks. Notable awards include: The recent prestigious Polys WebXR Awards 2021 with 3 wins for Experience of the year, Education experience of the year, and Video experience of the year for ‘The Magic of Flight’ XR experience, AIXR VR Awards 2021 nomination, DreamWorks Achievement Award, Kung-Fu Panda’s 2008 Academy Award Nomination for Best Animated Feature of the year, as well as winning the 36th Annual Annie Awards in 10 categories, including Best Animated Feature, ‘The High Ground Award’ strategy war games, between M.I.T Sloan Fellows and Harvard Business School, and has served as judge for the Animation Oscars. A visionary, inventor and a Metaverse pioneer, Haggai pursuit of the Metaverse and related Extended Reality (XR) and Enhanced Reality (ER) technologies (e.g 3D,VFX, AR,VR, MR) span over 20 years. At DreamWorks he managed key innovation, development and integration of the Academy award-winning "Shrek" facial system, adapting it to DreamWorks' animated features franchise pipeline. By enabling animators to convey emotions through facial expressions as never before, the Shrek facial system, was the breakthrough that allowed Shrek to be the first computer- animated film ever to put digital human characters in leading roles, leading it to become the highest- grossing animated franchise of all times, with over $3.5B in revenues. In 2006, Haggai launched a tech startup out of M.I.T focused on the innovation of the next generation natural human interface for the Metaverse. His innovation lab created key technologies and XR experiences that preceded commercial VR headsets including avatar interaction, head, facial and eye tracking, gestural and haptic. At Microsoft Haggai led Mixed Reality (MR) initiatives and R&D prototyping on HoloLens including the first shareable HoloLens Mixed Reality experience development at Microsoft which preceded “Mesh”. Most recently Haggai led XR strategy at Meta driving global XR initiatives, partnerships and teams in NA, APAC and EMEA. Notably, he produced and oversaw the creation and deployment for the first WebXR/OpenXR project, Project Origami: “The Magic of Flight”. As an innovation leader, he operates at the intersection of business, technology and creative. Haggai is an Alfred Sloan Fellow receiving his MBA from the MIT Sloan School of Management.

post.post_content:
Trent is on a mission to pioneer immersive technology and transform human experience for good.

To achieve this, Trent believes in the power of storytelling and immersive technology to drive a new paradigm of change and climate action. Through emerging tools like VR, AR MR and WebXR, we can raise awareness for social and environmental impact causes like never before.

As the Co-founder and CEO at PHORIA, a Melbourne-based XR Studio, Trent and his team have been Emmy nominated for their previous work in WebXR with Meta and the International Paralympics Committee. Alongside working closely with respected partners and world leaders including Netflix, Google, WWF and the United Nations (UN).

post.post_content: Tuğçe Joy majored in Psychology and then completed her masters in Cognitive Science, where she combined Psychology with Computer Engineering. She started working with Virtual and Augmented Reality as a lab assistant in 2015. Then she joined a startup and worked as a UX researcher for more than 2 years. She took part in many XR projects with different institutions and companies including but not limited to MIT Media Lab and Facebook Reality Labs. She published research papers in prestigious journals and conferences such as Virtual Reality Journal and CHI. Currently, she is working as a research assistant at Harvard University’s Learning, Innovation and Technology lab exploring the use of new immersive technologies in education.

Julie Smithson’s personal mission is to ‘inspire and educate people to think and act in a socially, economically and environmentally responsible way’.

It is through this lens as co-founder at MetaVRse, a 3D Web game engine for Business & XR development company.  Julie is leading enterprise companies to digitally transform and educate ways to immersive and remotely train users of the product/service. Julie guides her team to translate instructional language, interaction behaviors and curate knowledge testing gamification for businesses.  

Julie’s leadership is focused on transforming training & marketing into immersive experiences using technologies to design Web3 solutions, integration implementation and deployment to produce growth benefits, cost savings and human efficiencies.

Julie is also co-Chair of XRWomen.com , a global group of women who meet every Wednesday and learn about the applications of extended realities.  The group works to advocate, inspire and build communities aimed at inclusivity of gender equality, race and ethnicity in the digital sector and beyond.  

Julie is the host of the XR For Learning podcast. Julie also leads XR Collaboration, a coalition supporting human connectivity through digital presence in platforms building communication and collaboration.  Julie is also founder of XR Ignite to support the innovation and entrepreneurship of our communities. She also sits on panels and in leading conversations about interoperability standards and alignments with Khronos Group and MetaTr@versal.  

Previous to MetaVRse, Julie was Co-Founder of Emulator, the World’s most advanced DJ system, which won the prestigious 2011 DJ Mag Innovative Product Award.  She scored a $500K deal on the hit TV show Dragons’ Den. 

Julie is the co-host of the WebXR Summit series and a renowned speaker on XR and Produced TEDx Toronto (2010) and introduced coding in VR at Canada Learns Code (2017). She is past-President of the VRARA Toronto Chapter and Former Chair of the VRARA Education and Student Committees. Most recently Julie presented with the YPO, Harvard and 1Society about changing the way we learn and teach using spatial technologies.

post.post_content:
Sophia Moshasha is on a mission to accelerate the adoption of immersive & emerging technologies. Behind the scenes, on camera, and on stage, Sophia is a driving force behind numerous initiatives designed to advance knowledge and engagement with XR across all sectors.

As a producer of The Polys - WebXR Awards and host of its Virtual Red Carpet, Special Correspondent of the WebXR Summit Series and co-host of the VRARA podcast, Sophia has interviewed dozens of XR pioneers and innovators. As a fellow of MetaTr@versal, an initiative to advocate for cooperation among the stakeholders of the Metaverse on standards and interoperability, Sophia was the star of a 40 minute, 3-act play which was performed live on the Main Stage at AWE 2022, which featured a cast of industry heavyweights. She is a co-founder of XR Women, a global collective dedicated to the advancement of female representation in technology.  Sophia will host the WebXR Brand Summit on September 15.

Since 2018, Sophia has been the Vice President of the DC Chapter of the VR/AR Association’s Washington, D.C. Chapter. Sophia is also the co-founder and Chief Marketing Officer for Ready Player Golf, the first annual Virtual Reality Charity Golf Outing, which began in 2020, and has raised money for MSF (Doctors Without Borders) and XRSI (the XR Safety Initiative). She has served as Head of Partnerships for Brightline Interactive, XR Strategist for Virtual Reality Marketing, and in Executive Program support for AFWERX, the US Air Force’s Innovation Investment Program. 


Sophia has been influencing global networks through many years of active engagement in the XR community. She has been featured on prominent media outlets such as Forbes, ABC, CGTN, American Dream TV series and more She holds a Bachelor of Science from Virginia Commonwealth University. She is currently engaged in public policy planning for Meta.

post.post_content:
Daniel Dyboski-Bryant is a humanitarian committed to XR for good. His personal mission is to explore, drive and share the development and application of benevolent and meaningful and impactful experiences with emerging technologies. 

Daniel is the Executive Director of the Virtual World Society - a US non-profit - leading their mission to inspire and enable people to thrive, solve problems and create positive impact with emerging technologies. Since 2015, the VWS has run projects around the globe with families, schools and communities; has recognised and celebrated achievements in the XR community; and has contributed thought leadership to the industry.

Daniel co-founded Educators in VR in 2018 to bring together a global community of 3500 educators pioneering the integration of VR for learning, teaching and beyond. He specializes in R.I.S.E. - Remote Immersive Synchronous Experiences and Education. Educators in VR has run more than 3000 virtual events, workshops, presentations and conferences. In Feb 2020, two weeks before Covid 19 arrived, Educators in VR hosted the 2020 International Educators in VR Summit - a 6-day, 24/7, fully immersive VR conference on 5 platforms with 170 speakers, 150 events and 95% CO2 saving compared with a real-world conference. In May 2021 they ran a similar 30-day conference on 20 immersive VR platforms. Daniel will host the WebXR Production Summit on October 13.

Daniel has been an educator for 25 years, teaching languages, entrepreneurship and innovation and training trainers at colleges, universities and corporations in Germany, England, Wales and online. At Coleg Menai Daniel built and led an immersive learning Lab where he used VR to engage with migrant workers and refugees for which he won Inspire Tutor of the Year award in 2020.

Daniel is the host of the WebXR Production Summit and
Co-Founder of Educators in VR

talk_description:
Co-founders of Educators in VR Lorelle VanFossen and Daniel Dyboski-Bryant share their extensive experience bringing people together in VR to explore and experience XR immersive education. They\'ve produced over 3,000 educational VR events, workshops, classes, and conferences, bringing a unique perceptive to the potential of XR education and VR events. 

Educators in VR was founded by Lorelle VanFossen and Daniel Dyboski-Bryant in 2018 with the mission to integrate XR immersive technology into education, training, research, and business. The company has grown to over 3,000 global members and supports over 25 special interest groups they call teams, exploring XR industry verticals and niches. Over 60,000 participants have attended their thousands of free and paid events across multiple social VR platforms.

post.post_content:
Dr. Karen Alexander is a sought-after consultant on building immersive learning programs with extensive connections across the XR industry and academia. Her experience spans partnering with community organizations on giving children and youth the opportunity to create with XR tools, guiding higher ed institutions through the process of XR adoption, advising ed tech and XR startups, and, in her role as an immersive learning consultant with MetaVRse, pioneering the translation of of 2D training into 3D experiences for enterprise. 

Dr. Alexander is a co-founder of XR Women, a worldwide network of professionals that meet weekly in virtual worlds and where a distinguished list of XR industry speakers has appeared. As part of the team that produces The Polys - WebXR Awards, WebXR Summit Series, and MetaTr@versal, she has worked with some of the most influential thought leaders in spatial computing. Bringing her passion for metaverse literacy back to her academic roots, Dr. Alexander is host of the WebXR Education Summit, assembling a diverse array of practitioners to share knowledge on successful implementation of immersive learning. She is also a member of the Immersive Learning Research Network’s State of XR and Immersive Learning Expert Panel. 

Prior to her work in XR, Dr. Alexander was Dean of Junior and Senior Year programs at the women’s college at Rutgers University and Senior Editor of Signs: Journal of Women and Culture in Society. Her experience in higher education ranges across teaching, program design, journal editing, and college administration, with specializations in art, literature, film, and cultural production. Dr. Alexander is committed to women’s advancement and gender and racial equality and believes in a Humanity First approach to XR and the metaverse. She holds master’s degrees in English, Philosophy, and Issues in Modern Culture and earned her PhD. at the University of London.

post.post_content:
Ben Erwin’s work is dedicated to the advancement of the XR industry through recognition of its pioneers and events that provide an advocacy platform for thought leaders. He is a passionate proponent for cooperation on standards for the Metaverse.

As an Internet frontiersman since the 1990s, Ben has served as a developer and as an executive for digital media agencies creating data driven interactives for dozens of major brands. For 13 years, he was a webmaster and consultant for the United Nations humanitarian section and partner NGOs, bringing awareness to the plight of women and children in conflict areas around the world. Before the internet, Ben began his career in the entertainment and music industry.

Ben is a digital polymath with decades of experience in marketing, management, programming, video editing, and writing. Influenced by his years as a veteran of the browser wars, he has teamed up with XR industry leadership to produce the MetaTr@versal series of events. These events are designed to galvanize the community around cooperation on the development and adoption of open standards and platform interoperability for the Metaverse.

Ben believes passionately in the potential of immersive content as a positive means for evolved human communication, particularly in civics, journalism, and education. Through shining a light on the good works of innovators, he aims to help preserve their legacy and inspire others to build upon their work.

He is the creator of The Polys - WebXR Awards, WebXR Summit Series, and MetaTr@versal which have impacted the industry by catalyzing awareness of, and engagement with the immersive web.

post.post_content:
Evo Heyning has been creating immersive experiences that bridge real and virtual worlds for more than 20 years. As an interactive showrunner and production strategist, she has worked on media projects ranging from launching the Affordable Care Act to producing more than 500 hours of livestreaming events during the pandemic. Her work focuses on metaverse media and the creative potential of volumetric and virtual production.

Evo passionately shapes the future of the open spatial web to connect people and groundbreaking, applicable ideas through collaborative technologies. Through her company Playable Agency, Evo provides early stage production strategy and creative worldbuilding that expand reality.

Amy Peck is the Founder & CEO of EndeavorXR, a leading global XR strategy & consulting firm. She is a recognized thought-leader in the space and speaks globally on the future of XR and exponential technologies.
Amy holds multiple Advisory Board roles and is a Venture Partner at the Capital Region XR
Accelerator. She is Co-chair of Prospera Women, a global organization supporting female-led
startups and was Founding Co-chair of the VRAR Association Enterprise Committee.
She actively mentors entrepreneurs and is a member of several Women in Tech, Venture-backed Accelerators & STEM Education organizations.

Through EndeavorVR, she works with Fortune 500 companies and tech startups on XR strategy, content, development, product and GTM.

Her own personal mission is to see technology accessible to all - fundamentally improving every aspect of our lives and elevating the way we work, learn, communicate and play.

Cynthia Maller is Head of 3D Creative Technology at Walmart, and three of its digitally-native brands: Hayneedle, Art.com and Allswell. She is also a Certified Emotional Intelligence (EQ) Practitioner. Her focus is strengthening and scaling the three pillars of 3D in retail: inspiring aesthetics, visual integrity and operational excellence. She believes that every one of us has the talent and capability to add value to immersive commerce, and to be a builder, a citizen and a purveyor in the Metaverse. This drives her commitment to peer education, advocacy and invention. When she’s not at work, she’s on the ice, feeding her passion for figure skating. Her drive to try new things, to push herself, both in commerce technology and on the ice, is guided by the words of Erin Hanson, “What if I fall? Oh, but my darling, What if you fly?

post.post_content: Neil is VP Developer Ecosystems at NVIDIA, where he works to enable applications to take advantage of GPUs. Neil has been the elected President of the Khronos Group for over twenty years, where he initiated the OpenGL ES standard used by billions worldwide, helped catalyze the WebGL, Vulkan and OpenXR APIs for portable 3D and augmented and virtual reality, and the glTF run-time 3D asset format. Most recently Neil initiated and now Chairs the Metaverse Standards Forum with over 1,800 member companies.
