post.post_content:
LarryR/Cube3 has pioneered many of the current disciplines in \"digital media\" known as XR/ VR / AR 3DUX. UI, Experience Design,Transmedia and Immersive media.

LarryR/Cube3 has over two decades of experience as a leader in the area of virtual worlds , transmedia IP creation, Virtual Reality content, Virtual IP Law, social games, online 3D, human machine interface, Augmented Reality and networked communities for both entertainment and corporate media uses. Over the years LarryR/Cube3 has worked with over hundreds of 2D /3D software tools makers or services in all matters of finding customers and creating products and services and then forming communities and ecosystems around them.

LarryR/Cube3 has spoken at industry events for over two decades. Highlights include self created seminars at Apple Computers NYC, Siggraphs for many years, Macworlds, and Digital Hollywood Panels as well as local east and west coast tech/design shows/meetings and conferences. Work and projects of LarryR/Cube3 have been written about in both print and online in periodicals such as WIRED, UploadVR, NEW MEDIA, Macworld, CNET, and two zillion blogs. He also founded the early VR Groups for developers and designers. The NYVRMLSIG, the SFWEB3D.
Currently CubeXR is creating an online web3D Educational Community and Platform www ArdadiaVirtual.com

post.post_content:
Joanna Popper is an award-winning Hollywood and Silicon Valley media executive with a track record of launching cutting edge content and technology to drive revenue, audience engagement and brand love.

She currently leads HP’s Virtual Reality initiatives for Go-To-Market and Location Based Entertainment. Prior she was EVP of Media & Marketing at Singularity University and VP Marketing at NBCUniversal.

Joanna is Executive Producer on “Breonna’s Garden” which premiered at the Tribeca Festival. This augmented reality experience was created by Lady PhoEnix and Sutu with Ju’Niyah Palmer to honor the life of her sister, Breonna Taylor.

Joanna was Executive Producer on Double Eye Studios’ “Finding Pandora X,” winner of Venice Film Festival Golden Lion for Best VR Experience and the SXSW Audience Award for Virtual Cinema Spotlight. Finding Pandora X is a modern day take on Greek mythology live interactive experience in VRChat.

Joanna was selected as “50 Women Can Change the World in Media and Entertainment,” “Top 50 Original Thinkers in VR,” “Top Women in Media: Game Changers,” “Top Women in Media: Industry Leaders,” “Digital It List,” “101 Women Leading the VR Industry” and is on the Coalition for the Women in XR Fund.

He has featured in The Financial Times, The Economist, the BBC, and other media outlets. He has worked with organizations like the World Economic Forum and currently sits on the advisory board of Immerse UK to support businesses interested in immersive technologies.

post.post_content:
Eren Aksu is an AR/VR Subject Matter Expert and Senior Manager at Deloitte Digital. He brings together technical product management, sales and business development, marketing, strategy and production management experiences focused on the xR industry. His previous projects include dozens of virtual reality, augmented reality and mixed reality launches and releases in collaboration with companies like Google, Facebook, WSJ, SoCal Edison, Chevron and other global brands.

Mr. Aksu has been in the xR space since 2011 and joined Deloitte in 2018 after his role at Emblematic as the 2nd full time employee helping the startup scale exponentially. He helped bootstrap Emblematic with its founders at the Interactive Media Research Lab at USC and was selected as 1 of 10 “VR for Good” film makers by Facebook/Oculus for Facebook’s inaugural “VR for Good” program. The resulting xR film became part of the official selection for SXSW (South by South West) and several other film festivals around the world. After joining Deloitte in 2018, he was selected by Deloitte\'s CIO to lead the Deloitte Digital Reality (DxR) incubation and innovation hub reporting directly to the Deloitte CIO and CTO, and he now serves the US Navy as the AR Lead for their 5G Navy Smart Warehouse project in San Diego.

Mr. Aksu also leads multiple innovation related efforts at Deloitte, such as helping build out and leading content/frontier tech asset curation for Deloitte’s Houston Innovation Center focused on Energy, Resources, and Industrials. He is a frequent speaker and presenter on xR topics at events and conferences globally and is an Advisor at Deloitte’s Startup Deloitte program focused on fostering startup innovation inside Deloitte. He has an extensive network of startups and companies he collaborates with and is also the Co-Founder of Nextopic, a virtual conference series focused on introducing frontier technologies and their impacts on different higher-level topics to audiences around the world. Some of their recent conferences have included Nextopic: Future of Pandemics and Nextopic: Future of Work, which have featured dozens of speakers and thought leaders such as Salman Khan, Founder & CEO of Khan Academy.

A pioneer in this space, Tom has over a decade-long track record of running tech teams and providing strategic direction in emerging technologies for powerhouse brands and organizations. As VP of Product at 8th Wall, Tom is leading the strategy and development of powerful tools used by developers to create reality content (WebAR and WebVR) for the browser. Previous to 8th Wall, Tom was a founding partner at Super Ventures, the first VC fund dedicated to augmented reality.

He also played a critical role in building the AR/VR ecosystem as founder of We Are Wearables and co-producer of AWE, the world’s #1 AR+VR event series.

post.post_content: Gabe is a product manager and developer who has worked somewhere at the intersection of education, immersive technology, and collaborative tools for the past 10 years. He lives in Southern California, creates instrumental music in his free time, and enjoys working with curious, passionate people.

Chris Duffey spearheads Adobe’s Creative Cloud strategic development experience design partnerships across the creative enterprise space. Chris’ keynotes have received over 50 million impressions. His sessions have been reported around the world including Access Hollywood, Extra, Ok Magazine, Hello, People, and The Guardian. In addition, his work has been featured by more than 100 global media outlets on topics including generative experience design, computational creativity, the role of human and machine and AI enhanced creativity.

Prior to Adobe, Chris was an Executive Creative Director having been a creative consultant with over 35 advertising agencies across the major global holding companies: WPP, IPG, Havas, Omnicom, Publicis and MDC.

Chris also serves on The Board of Directors for the Association of National Advertisers NY (ANA) and The Consumer Technology Association (CTA) Board of Industry Leaders.

Chris is author of the award-winning book Superhuman Innovation, the world’s first book co-authored by AI about AI.

Jacquelyn Morie is a pioneer in the domains of computer graphics and virtual reality. She is the founder of All These Worlds, LLC, a company that creates and supports Virtual World experiences and research. Her clients have included NASA, the University of Southern California’s Institute for Creative Technologies (USC/ICT), XPRIZE and the Army Medical Command.

Her ongoing research focuses on how immersion can affect and benefit participants, how the use of Avatars changes both our social connections and our deep understanding of our sense of self, and how multisensory elements combine to create a cognitive gestalt that enhances the feelings of Presence in virtual experiences.

Her 2007 PhD thesis – Meaning and Emplacement in Expressive Immersive Virtual Environments – has been downloaded hundreds of times by emerging VR communities, serving as a deep first introduction and guide to the many important aspects of this new medium, from its female-centric history to a design methodology for emotional impact. It was completed under the supervision of Dr Lizbeth Goodman at the SMARTlab Digital Media Institute University College Dublin, Ireland.

Dr Morie is a long time educator, having created digital programs at the University of Central Florida, the Ringling College of Art and Design, and Otis College of Art and Design. She is the original developer of the first computer animation training program for Walt Disney Feature Animation in the 1990s, as well as similar training programs for companies in the Digital Effects industries, such as Rhythm and Hues Studios. She is a former member of the DARPA ISAT Group, tasked with investigating new topics for DARPA research, and a founder of the USC/ICT, where she served as Senior Scientist for 14 years. She is a three decades member of ACM SIGGRAPH and has served that organization in many capacities over the years.

talk_title: Passion and Purpose: The Deep Wellsprings of XR Inspiration
talk_description: Where do the ideas for outstanding XR projects come from? What motivations and individual histories are at play to spark these projects? And what reasons do creators have for choosing immersive technologies to express their vision? A few examples will start to answer these questions, and maybe inspire you to look deep for your own creative passions.

events.session_title: Passion and Purpose – The Deep Wellsprings of XR Inspiration

post.post_content:
Christi Fenison is an immersive storyteller, 3D artist, 360 videographer and simulation designer.
Her passion is creating XR experiences that expand perspectives and inspire action. Drawing on principles of narrative transport, cognitive elaboration and the sense of presence, she works to bring big picture ideas to life via the careful interplay of meaningful details.

By day, Christi works as an XR Instructional Media Producer at UNC School of Medicine IT, focused on the research, development and integration of XR training simulations in curriculum. Beyond the classroom, she is also a bespoke World Builder for Social VR events, crafting custom experiences tailored to each client’s vision and goals.

Christi received her Master's degree from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill’s Environment and Science Communication program, where focused on Emerging Technologies, 3D Modeling + Unity Development, Green Architecture + Sustainable Design, Geospatial Information Systems, and Immersive Journalism.

post.post_content:
I’m a multidisciplinary POC artist from Kentucky. I’m a VR enthusiast and a life long creative. When I was a kid I used to make houses out of paper, when I was a teen I played a copious amount of The Sims, when I went to college I started my art business doing professional photography, graphic design, web design, painting and illustration.

It wasn’t until 2020 that I discovered a love for digital 3D modeling. Exploring social apps on the Oculus Quest during the pandemic, I was immediately drawn to building worlds for people to socialize in.
In the past 12 months I have created and shared over 150 originally crafted VR templates and there are over 2,100 worlds that have my signature on them.

I design all of my environments, structures and furnishings from scratch, having no previous experience in 3D or VR before the joining Altspace. I am the first world builder to successfully monetize templates via Patreon memberships, with over 200 Patrons since November of 2020. I’ve paved the way for other artists in the space to get paid and I teach dozens of aspiring world builders daily and free of charge. Having hosted over 50 events in Altspace, I’ve also introduced countless users to the platform.

I have worked with several notable organizations within VR, such as Naughty by Nature, Public Enemy, The Harlem Film House, BRCvr, DreamlandXR and NFT Oasis and many of my colleagues have as well.

Juliana Loh is a Creative Producer working hard to change the world by bringing imagination, critical thinking and a sense of play + wonder to the forefront. Drawn to global perspectives, she identifies with the storytellers, futurists and game changers in a world in need of a better vision. A talented XR artist (Google Tiltbrush) and in-world designer, Juliana uses human centric design thinking to give structure, inspiration and meaning to ideas, people and places. Her work has been represented at four International Film Festivals and she has spoken at such venues as SXSW and various XR global summits.

Chris worked 20 years in behavioral health administration and programming before experiencing social presence via VR in 2013. VR changed his professional trajectory when he recognized the disruptive implications remote, immersive, shared experiences, unbound from the physical restraints and proximity requirements of the real world, will have on the way humans work, learn, and socialize.

Listed by Onalytica as a Top 100 influencer in both AR and VR, Chris is particularly noted for keeping a close pulse on the social, educational, artistic and entertainment spaces of the XR movement.

Chris has held a variety of roles including Social VR Liaison for the leading Virtual Reality tech blog ‘Road to VR’, co-founder of Utah VR and Silicon Slopes (AR/VR chapter), Edge of Discovery Ambassador, Siggraph judge, XR consultant/speaker, and Director of AR/VR at Morph 3D where he co-developed portable and persistent avatar systems.

Chris is currently serving as Senior Sales Engineer for ENGAGE XR, delivering virtual collaboration, communication, training, education, events and creative solutions to a growing global market transitioning to the metaverse

post.post_content:
Alex spent 10 years in the games industry with Codemasters before starting RiVR in 2015.

We started making 360 videos for car manufacturers and holiday brands all around the world which led us to create some software to synchronise all the virtual reality headset together. RiVR link is the software that came out of those projects and is now being used all over the world for training in all industries particularly first responders.

RiVR has also created photo realistic fire and crime scene investigation scenarios (RiVR investigate) for UK and US governments and we now see the software being used in multiple sectors.

as we look to the future we are growing our scanning techniques and pipelines allowing us to create two-dimensional documentary series which incorporates 6° of freedom photorealistic room scale virtual reality as well!

Step inside is the new platform we are creating to allow people to go that next step with a documentary film or TV series.

James Jensen is an entrepreneur committed to working with leading-edge technology and eager to solve
problems surrounding how we interact and engage with each other in physical and virtual worlds. He is
the previous creator and co-founder of the world-renowned virtual reality company The VOID. Within
the last 25 years, James founded and managed several technology companies in video streaming, social
networks, mobile games, and creative services. He has partnered with Disney, Sony Entertainment, FOX,
MGM, Intel, Microsoft, SyFy, Dreamworks, and MTV through those ventures.

He is now launching a new form of virtual reality, called hyper reality, in the form of the multi-sensory
entertainment company JUMP. JUMP will allow people to come as close to jumping and flying as the
real thing, but without all of the risk.

Andreea Ion Cojocaru is a licensed architect, a software developer, and the co-founder of NUMENA, a company comprised of coding architects that both design and develop. Projects focus on spatial experiences and interactions across multiple dimensions and modalities.

Christina Kinne aka XaosPrincess graduated from Munich Filmschool in 2006.She has worked as director, first a.d., producer, editor, set designer, photographer and journalist, and has directed more than ten movies, including one of Europe’s first live-action 3D-films – “Delusion 3D” (2008).

After her parental leave Christina Kinne found a new creative home in Virtual Reality. Using software like Gravity Sketch or Tilt Brush she designs 3D models for VR in VR.Christina Kinne has produced and hosted a variety of Virtual Reality events.As evangelist she also likes to promote VR in real life – be it by screening live VR content to a RL audience or by producing educational videos.

In July 2020 Christina Kinne joined Tivoli Cloud VR as CMO and Events Manager to help making the dream of a friendly, creative and inclusive metaverse come true.Currently she is also pursuing a second MA in “Digital Narratives” at the International Filmschool Cologne.

John Akers is the Director of Research and Education at the University of Washington Reality Lab where he manages the XR-related undergraduate research program and educational initiatives. He received bachelor\'s and master\'s degrees in Computer Science and Informatics from the University of Washington, where he researched approaches for accessible input devices for XR applications in the Taskar Center for Accessible Technology.

He is also a member of the XR Access Initiative and a participant of prior W3C workshops on inclusive design for immersive web standards.

profile_title: Director of Research and Education, Reality Lab
talk_title: Designing Accessible Interactions for the Immersive Web
talk_description: Immersive applications as a new medium have evolving design paradigms. Substantial work has been done to define accessibility guidelines for the traditional 2D web, but efforts are still in progress to ensure the immersive web is accessible to all individuals.  In this presentation, we will explore how interactions in immersive applications can be designed to support a variety of input devices and allow more people to fully experience the immersive web.

Yinch is a software engineer who works in the games and real time graphics space. His recent projects have included a VR ski fitness game, a jetliner cockpit procedural trainer and MRI machine simulator. He believes that technology should help solve real world problems and make life better.

He works closely with local schools to give access to immersive, interactive and inspiring VR learning experiences, ranging from an ISS jetpack adventure to Shakespeare\'s Globe Theatre. His company also runs programmes that encourage pupils to learn coding skills.

Before VR, his company has worked on video installations, healthcare mobile apps, treadmill fitness software and interactive 3D kiosks. Clients including Bank of America, Ford Motor Company and Samsung USA.

Yinch founded playko after working as lead developer on console games and multimedia titles. He graduated with a Masters in Engineering from Imperial College, London.

post.post_content: Dominique Wu is a senior UX/UI Designer, AR/VR Designer, and Art Director specializing in the entertainment and tech industries. She has designed and developed strategies to help businesses scale sustainably and maximize growth for more than 10 years.

James is currently CTO at LABLIGHTAR.

He co-authored the popular LinkedIn Learning video course HoloLens App Development. He also wrote the technical book Beginning Kinect Programming with the Microsoft Kinect SDK.

In a previous life, he pursued a PhD in Philosophy at Emory University, with a focus on theories of consciousness and phenomenology.

After completing his Master\'s degree in Media Design at HEAD in Geneva and being a researcher in Interaction Design at ENSAD in Paris; Jérémie Lasnier co-founded LiveLike to build immersive sports streaming experiences in VR, mobile, and web, endorsed both by the NFL and TechCrunch. As Chief Creative Officer, He pushed the boundaries of innovation by overseeing all aspects of the design from implementing interfaces, 3D environments to mixed reality augmentations. He worked with major TV channels such as Fox Sports, France TV, and SKY to broadcast the biggest events of the world like the World Cup, the Superbowl, and the final of the Champion\'s League.


Jérémie won multiple international awards such as a Samsung Design Award, VR Award, and a Gold Award at the Oculus Mobile VR Jam. He also joined the prestigious 30 under 30 Forbes List class of 2017.
In 2020, LiveLike\'s VR product got acquired by Cosm, a global company focused on design, technology, and innovation to deliver the best immersive experiences to partners around the world. Jérémie joined the leadership team as VP, Immersive Design.

Started in Business in the Print Industry and always had an interest in different tech to compliment the print work we did. Got in to Augmented reality many years back now, which led me to learn how to actually develop it. I\'ve since worked as a developer and in several other capacities in the industry and am excited by the endless opportunities to be creative.

Dr. Guynup is an award winning VR artist, author, and teacher. As an artist, his exploration of storytelling / shape changing avatars and use of poetry to unpack the design language of VR in the 1990's continues to resonate today. As a professional, he built multi-million dollar training software for for CSX Rail, Weyehauser, UPS, and more. For the past decade he's taught online, in-world, multi-user, classes on VR art and design.

Dr. Guynup currently teaches at Southern New Hampshire University and is developing VR classes there.

talk_description: This session introduces the on-going VR Art and Design coursework of Dr. Steve Guynup. It is a live VR demo with a VR audience, broadcast from Dr. Guynup's FrameVR class space.  Teaching methods, creative use of space, and leveraging of virtual art and virtual poetry as inspiration for educational projects are explored. Participants will learn to look at their own works through a lens of virtual art and discover new options for crafting engaging educational outcomes.

post.post_content:
Space Popular is directed by Lara Lesmes and Fredrik Hellberg, both alumni of the Architectural Association in London (2011). They founded the practice in Bangkok (2013) and have been based in London since 2016. Space Popular creates spaces, objects, and events in both physical and virtual space, concentrating on how the two realms can blend together.

The studio has completed buildings, exhibitions, public artworks, furniture collections, and interiors across Asia and Europe, as well as virtual architecture for the immersive internet. Clients, collaborators, and commissioners include national institutions such as MAXXI - National Museum of 21st Century Art, Rome, Italy; The Swedish Centre for Architecture and Design –ArkDes, Stockholm, Sweden; Royal Institute of British Architects, London, UK; National Museum of Modern and Contemporary Art, Seoul, South Korea; as well as independent galleries such as MAGAZIN, Vienna, Austria; and Sto Werkstatt, London, UK.

Lesmes and Hellberg both have extensive academic experience having taught architectural design studio since 2011, first at INDA, Chulalongkorn University in Bangkok, since 2016 at the Architectural Association in London, and since 2020 at Daniels, Faculty of Architecture, University of Toronto. Their current MArch design and research studio at Daniels investigates visions for civic architecture in the immersive internet.

talk_description: The art and craft of buildings and cities in the age of spatial media.

She is also a full professor of Game Design at UC Santa Cruz, in the department of Performance, Play and Design.

post.post_content: Doug North Cook is an artist, professor, and researcher focused on immersive technology, interaction design, and the application of architectural theory to digital environments. He founded the Immersive Media programs at Chatham University, and runs the Immersive Design & Game Design Residencies at Fallingwater. Doug is currently working on multiple new projects including museum installations, game projects, and scientific research.

profile_title: Program Director and Professor of Immersive Media

post.post_content:
Caitlin Krause focuses on the intersection of technology, innovation and wellbeing, and founded the studio and consultancy MindWise in 2015. She teaches about the subject at Stanford University. Caitlin has advised global organizations including Google, Facebook, Oracle, TED, Evernote, University of San Francisco, ETH Zürich and the U.S. State Department. In September of 2020 she released the book Designing Wonder: Leading Transformative Experiences in Virtual Reality. She authored The Importance of Presence and The Art of Storytelling in VR as part of the XR Collaboration Global Resource Guide.

Caitlin has created and run numerous collaborative experiences in social XR, fusing presence, mindfulness, storytelling, curiosity and emotional intelligence. A Senior Strategist for the Virtual World Society, she is a writer and designer for digital therapeutic applications that incorporate haptics and biofeedback. After two decades of teaching and leadership experience, she authored Mindful By Design (Corwin Press, 2019). Caitlin helps individuals and teams navigate complexity and change, prioritizing mindful wellbeing, joy, creativity, wonder and awe.

talk_description: A conversation about how we can reframe for immersive creativity through invoking awe and wonder. This talk brings up design considerations, intentional choices, and examples of ways that prioritizing a sense of wonder leads to WebXR experiences aligned with flow and flourishing, creative expression, wellbeing and connection.

post.post_content:
Austin Caine, a.k.a Cause, is a professional world designer specializing in building bespoke 3D event spaces for social VR platforms. He is a prominent builder in AltspaceVR having created some of the more popular entertainment spaces (such as The Flying Saucer and The Worm Hole) and has helped to spark innovation in many other creators.

He is also an admin and consultant for the yearly BRCvr virtual "Burning Man" event held in Altspace, and has worked with many people to help bring their creative ideas to fruition. These days he and his partner Christi work closely together on many VR and XR projects to deliver clients a higher level of atmospheric quality while maintaining optimal download speeds and visual framerates.

post.post_content:
WILL CHERRY is a director, designer, and technologist specializing in the combination of hemorrhaging-edge technology with story-driven interaction design. His career creating 360 and realtime VR/AR experiences for companies like Samsung, AT&T, Apple, and more stem from a love of human-centered immersive design principles. A Swiss-army-knife of a person, his technical skillset spans AAA game and film production disciplines to drive creative solutions for any medium.

His unending passion: using technology to both create art and improve the human condition through experience - be it digital, physical, or the juxtaposition of the two.

events.session_title: Polygons are the New “Expensive” – Optimizing for Scalability

post.post_content:
Christina is the CEO of Metastage. Since its founding in 2018, Metastage has completed over 150 productions with major brands and award winning projects, including two Emmy nominations. Metastage is the first North American partner for the Microsoft Mixed Reality Capture technology.

Prior to leading Metastage, Christina was the CEO of VR Playhouse, an immersive content company with immersive projects featured at SXSW, Sundance, and Festival de Cannes. She is a recipient of the Advanced Imaging Society\'s Distinguished Leadership in Technology Award and was named in the Huffington Post as one of 5 women changing the virtual reality scene.

Her writing and research on volumetric video has been published in the textbook, Handbook of Research on the Global Impacts and Roles of Immersive Media (2019), and What is Augmented Reality? Everything You Wanted to Know Featuring Exclusive Interviews with Leaders of the AR Industry (2019).

talk_description: n/a

post.post_content:
Hugh Hou is a Co-Founder and Creative Director for CreatorUp, a digital media education company and production studio. He heads up immersive media content creation and has produced VR content for numerous companies and organizations such as Samsung, the Special Olympics, Google, Oculus, MasterCard, Twitter, TikTok, RedBull Music, LACOSTE, Huawei, and the Los Angeles Police Department.
He also directs and produces Mixed Reality music videos. He worked with musical artists such as I Prevail, Joyner Lucas, Kristina Sky, Roger Shah, Cypress Hill, and SHAED.

When not producing original VR videos & films, Hugh dedicates his time to sharing his vast expertise in immersive technologies and VR filmmaking on the CreatorUp YouTube channel. He truly believes that by sharing freely with the world through YouTube, mentoring and consulting, more creators will join the immersive media family.
Hugh’s goal is to help the VR industry thrive and to improve the quality of VR filmmaking.

post.post_content:
Inspired by movies in the 80’s and 90’s, Shawn has been reaching towards the dream of the hologram for over 20 years. Shawn got his start with a classic laser interference pattern holographic studio he built in high school, followed by training in advanced holographic film techniques at MIT. He has been awarded dozens of patents around the world, the Popular Mechanics Breakthrough Award, and noted as one of the ‘20 Best Brains Under 40’ by Discover Magazine.

Shawn works between Brooklyn and Hong Kong where he serves as co-founder and CEO of Looking Glass Factory.

Ayşegül Yönet is a Senior Azure Cloud Developer Advocate at Microsoft and focusing on Cognitive Services, Spatial Computing and WebXR. She is a co-chair of W3C Immersive Web Working Group and Community Group working on WebXR Device APIs.
post.post_excerpt: Ayşegül Yönet is a Senior Azure Cloud Developer Advocate at Microsoft and focusing on Cognitive Services, Spatial Computing and WebXR. She is a co-chair of W3C Immersive Web Working Group  and Community Group working on WebXR Device APIs.

post.post_content:
Story without data is an antidote, data without a story lacks empathy, but a data story can spark a movement. Michael is a data storyteller with a 100k following on TikTok as @the.data.guy

He is also a co-founder of Flow Immersive which is a data storytelling platform for authoring and presenting data stories.

Prior to Flow, Michael was a manager in the Strategy practice at Deloitte Consulting.

Ben Erwin’s work is dedicated to the advancement of the XR industry through recognition of its pioneers and events that provide an advocacy platform for thought leaders. He is a passionate proponent for cooperation on standards for the Metaverse.

As an Internet frontiersman since the 1990s, Ben has served as a developer and as an executive for digital media agencies creating data driven interactives for dozens of major brands. For 13 years, he was a webmaster and consultant for the United Nations humanitarian section and partner NGOs, bringing awareness to the plight of women and children in conflict areas around the world. Before the internet, Ben began his career in the entertainment and music industry.

Ben is a digital polymath with decades of experience in marketing, management, programming, video editing, and writing. Influenced by his years as a veteran of the browser wars, he has teamed up with XR industry leadership to produce the MetaTr@versal series of events. These events are designed to galvanize the community around cooperation on the development and adoption of open standards and platform interoperability for the Metaverse.

Ben believes passionately in the potential of immersive content as a positive means for evolved human communication, particularly in civics, journalism, and education. Through shining a light on the good works of innovators, he aims to help preserve their legacy and inspire others to build upon their work.

He is the creator of The Polys - WebXR Awards, WebXR Summit Series, and MetaTr@versal which have impacted the industry by catalyzing awareness of, and engagement with the immersive web.

post.post_content:
Dr. Johnson-Glenberg is a Research Professor at Arizona State University in the Psychology department. She is also an entrepreneur and President of the award-winning learning technology company called Embodied Game, LLC. she leads a team that creates, researches, and disseminates innovative virtual and mixed reality (XR) educational content for 4th graders through life-long learners. Several of the NSF-funded STEM games can be downloaded for free at www.embodied-games.com.


She has a varied background as a screenwriter, experimental psychologist, and game designer. Her lab has been at the forefront of creating “embodied” and kinesthetically-active games using sensors and motion capture technologies for over a decade and a half. Dr. Johnson-Glenberg presents nationally and internationally. Some recent publications include design guidelines for learning VR at Frontiers in Robotics and AI and, a rubric that teachers can use to score the quality of a VR lesson.

talk_title: Embodied Education across the XR Spectrum

post.post_content: Steve Grubbs is the founder of VictoryXR, a pioneer in the space of metaversity education. Steve is the former chair of the House Education Committee in the Iowa Legislature and has degrees in business and law from the University of Iowa.

talk_description: Learn about how metaversities operate, the best use cases, objective results from early adopters and the process to move from Zoom to a metaversity.

post.post_content: Jonathon Richter is the founding CEO and President of the Immersive Learning Research Network - or iLRN - a nonprofit educational research and innovation network for the public to discover, share, and innovate on "what works" in XR and Immersive Learning.

events.session_title: State of Immersive Learning with XR

post.post_content:
Chris Dede is the Timothy E. Wirth Professor in Learning Technologies at Harvard’s Graduate School of Education (HGSE). His fields of scholarship include emerging technologies, policy, and leadership. From 2001-2004, he was Chair of the HGSE department of Teaching and Learning. In 2007, he was honored by Harvard University as an outstanding teacher, and in 2011 he was named a Fellow of the American Educational Research Association.

In 2020 Chris co-founded the Silver Lining for Learning initiative (https://silverliningforlearning.org). He is currently a Member of the OECD 2030 Scientific Committee and an Advisor to the Alliance for the Future of Digital Learning, sponsored by the Mohammed bin Rashid Global Initiative (MBRGI). Also, Chris is a Co-Principal Investigator of the NSF-funded National Artificial Intelligence Institute in Adult Learning and Online Education.

His most recent co-edited books include: Teacher Learning in the Digital Age: Online Professional Development in STEM Education; Virtual, Augmented, and Mixed Realities in Education; Learning engineering for online education: Theoretical contexts and design-based examples; and The 60-Year Curriculum: New Models for Lifelong Learning in the Digital Economy.

events.session_title: State of Immersive Learning with XR

post.post_content:
Maya Georgieva is a futurist and Metaverse strategist, author, and speaker with more than 15 years of experience in higher education, industry consulting, global communities, and human rights policy. Her most recent work focuses on innovation, the metaverse, immersive storytelling, VR/AR experiences, design thinking, and digital strategy. Maya actively writes and speaks on the topics of the metaverse, immersive storytelling, and the future of learning, creativity, and work and consults organizations and startups in this space. She is an XR producer and serves as a judge and coach for several competitions and accelerator programs.

Maya is the Senior Director of the Innovation Center and XR, AI, and Quantum Labs at The New School. She leads a team driving new media and innovation focused on immersive storytelling, spatial computing, future interfaces, and design. Maya teaches the signature Immersive Storytelling course at Parsons School of Design. Maya often speaks about the Metaverse and frontier technologies like AI and Quantum and speculative futures. Her work has been featured at SXSW, the MIT Media Lab, The Atlantic, The Economist, and the Fulbright Program, among others. She is the co-author and principal investigator of the State of XR and Immersive Learning Report. She has authored white papers on the future of education and immersive learning in EDUCAUSE Review, The Chronicle of Higher Education, EdSurge, and other publications.

events.session_title: State of Immersive Learning with XR

post.post_content: Paula MacDowell, PhD, is an Assistant Professor at the University of Saskatchewan, specializing in Educational Technology and Design. Her ongoing research focuses on designing technology-enhanced learning experiences for K-12, higher education, and informal learning contexts. In collaboration with academic, industry, and community partners, Paula studies the design of immersive learning experiences for pro-social and environmental change. She serves as the Practitioner Chair for the Immersive Learning Research Network (iLRN).

Steve Bambury has worked in education and training for 20 years. In 2016 he became the first Head of Digital Learning and Innovation across the JESS school group before moving on to work as an education consultant in 2019. This included an extended engagement within New Media Academy where he led on education strategy and immersive technology and coordinated the deployment of the first virtual campus in The Middle East.

Steve has won awards from Apple, Microsoft, GESS, BETT and EdTech Digest for his working integrating technology in learning and professional development. In 2017, he hosted the world’s first professional development sessions inside virtual reality and in 2018 he co-hosted the world’s first global lesson inside VR alongside Pixar co-founder Loren Carpenter. Steve is on the judging panel for both the GESS Awards and World VR Awards and his work with VR has been featured on Forbes Middle East, Arabian Business, Dubai One and more.

Steve now works as a consultant and project manager in the field of NFTs, Web3 and the Metaverse.

Corinne Brenner is Director of Learning at Killer Snails, where she helps create and study games that inspire a love of science. Killer Snails’ most recent project is WaterWays, an augmented reality app that helps students connect the impact humans have on water, and water’s impact on people. She is also a PhD candidate in NYU’s Educational Communication and Technology program, where she uses a variety of methods to understand how virtual reality can be used effectively in education.

Corinne is an author of numerous academic publications examining the affordances of immersive technology for education and entertainment. She received her BA in Psychology from Cornell University, and MSc in Social Psychology and Psychological Methods from the University of Amsterdam.

Ms Grace Kebirungi possesses a Masters degree in Microbiology and Quality Control (Virology and Bacteriology) and a BSc in Fundamental and Applied Microbiology, from the University of Science and Technology Houari Boumediene Algiers, Algeria through an Algerian government scholarship in collaboration with the Ministry of Education in Uganda.

She is passionate about innovations in health and was part of the team that pioneered training of frontline health workers in COVID-19 Infection Prevention and Control using virtual reality technology. She is instrumental in VR ideation and content creation, writes scripts and works together with the technical team at ACE to transform health science courses into virtual reality training courses. She is a strong advocate for virtual reality and does this through virtual reality application training. She also has competences in bioinformatics, unix programming language and basic understanding of python programming

A pioneering Extended Reality Producer and a Creative Director with a knack for telling stories, a flair for detail, and a hint of humour. I have a proven and experienced background in 360 productions, Augmented Reality, Mixed Reality, simulations, 360 animations and VR games for multinational companies, SMEs, African governments and NGOs based all around Africa.

Isiaq is the co-founder and head of growth at SwiftXR, a cross-platform builder tool that allows users and businesses to create WebXR content without having to write code. SwiftXR is used by companies in the real estate, art, education, and e-commerce industries to develop lightweight WebAR experiences.

He\'s also on the advisory board of the VRAR Association, Nigeria Chapter, a global community promoting virtual and augmented reality technologies in Nigeria and aims to democratize access to VR/AR learning resources. Isiaq is dedicated to expanding the extended reality (AR and VR) community of users, enthusiasts, and developers.

Job is the founder of StanLab Ltd, an education technology company that is leveraging immersive technology to build learning solutions to create access to quality education for all students no matter their background. Stanlab builds 3D interactive, virtual laboratory application that provides practical science education to students especially those who do not have access to traditional laboratories in resource-constrianed settings.

He is the 2018 Winner of the Global #IdeasChangeLives Competition organized by British Council and a top education innovator as recognized by Deloitte and World Economic Forum in the #WorldClass Education Challenge.

Carlos J. Ochoa Fernandez:

Engineer from Madrid Polytechnic University, MBA from Babson College, Certificate in Innovation and Entrepreneurship by Maryland University, Certificate in Digital Marketing for International Business Development (ICEX), and ITC & Gis Certificate by Siemens Data-Technic Schule (Germany).

President VRAR Madrid Chapter, Co-Chair of Education Committee, Immersive Learning Founding Member, ICICLE X-Reality for Learning and Performance Augmentation SIG, Member of Educators in VR, Member of Smart Cities Experts and Standards Group of AENOR (Spain),
Expert Evaluator for the European Commission in XR Projects and Technologies.

With over 25 years of international experience in the Innovation and New Advance Digital Technologies in the ITC Industry and Digital Education. Leading successful organizations (SIEMENS, Sagentia, Altran, Founder and CEO of E_Learning Consulting, ONE Digital Consulting & SmartEducationLabs, with a balanced strategic mission and innovative business development vision.

Author of the White Paper “Best Practices in VR in Education” and “State of Art of XR in Education” by VR/AR Association and Member of Several Experts Committees in XR in Training, Education, Training, Cultural Heritage, Tourism and Smart Cities

She creates, curates, produces, and collaborates across various artistic expressions, encountering unique ways to imagine new worlds through immersive storytelling, and focusing on producing extended reality experiences. She curates #ImmersiveJuaKali conversations, which bring together XR practitioners from Africa and around the world.

post.post_content: I investigate how the affordances of XR experiences – such as interactivity, visualization, goal-directed activity, and presence – can be leveraged to promote more effective learning specifically in humanistic and linguistic subjects. On one hand, I am interested in understanding how user activity in an XR experience generates mental narratives that help learners structure, organize, and process culturally and linguistically situated knowledge. On the other, I am designing procedures and evaluative tools to define and assess the learning that occurs in interdisciplinary teams of students, faculty and staff who integrate Immersive in their work. I am looking at how the activity of these teams can be configured to project-based learning, and how this learning can be used to complement or challenge existing post-secondary pedagogical approaches to language, culture and heritage learning.

After a combined 20 years of studying and teaching foreign languages, Michael McDonald created Gold Lotus which aims to demonstrate how virtual reality can support the learning and teaching of foreign languages.

Recent projects include the launch of the Handy English VR vocabulary-building app, a 24-hour VR English lesson and cultural event to raise funds for the fight against Covid and programs in schools around the world aimed at raising awareness of how VR can be used to develop language skills and cultural awareness, with particular focus on students building their own webXR spaces to share their local cultural heritage in a unique VR exchange program. His most recent course in partnership with VictoryXR has just concluded on the ENGAGE VR platform - Public Speaking in a Multicultural World.

post.post_content: Jennifer Rogers is an experienced Learning & Talent Development executive with a demonstrated history of strategic workforce transformation and capability development. She specializes in workforce optimization and acceleration utilizing a unique combination of emerging technologies and data analytics and has led large strategic initiatives in several global, high risk-high compliance industries, including oil and gas, mining, aviation, and financial services. Jennifer is passionate about leading cutting edge innovation in the learning space, with particular attention to strategies that proactively prepare the workforce for the future of work, and currently serves as VP of Learning and Development at RPM Living, a rapid-growth-stage real estate firm, as well as lends her expertise as an Executive Officer of IEEE’s Learning Technology Standards Committee.

post.post_content:
VR Enthusiast, Innovator, Educator, Speaker, Autism Advocate, Author, Wife, Mom

Muhsinah L. Holmes Morris, Ph.D is the former Interim Department Chair/Assistant Professor of Chemistry and is now in the Department of Education and Assistant Professor of Education for the Center of Morehouse Center for Excellence in Education (MCEE) at Morehouse College in Atlanta, GA. Dr. Morris is Morehouse College’s 2021 Winner of the Vulcan Teaching Award of Excellence.

She is an alumna of Clark Atlanta University (B.S.) and Emory University (M.S. & PhD). Her research interests focus on inclusion in STEM for the neurodiverse. She is the Principal Investigator (PI) of the VR Project, “Morehouse in the Metaverse”. She launched her Advanced Inorganic Chemistry course in Virtual Reality in the Spring of 2021. She is a pioneer in this space as the chemistry content in VR is limited.

She is the wife of a gamer/techie named Chris and mom of 5 sons, Anthony, Matthew, Christopher, Seth and Cameron. She believes VR provides a pathway for creating inclusion in society for the neurodivergent through immersive educational experiences that more specifically target vocational rehabilitation goals. As a member of the Autism Speaks Community Advisory Council, Advocacy Ambassadors, and Grant Review Committee, Dr. Morris sheds light on the issues that affect the 1 in 44 children and 1 in 45 adults on the autism spectrum. Her teaching philosophy centers around building a rapport with students before asking them to perform, and she infuses metacognitive goals as part of her learning objectives in the classroom to help students persist through their educational experiences.

She is affectionately known as Dr. M.O.M. (Molder of Minds) by all her students. She continues to mold the minds of educators and students globally in the Metaverse. Her future is authentic transformation of the educational system for our future leaders using immersive technologies in the Metaverse. More recently, she founded Metaverse United, LLC where she helps people find where they belong in the embodiment of the internet called the Metaverse. Learn more at UnitetheMetaverse.

Jasmine Clark is the Digital Scholarship Librarian at Temple University. Her primary areas of research are accessibility and metadata in emerging technology and emerging technology centers. Currently, she is leading The Virtual Blockson, a project to recreate and gamify the Charles L. Blockson Afro-American Collection in virtual reality to teach high school students primary literacy skills. She is also doing research in 3D metadata and the development of Section 508 compliant guidelines for virtual reality experiences.

She is also the chair of the DLF Digital Accessibility Working Group, as well as a Co-Chair of the DLF Committee for Equity and Inclusion.

As the Coordination and Engagement Team lead for XR Access, he helps organizations invested in XR stay up-to-date on the latest accessibility guidelines and helps find solutions to novel accessibility challenges. He also conducts ongoing research at UC Berkeley on how AR can be used to help people with visual impairments.

post.post_content:
Anna Xygkou is a PhD candidate and researcher in the Department of Computing at the University of Kent, UK. After receiving her MSc in Language and Communication Impairments in Children (University of Sheffield, UK) and her MSc in Statistics and Research Methods (University of Kent, UK), she delved into researching the application of immersive technologies and specifically Virtual Reality, to improve the quality of life of diverse populations (autistic children and adults), as well as groups who are vulnerable to social isolation. Companionship and Social Connectedness through/with Conversational Virtual Humans (CVHs) has been her core research interest, especially when those entities can co-exist with any other physical/artificial entities in any type of context and environment. Her current research interests include conversational AI and Human-Robot Interaction for socially deprived/challenged groups.

She was the founder of AUTISM VR Channel in AltspaceVR and the moderator of the Diversity Track in the Educators in VR International Summit Virtual Conference 2020.

post.post_content:
Roland is a product designer and UX expert based in NYC, curator of WebXRNews.com, XR Accessibility at Virtuleap, and creator of GRAVR — a globally recognized avatar for VR on the web. Previously, Roland co-founded the consulting agency ByteDept, designing human-centric digital products for some of the world’s most respected brands in a variety of verticals. He is the host of WebXR (A-Frame NYC) workshops/events and creates immersive experiments that make the current VR/AR industry accessible for everyone.

He started his design career in the Siemens/BenQ innovations lab. A graduate of the University of Applied Sciences Munich, Roland is an adjunct faculty teacher for immersive design at the School of Visual Arts, NYC. He is also a member of the W3C Immersive Web CG and XR Access.

For fifteen years, Dr. DuPont has taught multimedia communications across the greater Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania area. Her areas of focus include VR and AR, Web design and development along with Video Game design and development. Dr. DuPont continues to provide education in these areas through her position at Community College of Allegheny County. Her passions include providing opportunities to students and members of the community to gain hands-on experience with these cutting-edge technologies and providing Open Source Educational materials to encourage others to offer opportunities to their communities.

talk_description: This presentation discusses experiences and approaches to providing learning opportunities through Community Colleges. Topics include addressing obtaining hardware, preparing students for diverse workforces and obtaining funding to serve the community. The presenter also speaks about hurdles and approaches to providing affordable opportunities to students

events.session_title: Equity in Teaching Next Gen XR Developers

post.post_content:
Emily Sherwood is Director of Digital Scholarship and Studio X at University of Rochester’s River Campus Libraries. She is an alum of both the Council on Libraries and Information Resources (CLIR) Postdoctoral Fellowship Program and the EDUCAUSE/CLIR Leading Change Institute. With over a decade of experience helping faculty across disciplines incorporate technology in their teaching and research, Emily regularly collaborates with faculty, staff, and administrators at UR and beyond to develop experiential learning opportunities, increase digital literacy skills, and push the boundaries of how libraries support research and teaching through the use of technology.

Currently, she is building capacity for augmented and virtual reality at UR with the opening of Studio X, a hub for immersive technologies. Emily holds a doctorate in English from the Graduate Center of the City University of New York.

Heather Haseley is the Co-Founder and Co-Executive Director of the Arizona State University Learning Futures and Lead Design Architect of Next Generation Learning.

At Learning Futures, we imagine and build the future of learning for all learners. Our goal is to create the conditions to foster creativity and collaboration to enhance learning. Faculty, students, and staff experience deeper empathy for all our learners by taking part in bold exploration and experimentation within a human-centered learning environment. Through our Collaboratory, Studios, and Emporium, we play, fail, learn and iterate through authentic collaboration. Our Learning Futures Collaboratory brings individuals, research, and communities together to imagine the future of learning and set a bold collective vision. Our Learning Futures Studios allow us to prototype and create POCs and MVPs for testing that inform the platforms, architectures, and infrastructure needed to scale our vision. Our studios are not full of professionals, rather groups of students who get paid to upskill in addition to working on meaningful projects for the institution and clients. Our platforms and products are made by students for students. Our Learning Futures Emporium allows everyone to access our tools, experience the future, and be inspired to co-create the future. Participants feel the excitement of positive growth and societal impact by contributing to the future of learning.

Before joining ASU, Heather served in leadership roles at the University of Pennsylvania, Northwestern University, and Columbia University fostering innovation in learning through the creation of new centers, programs, communities of practice, and learning experiences. She has presented at national and international conferences and events around the world on learning innovation, giving feedback, learning design, and program development.

Heather Elizabeth Dodds, Ph.D. is a compassionate and enthusiastic research design advocate. She has current UX certifications and holds a Master’s Degree in e-Education from the University of Phoenix and a Doctorate in Instructional Design for Online Learning from Capella University. Heather\'s 2013 dissertation is on the quantitative effects of virtual worlds (Second Life) on scientific inquiry skills.

In the past two years, Heather has authored two book chapters, one on the use of XR in STEM education and one for instructional designers guiding the use of XR in higher education. Recently, she also taught one of the first college courses ever to incorporate the Quest 2 headset. She actively publishes about the design and use of XR for learning via LinkedIn and her blog.

post.post_content:
Dr. Hayes is passionate about developing, evaluating, and iterating on technology used for learning in formal and informal environments. She has designed and created educational XR experiences over the past decade and works tirelessly to encourage students at all levels to pursue STEM education and STEM careers with the explicit goal of expanding and diversifying STEM education and the STEM workforce. Her efforts to recruit students into STEM range from public exhibits of Virtual Reality, to K12 classroom visits, to app development camps for middle and high school-aged students to hosting interdisciplinary game development events.

Dr. Hayes leverages her research funded by NSF, NIH, the Department of Defense and the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation to inform Learning Technology design and implementation across learners from K12 and university levels to the workforce.

Dr. Brooke Morrill serves as the Senior Director of Education at Schell Games. Morrill uses her expertise in behavioral science, psychology, and research to increase the impact of and engagement in the company’s educational and transformational games. She identifies and secures extramural project funding in both the federal and private sectors in order to create and iteratively develop innovative, interactive experiences. In addition, she collaborates with universities and research institutions for product development and evaluation. She also maintains an active Board Certified Behavior Analyst-Doctoral credential from the Behavior Analyst Certification Board.

Morrill’s noteworthy contributions at Schell Games include securing and managing governmental funding for projects including Happy Atoms, HoloLAB Champions, and most recently HistoryMaker VR, all of which are funded through federal grants. Outside of the studio, Morrill serves on the XR Education and Training Advisory Group for the Academy of International Extended Reality (AIXR), a membership network of industry leaders that helps to enable growth, nurture talent, and develop standards while working to bring wider public awareness and understanding to virtual and augmented reality. She is also a Principal Member of grant review panels for the Institute of Education Sciences at the US Department of Education.

Prior to working at Schell Games, Morrill gained a variety of experiences through her educational endeavors. While earning her PhD at Utah State University, she became a summer intern at Disney Research Pittsburgh in the Behavioral Economics Research lab. While there, she met Schell Games’ CEO Jesse Schell and began working at the company soon after.

Morrill currently lives north of Pittsburgh, with her husband, children, and dogs. During her free time, she enjoys cooking, being a theater patron, and counting down to the holiday season.

resources: I do not yet know the other panelists or what exactly we\'ll discuss, so I will need to update this later if materials are necessary.

post.post_content:
Dr. Stylianos Mystakidis is a Learning Innovator and Researcher at the University of Patras, Greece, as well as Professor-Counselor at the Hellenic Open University, Greece. His areas of professional expertise and research are Learning Innovation, Metaverse, Virtual Reality, Augmented Reality, Gamification, Serious Games, Open Education and Continuous Professional Development. He has published over 60 articles in peer-reviewed international journals, conference proceedings and books on the previous topics.

He has extensive teaching experience in European (Spain, United Kingdom, Greece, Cyprus) and US universities. In 2020, he co-designed and developed as lead author the official 2-ECTS blended learning course for all educators of Cyprus on “Augmented and Virtual Reality in Teaching and Learning”. He has also designed, developed and managed an innovative, awarded-winning MOOC using playful design and Multiuser Virtual Worlds. He has participated as certified project manager (PMP) and researcher in eleven international projects.

His formal studies include a Ph.D. at the Faculty of Information Technology, University of Jyväskylä (Finland), a MA in Education in Virtual Worlds at the University of West of England Bristol (United Kingdom), a MSc in Mechanical Engineering at the National Technical University of Athens (Greece) and a Postgraduate Certificate at the Open University of Catalonia (Spain).
List of publications: https://www.researchgate.net/profile/Stylianos-Mystakidis

Dr. Levin is an Associate Clinical Professor and the Medical Director of Global Network Operations in the Department of Radiation Oncology at the University of Pennsylvania’s Abramson Cancer Center. He received his undergraduate degree from Franklin & Marshall College, a master’s degree in physiology from Georgetown University, and an undergraduate medical degree from Tel Aviv University. His post-graduate training includes an internship in medicine at Yale University, a residency in radiation oncology at the University of Pennsylvania, and a fellowship in proton therapy at the Massachusetts General Hospital.

Dr. Levin’s clinical focus is the management of patients with thoracic malignancies and soft tissue sarcomas. His research interests include investigation of integrative oncology modalities and mind-body medicine. Dr. Levin is a nationally and internationally recognized leader in the development of virtual reality applications for healthcare.

My name is Shannon Putman, PhD-Fort Knox Coordinate in the Education Leadership Evaluation and Org. Development Department at the University of Louisville. Prior to that, I spent eight years teaching the multi-modal communication special education classroom and two years as the learning and behavior disorder resource teacher. I spent three years working as the teacher in residence at Cochran Elementary. I have focused my work on implementing the use of Immersive Virtual Reality (IVR) technologies into the educational curriculum. My Ph.D. research focused on the use of IVR technology as educational interventions.

I am also an advisory board member of XReps, the leading immersive virtual reality football simulation system.

post.post_content: Dr. Angelina Dayton is the Chief Research Scientist at the Virtual World Society and an Aspen Institute Tech Policy Fellow. She has previously been an XR user-experience designer, speaker, consultant and trainer.  She is widely known as The VR Lady and has spent her career helping those in education and industry understand large-scale deployment and mass adoption of emerging technologies. She is the mother of seven and is a children’s magician in her free time.

events.session_title: Bringing Immersive Education to Underserved Communities

post.post_content:
Daniel Dyboski-Bryant is a humanitarian committed to XR for good. His personal mission is to explore, drive and share the development and application of benevolent and meaningful and impactful experiences with emerging technologies. 

Daniel is the Executive Director of the Virtual World Society - a US non-profit - leading their mission to inspire and enable people to thrive, solve problems and create positive impact with emerging technologies. Since 2015, the VWS has run projects around the globe with families, schools and communities; has recognised and celebrated achievements in the XR community; and has contributed thought leadership to the industry.

Daniel co-founded Educators in VR in 2018 to bring together a global community of 3500 educators pioneering the integration of VR for learning, teaching and beyond. He specializes in R.I.S.E. - Remote Immersive Synchronous Experiences and Education. Educators in VR has run more than 3000 virtual events, workshops, presentations and conferences. In Feb 2020, two weeks before Covid 19 arrived, Educators in VR hosted the 2020 International Educators in VR Summit - a 6-day, 24/7, fully immersive VR conference on 5 platforms with 170 speakers, 150 events and 95% CO2 saving compared with a real-world conference. In May 2021 they ran a similar 30-day conference on 20 immersive VR platforms. Daniel will host the WebXR Production Summit on October 13.

Daniel has been an educator for 25 years, teaching languages, entrepreneurship and innovation and training trainers at colleges, universities and corporations in Germany, England, Wales and online. At Coleg Menai Daniel built and led an immersive learning Lab where he used VR to engage with migrant workers and refugees for which he won Inspire Tutor of the Year award in 2020.

Lorelle is an author and writer and expert on social media, web publishing, and VR education.

post.post_content: Emilie is the CEO and Co-Founder of Zoe Immersive. Based in Los Angeles and Geneva, Switzerland, she oversees business strategy for the company, and was pivotal to establishing Zoe partnerships with Unity, Meta, Qualcomm, Epic Games, and others. Emilie is a Swiss designer & technologist at heart, specializing in human-computer interactions. Emilie’s ultimate goal is to empower the next generations to become creators in the metaverse.

I am an Instructional Media Specialist working at Chemeketa Community College in the Center for Academic Innovation on a faculty support team. I specialize in instructional media and work with faculty on content creation, use of technology and media, best practices and pedagogical use of media, media enabled classroom technology, and more. My former professional background was in video game development prior to working in higher education.

Peta is an experienced teacher, researcher and award-winning digital designer specialising in immersive technologies. She designed Pangaea Minds, an educational framework using virtual worlds to connect schools for global team-teaching and student collaboration. Peta has recently led the design of VR and AR solutions for NSW Transport and the Music Performance Industry. Her research in Immersive Design at UNSW was a catalyst for her strong interest in ethics, regulation, and governance specific to the metaverse. She is the Director of XR Global Citizenship and Education at XRSI.org and is currently studying Cyber Law at Deakin University. As a classroom teacher, she is committed to empowering teachers, parents, and students in their understanding of the opportunities, challenges, and risks associated with belonging to virtual worlds and the metaverse. Peta is also winner of the 2021 Immersive Learning Research Network: Best Immersive Learning Project. Pangaea Minds is a truly innovative and global approach to equip students with the attitude and aptitude for conquering the serious economic, political, health, and climate challenges our current leaders are grappling with.

post.post_content:
Rolando Masís-Obando is a PhD candidate of Computational Neuroscience at Princeton University. Scientifically, he is interested in how contexts (like those in VR/AR) shape the way we think and remember our day-to-day experiences. He has scanned dozens of people’s brains (and effectively read their minds) to further understand how the brain represents spaces and concepts. Given the intersection of AR/VR with neuroscience, Rolando’s recent interests revolve around how we can shape a future internet to be more human-centered and grounded under ethical principles. He recently directed a cinematic educational video on the history of the Metaverse and its ongoing issues with privacy and agency. The video can be found here: https://youtu.be/wsJF1ugsfKI

Rolando graduated from Yale University with a focus on Molecular, Cellular and Developmental Biology. During his studies co-founded Shuflix with his brothers, the largest activity search engine (at the time), to help people interact with their environment in a playful alternative way while helping small businesses get more exposure. Since then, he has also co-founded PhDx, a platform to help incoming PhD students with guides and insider knowledge of the unspoken rules in academia.

In his free time, Rolando is a filmmaker, composes for films, creates augmented reality tutorials for his YouTube channel, and does pro-bono marketing consulting for personal brands and small businesses.

He is currently working to motivate and facilitate college faculty in increasing digital literacy, exploring new practices, and investigating experiential and extended reality learning opportunities at the Teaching and Learning Exchange at George Brown College.

In addition, he is the president and founder of Tapvigo Solutions, an innovative communications solutions company. In his work, Michael has helped to create a groundbreaking virtual reality simulation on anti-racism called Let\'s Talk About Race.

post.post_content: Cassondra (Cassie) Eng is an NIH T32 Sports Neuroscience Postdoctoral Scholar at Stanford University. Her training is in two distinct, but complementary areas: the Learning Sciences and Cognitive Neuroscience. She utilizes eye tracking and neuroimaging to investigate the interactions between psychophysiological processes and educational outcomes. Her research focuses on fostering attention regulation and cognitive skills through enriching virtual learning contexts. Her primary work examines how physically-active video games enhance cognitive development and neuroplasticity in at-risk populations. As technology use grows at an exponential rate and sedentary behavior increases in the wake of the global pandemic, evidence-based practices that promote both physical activity and cognitive engagement are needed. She advocates for Educational Neuroscience, the emerging field that fosters collaborations in neuroscience, psychology, human-computer interaction, educational technology, and related disciplines to explore how learning experiences support brain development and cognitive skills crucial for academic achievement and success.

events.session_title: Findings on the Effectiveness of XR for Education

post.post_content:
Eleni Mangina carried out her PhD work at the University of Strathclyde (UK), Department of Electronic and Electrical Engineering, working on Agent-based applications for intelligent data interpretation (1998-2001). Eleni Mangina holds an M.Sc. in Artificial Intelligence from the Department of Artificial Intelligence at University of Edinburgh in the UK and an MSc in Agricultural Science from Agricultural University of Athens in Greece. In 2002 she joined the School of Computer Science, at University College Dublin, Ireland.

Dr Eleni Mangina is currently Professor at the School of Computer Science, University College Dublin in Ireland and the Vice Principal (International) for College of Science. Eleni Mangina is guided by her own definition of the art of persistence, that involves both courage and compassion with research integrity and authenticity. Her lab operates at the intersection between applied Artificial Intelligence (VR/AR; Data Analytics; UAVs; Information Systems) and a portfolio development within interdisciplinary applications (i.e. Energy Sector and Educational Systems with XR).

Eleni Mangina has extensive experience for the last 20 years in National, EU and International funded projects and she is project coordinator of two (2) H2020 projects (ARETE & AHA), one (1) Erasmus+KA2 (FANTASIA) and partner within other H2020 projects (i.e. iSEED) and three (3) Erasmus+ projects (XRforPed, BASE, RoboPisces). She is funded investigator as part of SFI Energy Systems Integration Partnership Programme (ESIPP), NEXSYS and academic supervisor for two (2) SFI Centres for Research Training (CRT) (Machine Learning – ML-Labs; Digitally-Enhanced Reality – D-REAL).

She has authored more than 200 peer-reviewed articles in national and international peer reviewed workshops and conferences and international journals, including in IEEE and ACM. Eleni Mangina also contributes as a committee member for reviews to many international conferences and journals. Eleni Mangina also contributes actively to IEEE Standards and is the Executive Editor for the publications of the IEEE Global Initiative on XR Ethics. She is currently the Chair of Athena SWAN Bronze Award application for the School of Computer Science.

talk_description:
The
scope of this presentation is the exploration of ethics-related issues to support the development, design, and
deployment of XR applications in education and the aim is to initiate expert-driven, multidiscipline analysis
of the evolving XR Ethics requirements, with a vision to propose solutions, technologies, and standards in future updates. The set of recommendations within this report will hopefully contribute to industry
conceptualisation of socio-technological issues, highlight concreted recommendations, and lay the
groundwork for future technical-standardisation activities.

Reference will be made to our CEN Workshop on the 9th of September 2022:

events.session_title: Findings on the Effectiveness of XR for Education

post.post_content: I am an Assistant Professor in the College of Education, at the University of Florida and have experience of developing technologies with autistic, and underserved groups, which started in my undergraduate work exploring multimedia programs for a deaf community in the U.K. I am currently interested in examining and developing the role that VR HMDs can play in supporting young people with autism in their daily lives; informed by their input. The aim of my work is to co-design the future of this field (VR and autism) with autistic communities and other important stakeholders. More than this, I am also interested in developing a range of innovative technologies that can help to enable people with neuro-diversity.

John Collins a.k.a. The Paper Airplane Guy held the world record holder for paper airplane distance for ten years. Author of five books of original designs, John has been called the world’s foremost expert on paper aircraft. He has appeared on Conan, Nat Geo, Discovery, Science Channel, ESPN’s Sports Science, Ripley’s Believe It or Not, as well as performing live for TedX Munich, Google Zeitgeist, WIRED 21, Harvard’s Graduate School of Design, and more than 90 in-person presentations per year.

Mr. Gappelberg is an accomplished entrepreneur with an expertise in creating, funding and running start-ups, as well as extensive experience both as a hands-on operating executive and as a public markets professional.

From 2000 to 2005, Mr. Gappelberg was the co-founder and CEO of EG Products where he funded, patented, imported and distributed the market’s first LED light-up toy. He secured license deals from Disney, Universal Studios, Clear Channel Communication and built a national sales channel, setting the foundation to land contracts with Walgreen\'s, Macy’s, and live event shows like Ringling Bros.

He was also co-founder and CEO of an app development company which created and published over 200 successful apps for both Apples iTunes store and the Google Play store. Prior to being a successful entrepreneur, Mr. Gappelberg worked on Wall Street and has more than 20 years of extensive experience as both a hedge fund manager and Senior Vice President of Finance.

In 2018, he founded Nextech AR Solutions and is the current CEO of the Company.

post.post_content: Ashley Crowder is the co-Founder and CEO of VNTANA, a SaaS platform that makes 3D asset management and distribution incredibly easy via the industry’s only fully automated 3D optimization and content management platform. She has worked in the 3D/AR/VR space for over 10 years helping Fortune 1000 brands including Adidas, Hugo Boss, Decker’s Brands and more launch 3D applications to increase sales and speed up time to market. She has 14 patents on mixed reality technology and is a part of the Khronos Group to create standards in 3D technology. Ashley was featured as one of USC’s leading engineering CEOs of 2016 and has given talks on the future of mixed reality at prestigious venues including SXSW, Augmented World Expo, TEDx, World Economic Forum and more. Tom Ffiske writes about immersive technologies at the Immersive Wire, a newsletter and website dedicated to all things VR, AR, and the metaverse. His goal is to bring a curated digest of the analysis that matters, helping professionals interested in immersive to reach new heights.

Tom has written about the industry since 2016, covering the latest trends and investments while keeping a pulse on the latest innovations. He has spoken in several events, published a bestselling book on the sector, and help connect professionals to help each other soar.
